Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Singapore Sling cocktail
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lost Melody cocktail

iUTYXzLCzo-93UtoPO6M1A.text: My wife and I came here for our 26th anniversary dinner, while stating at the hotel, and the experience the staff of Blue Hound provided ranked this dinner among the top three of my life! Through out the staff at Blue Hound was attentive and professional, but also gave us our space. We were seated against a window with views of Phoenix skyline and the old court building, On our table was a card congratulating us on our anniversary signed by several people on the staff (one wishing us Happy Birthday - my wife's favorite).  We started with cocktails and at the waiter's suggestion I had a Lawless (Bourbon, homemade bitters and liqueur and served in a glass that was presented upside down over smoldering tobacco smoke). It was sweeter than I expected but very balanced. My wife enjoyed the Romeo & Violette, choosing only based on the name of the drink. Her drink was not as sweet as I expected but similarly balanced.  For dinner we both had the Chef and Bar Geek out for $48.00 each. This was four courses, of which three were served with cocktails and none were on the menu. The manager, mixologist, sous chef, and chef each visited our table several times. They started by asking for preferences and allergies (non) and then explained each cocktail and course.   The first course did not have a cocktail and was a cod served with olive oil, fennel and other ingredients the four cocktails now have me forgetting. The dish was mild with tangs from the fennel and spices. I remember thinking that I'd never have order this on a menu based on the description (I need to broaden my horizons), but it was amazing!  The second course came out after we were presented with a watermelon flavored and vodka based cocktail served with the foam of egg whites on top. We were guessing what the course might be based on the drink, but didn't come close. The second course was soft shelled crab on a bed of local sweet corn. We had never had soft shelled crab before so the waiter explained that we did not need to remove the shell, but could just enjoy it all. I enjoy crab, so I'm not sure why I've never had soft shelled crab. All together it was delicious again and also something I'd never have considered reading on a menu.   The third course came out after we were presented with a cocktail based on the house mulled wine topped with egg whites. It was a heavy and spicy drink (and amazing) so we were predicting beef or pork for the next course. The third course was pork belly topped by a poached egg and served on a chorizo aioli with Mexican spiced corn cut off the cob and a Blue Hound tater tot. I  was glad to see the tater tot, having read about Blue Hound's tater tots here, but my wife never would have ordered it. . In fact, it is here where I am relying on pictures and the third cocktail makes it a little fuzzy. Just the same, it was also amazing and we were stuffed at the end (yeah, we could have stopped and not eaten it all, but that was neigh impossible).   Prior the fourth course we were presented with an espresso-based cold cocktail that had us guessing chocolate. The desert came after we had had time to let the prior three courses settle over conversation; not so soon as to rush us but not so late as to have us looking for the waiter. Desert was the only course where we received different dishes. I was given a pineapple upside down cake under medjool ice cream with salted carmel sauce (this was the only item of the evening that I later saw on the menu). My wife was given some sort of flour-less chocolate cake with a salted carmel sauce and ... well, I forget the rest. The pineapple upside down cake was just so good. She ate half of my desert and we both had far more than we should have. We both liked her desert, but the pineapple upside-down cake with the carmel and ice cream what just right.   The dinner came in under $200 for the two of us including tip. To be honest, I'd expected it to cost far more and, considering the quantity and quality of food and service we received, the price was a bargain. Blue Hound will definitely have us looking for excuses to come downtown again. I was happy we were staying at the Palomar so the right "home" was just an elevator ride. To do even just the three cocktails (ha! even just!) that came with the "geek out" experience I would definitely need a taxi or designated driver home. Thankfully the Hotel Palomar has fantastic summer rates and a room was less than the price of a car or taxi.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mulled wine based cocktail that came with the third course of &#34;Chef &amp; Bar Squad Geek Out&#34;. Go for it!

O5Vlwqz9d0JQ6u0C_mrkIA.text: The experience started off well enough, but it then became really frustrating. I enjoyed a happy hour drink with a snack, tasty, at the bar and had a nice positive, service experience. The staff at the bar had expanded when I decided that I was too tired to head elsewhere for a full meal. My new server became a serious downer. After being ignored for a while, I grabbed his attention and asked about specials for the evening. There were none, but for any other server, that question would have been an indicator that this particular customer was highly serious about ordering dinner. No, apparently not.   This guy went around and paid attentive service to every male at the bar, getting drinks, following up with proactive questions about whether they would like to order dinner, asking how their, insert food/drink here, were. Unlike me, these people were not clutching their menus. The bartender closed them out while I sat. It was unbelievable. All the while, I'm there with the darn menu, giving the look, and hoping to order.   After the various male patrons left for their dinners elsewhere or finished their drinks, he turned to me. I ordered some dinner. I was furious. The ONLY reason I stayed was that I had had a busy day and hadn't had a chance to eat lunch. I was really hungry. Going elsewhere would have taken too long. By the time my food arrived, and the, more with it bartender, asked the obligatory questions, all I could offer were clipped responses while thinking, "get me out of here. I deserve better." I choked down the meal, paid, and left.   Here's what I'll say. Women travel. Women need to eat. Women sit at the bar to do those things, eat, drink, and relax, like any other travelers. Don't make us second class citizens.  My experience might have been due to one server's unconscious bias, but it sucked and it colored an otherwise positive experience.

UJfEMttrkx8FkCE9fJbHRQ.text: We had a little difficulty find the restaurant.  Once we did, I was very impressed by the layout and decor. We sat at a table against the wall in the bar area. There was a long table between us and the bar where a 40 y/o was celebrating her birthday. It would have been nicer if they were in the corner of the room instead of the center as they were quite loud.  The birthday girl was very loud every time she opened a present. I guess some people just need attention. Ok, back to the review, our food was delicious and our server Adam D. was great. It would have been better if we were able to hear each other at our table instead of being drowned out by the party.

FqxVhq7aGJad_zT3nYK2rA.text: In general I was a bit disappointed dispite the friendly service. Went for anniversary ,nice atmosphere but thought homemade pasta was dry and bland.  Limited menu and over priced food. This place is more suited for happy hour and group events rather than a quite dinner.

RFy6nLVXWujCFCAGqPOy-w.text: First impression of this place was great. Interior was really trendy and the social aspect of it could be heard from right off the elevator. Our waitress was a bit rude and cut us off when we were speaking to her. Her attitude really overshadowed the experience we were anticipating. The pasta portions were small, and even smaller when you saw how much you were paying for it. The drinks were delicious. I got the Buffalo Dusk drink and would definitely get it again. Nothing "wowed" me out of the food we purchased except for the chocolate dessert. We purchased a few appetizers and split them but nothing really stood out to me. The two that are pictured are the Roasted Cauliflower and the Spiced Chicharrones. The atmosphere was the most impressive thing out of the restaurant.

5arpsotjsND7kmxxKIEmBw.text: This was a highly recommended restaurant from the hosts of a conference I was attending. It was absolutely classy and amazing. The menu of prohibition era cocktails was out of this world and our waitress was throughly knowledgeable about all of them. The roasted cauliflower was amazingly good. I also had the blackened salmon which was great. My co-worker loved the wedge salad (looked so good!) and she raved about the shrimp and grits. Additionally, the hostess was so very nice and greeted us with a warm welcome and conversation. Lastly, the decor and ambiance are incredibly warm and classic. A must try for all!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

RF_QHTwa1JH8_yjGDBSr_A.text: Phoenix, you "speak-easy" our language! This was our second and final "sip and nosh" place for the evening. I knew I wanted to try this place out so I purposely told hubby to save room for our next small plate dinner. I couldn't quite tell from the photos what kind of food it offered but figured we would find something to fill our bellies.   Let me start off by saying the name (Blue Hound Kitchen) doesn't do justice to its classy, posh, swanky, speakeasy like, cozy bar/restaurant. I mean, yeah I applaud the Blue Hounds which greet patrons here and there (pictures are a must!) but the place is so much more than that!  Lucky for us, it was a Sunday night and we had no problems walking (I mean sauntering) in to a nearly open seat bar. I can imagine on a weeknight it would be packed with the downtowners loosening the tie and tossing back some cocktails after work.   We truly enjoy watching our bartenders work their magic while crafting cocktails. Hubby enjoyed the Lawless cocktail ($13) finished off with a tobacco smoke. I opted for the Air Mail ($12) which was light and refreshing. As I gazed over the menu, I immediately spied the Corn Grit Fries (how can anyone resist smoked bacon, white cheddar and Pomodoro sauce) and hubby picked the Deviled Eggs. I must have been hiding under a rock when deviled eggs became a huge appetizer. Even though we just had them at our last restaurant, they never taste the same no matter where you go! These were good but not raving over them. Those Grit Fries are what we raved over. So interesting and awesome. Definitely recommend!  We left happy and blue. Happy, we had a great time but a bit blue that our time in Phoenix was too short. Definitely would like to explore more of this place (and city) next time we're here! It's no joke that Phoenix is HOT, HOT, HOT...temperature and dining/bar scene!

V0OxRRntAdHhgV_KVhU7-g.text: Came here Sunday night after a long drive back home. Decided to stop here for dinner. We ordered the lamb and grouper. At first food came out fairly decent. Slowly enjoying my dinner with my partner talking away. After a few bites into my fish it was undercooked. Told our server. Waited while for them to remake my dinner (grouper) fish my partner had already finish the lamb as I waited. My remake of the grouper finally came. I took a few bites and the fish was undercooked again. This time was rawer than before. I would think they would be more careful on the 2nd try. Told our server to send it back and didn't want anything to replace it. No management ever came to say anything. Server offer dessert. Which was good.  But overall ended up leaving not  getting to enjoy my dinner.

fkxRRgCb6kleC9DNlAks1Q.text: 1st time here & can't wait to come back! Came in for a good strong cocktail and some tasty shared food at the bar before going to City Skate last weekend. I'm so impressed with the Wiskey drinks and food at the Blue Hound. The Nutella aged Wiskey in their own barrel baby

I_V_RznyjDecMLqsrEZKJA.text: What a perfect date place! I didn't realize from the pictures how intimate it actually is.    Make sure to call ahead for reservations! I made one the morning of and the earliest I could get a table for two was at 9pm.   The service was amazing, and the drinks were even better. I had some kind of Rose infused gin drink, I can't find the name of it, but it was fantastic. All of the drinks from the menu sounded wonderful, I can't wait to try more.   For dinner I had Roast Chicken with veggies. The skin on the chicken was so crispy I LOVE crispy chicken skin. My date had the fried catfish. Definitely recommend both.   The only thing is I wish bread was included with the meal! It was $12 off the appetizer menu, and I couldn't get myself to splurge for it. I also wish the dessert menu was a little bit more variable. I was in the mood for dessert, but none of them were doing it for me unfortunately.   But would love to come back! It's a great experience overall!

V-dUhSDbV-8ikSvPJkHzfg.text: Came here for a cocktail week event and was treated amazingly by the super friendly staff. The place is gorgeous, the decor ,the bar the seating and waiting areas are great. The event had us try some of their drinks that were good and and we tried their brunch. The French toast the quiche was good but the bacon was to die for the thick peppered one specially. The place is every bit as cool as everyone says it is. I'm dying to go back and try their dinner and also sit on the bar and try some their drinks of their cockatil menu. Fun place in the middle of downtown phx and I really enjoyed my visit and look forwars to many more.

HD7-I3M2H1770_C9BqmXVQ.text: Horrible. Service was not good at all. I went with a group of friend who's we're staying in the hotel and our order took forever to come out. I got a Caesar salad along with some of my other friends, and it tasted horrible. We also were sick the rest of the night. I will not be going here again.

6brE7C4gOKgDzYfiu3QQEA.text: I was here for a private event so I cant really review their menu but I must say that even tho the event was hosted by a third party, their staff was really friendly. The place has high ceilings and feels really open which i really liked.

fj4zZorggctoyhnYmx099A.text: Everything was absolute perfection. We came in with 5 people for our reservation early and they sat us as soon as they could. The restaurant itself has wonderful atmosphere. We started with drinks, great drink menu, very creative. For appetizers we had the flatbread which was just okay and the fried polenta (you can definitely do without this)....the entrees were AMAZING. We tried a little of everything. Pork shank, Brussel sprouts, salmon, rainbow trout, fried green tomatoes & the shrimp and grits!  My favorite was the Brussels and the rainbow trout. We also tried the pineapple upside down cake, HOW IS IT SO DELICIOUS.   Great service too. Come here, tell your friends about it.

7pmijrHOp_HnwY9h4lmq0Q.text: Not my first choice. Way over-priced! The charcuterie plate was awesome, but my quinoa and veggies were bland. The patio was neat though and I loved the lounge inside. Prob would go back but just for drinks.

RjRU85I-VgobCZJbxYLv0w.text: Few places have captivated me as much as Blue Hound Kitchen & Cocktails, in Phoenix. Between their unique menu, amazing drinks, and warm atmosphere, I knew I HAD to make a stop while on my trip. This place is pulsing with creativity. Make sure to stop in if you ever are in the area.

C737iechLmaE1qL7A37CGQ.text: Came here with my husband and in-laws last month, and it was spectacular. Their cocktails were delicious and we each ended up ordering two and sharing because we liked everyone else's drinks too. My MIL and I both got the shrimp and grits and let me tell you, it satisfied every comfort food bone in my body. It was delicious.  The FIL and my husband both got the pork shank? And both thought it was good, but they like us girls' shrimp and grits more;) there was just a lot of rice and was a little dry.   And the appetizers! Almost forgot those. We got the ahi tuna thing, and it was so good. But in my opinion it wasn't the tuna that was the star of this dish, it was the fried chickpeas they had on the side.  Holy moly- I need that recipe.   Anyway- totally recommend this place

7RgOVlW4Y1MxtzFCvZLAKg.text: Our server, Gemma, was spectacular! Our group of eight felt completely at home and she went beyond any limits to make sure our experience was exceptional. Welcome to the best of downtown Phoenix!

clYJd-CnxQCnm0JJq7Q0qA.text: BEST PORK CHOP EVER! My only complaint would be that it was served with an arugula salad of mixed greens and was way too salty tasting.  There was no contrast in flavors... if you are going to cook with salt, it has to be balanced with another sense like sweet or heat... have already been raving to folks about your place.

oBawROe-muyfhHTeOdN9Mg.text: Took too long to come back but oh so happy I did.  Ok, I admit that I shamelessly enjoy the valet parking at the Palomar option (only $5 with validation from restaurant) so that's a good start.  The seating at the Blue Hound is comfy and doesn't feel crowded.  The cocktails are always interesting- I had a War of the Roses, yum!  The food was delicious too.  We had the flatbread special of the day with green chiles and pulled pork. Very good. And the chicken bites were fantastic.  Also shared the burrata and it was great.  Overall totally tasty and fun!!

6VNB03zA4U_9rmjrBrMxuA.text: Well, I knew it was not going to be good when it took three people to get us to our friends inside the tiny little place.     Pretty sure this is the place, oh wait, a sign.   Entrance to Blue Hound is that way.    OK cool.   Go that way.   Met up with a hostess, we said who we were meeting, nope, not here, you want to walk all the way down to the blue stairs.     Okay, cool.   So we go past the first doors with the sign and could not find any blue stairs.   Go back to the original hostess station,  give the party name, she says oh yes and takes us back to the blue stair girl.  Who seemed VERY confused the first time.   This new hostess says this girl will help you.  No, no she won't she sent me to some fictional blue stairs.   What is your party again?   I say it again.   Nope.  Whip out my phone to call my friends just as hostess number two says "ohhhhhhh xxxx"  YES.  The SAME NAME I HAVE BEEN saying.   So takes me to our friends.    Yeesh.    Which by the way was not in the back where it says the entrance is.  They were RIGHT NEXT to the original hostess station.        OK cool!   Let's get drinks.  Guy comes and says that they aren't serving tables, you have to go to the bar.  Ok, cool.   VERY OVER PRICED for very little alcohol.   Very few mixers, no redbull for instance.    Ordered food, ham sandwich and 4 shrimp.   VERY OVER PRICED for very little food.     NO service at our table, had to hunt the check down.   THEN the confused hostess tried to tell us there was a 200.00 table minimum.     Blue Hound you suck.  Out loud.  Thanks for putting everyone in a bad mood before a comedy show.  NEVER AGAIN.

YNa0VXHEqfGulY6XLDDKqw.text: Came in again tonight for my wife's birthday and it was an incredible experience overall. Shrimp and grits are off the hook and they had a special scallop dish with grits tonight. Best scallop dish I've had in my life. Great dessert, awesome service, refreshing drinks. So good. A little pricey, but totally worth it. Get the scallop dish if they have it on special. Amazing meal, thank you Blue Hound!

M8Exf3bjK-V9XkKzrTbe9A.text: Great dinner of sides like frites, corn, ceasar salad and noble bread with delicious cocktails and great service!

wMTQC9WNvIdB7KQ86PIpzQ.text: I used to be a big fan of this restaurant especially for their drinks. I know they changed their menu (and most likely chef) a while ago. The drinks used to be creative and delicious. I went there before a concert to get drinks and a few small snacks. The first thing I ordered was the beef carpaccio. This is one of my favorite dishes to order whenever I see it on the menu. When it arrived it was one tiny tiny piece of meat with a few super thin chips and one bite of arugula salad. An absolute rip off. We also ordered some bread which came with 3 tiny pieces and a horrible sauce on the plate.  The drinks ($15.00 a piece) were tasteless and watered down. I don't know what happened to this place but I will not be going back. The only reason for 2 starts is because the server was so nice.

xkSyr0DqfWZ4JBZ1O3Dh4w.text: The restaurant is in the Palomar hotel and a bit difficult to see from the street.  They offer validation for 2 hours of parking in the public parking which is helpful.  The location is downtown and close to the Comerica Theater which is where we were going after dinner.   I had the iceberg salad which was very good.  For the entree I had the Arctic Char which was good but not great.  From watching the surrounding tables, it appeared that the happy hour appetizers might have been the way to go.  They have outdoor seating with a fireplace which would be nice when the weather is cooler.  It's convenient in the downtown area but not particularly special.

cJaLZcRvFQLbu0q9SpxszA.text: We came here for a late night dinner and quite enjoyed ourselves.  The restaurant was only about 2/3 full but it was very loud and the atmosphere was a mix of people like us dressed casually and people dolled up.  By the time we left, however, it was pretty empty.    We had a bit of a hard time ordering, and the weird thing was the huge variance in the portion sizes.  For four of us we ordered the bottomless popcorn, the large BBQ'd Kobe beef short rib, the tater tots, Dinasaur kale salad, roasted cauliflower, a special flatbred, the large jerk cured fish.  We also had a heirlooms tomato salad that the waiter gave us because someone had messed up an order.  Everything was actually really tasty, but the beef short ribs dominated the meal in terms of portion size while the tater tots and the fish were really tiny in size.  Food came out at a pace that wasn't rushed and allowed us to talk and enjoy ourselves.  My only other complaint was that there were a large number of things that they were out of (both on the bar menu and the food menu).  I'd definitely come back here, but I'd really rather someone else paid.

t5BHuFUKZH5WVxIHd7tQYA.text: Visited Blue Hound for the first time with a friend last night. Very cool atmosphere. Very classy. The lighting is dim and orange, offered up primarily from vintage-style Edison bulbs hung from the ceiling. Sure enough, you're met by the statue of a blue hound upon entering.  Blue Hound was busy when we arrived at around 10:00p, but we were able to find seats at the bar. Turns out, this was the best place for us to sit.  We were helped by a super competent bartender named Bobby. It was very obvious that he loved what he was doing. The drink options were super crafty and Bobby was especially knowledgable about every topic we discussed with him.  We didn't order any food, but I would love to go back and experience their food menu sometime soon.  The drinks were costly, but you definitely get what you pay for - both in quality of beverage and in quality of service. In fact, the cocktails in particular were VERY reasonably priced for the quality of what you got.  I enjoyed my time at Blue Hound - I'll definitely be back. If you haven't been, get yourself a little dressed up and go give it a shot - you won't be disappointed. Well done, Blue Hound! And thanks, Bobby, for a really nice time.  :)

l0DyQzL-ewmX9aJiYnwCcA.text: Blue Hound is fantastic!  We started of with the shishito peppers and they were DELISH!! Our main meal included the home made pasta, added some shrimp, and the pork shank with risotto!  The pasta was done al dente with a great sauce!  The pork shank was so tender we didn't even need a knife!!! Highly recommend this place before any event downtown! By the way, Lost melody drink was tasty!! Gemma did a great job and was on top of everything even though it was busy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We had multiple dishes and did everything but lick the plates clean!!

TS0o7V-BRWaO9sYTqz7N9g.text: I have always enjoyed Happy Hours with friends at Hotel Palomar's Lustre Bar so it was time to try the Blue Hound Kitchen & Cocktails. A friend that lives in Downtown Phoenix invited me this morning for breakfast and I accepted. For me, it's always fun to head downtown for a bit of 'Metro' fun -- there's nothing like the noises of downtown City life. Back to BHK&C, I love the decor and that it's located in the hotel lobby.   We decided to try the Brioche French Toast & Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. Both were tasty and portions were just right. & Coffee was delish! Service was outstanding. I look forward to an evening Dinner here. Oh my...their Happy Hour fries would be ideal right about now! Cheers***

OTMcCP2KXAVGVovgI_GePg.text: Sadly disappointed, waste of $90. My wife and I had been to Blue Hound the first few years when it opened and loved the BBQ ribs, deviled eggs and drinks. We planned to have a nice night out again and eat some of the traditional plates we had but they changed the menu and sadly disappointed in the portion sizes, lack of creativity and flavor of and in the food.   To begin the deviled eggs were nothing compared to the ones at Del Friscos. Lacked flavor and taste. My wife had the Swordfish which was good, and I had the Neiman Short Ribs - bad decision - it was mainly thin flat meat with fat and tasted bathed in salt.  When I told the waiter he looked at me as though I didn't know meat had salt and said they were "salt friendly" as though I would have changed my mind.  The manager walked over shortly after and asked how the sharing of our first dish was going instead of apologizing and asking if there was anything they could do to make the experience better.   When the next dish was brought out, Trout, it too tasted over salted but as I was too hungry I ate it and just wanted to call it a night.   I WILL NEVER GO BACK!

FYE68R3ykAlEZ56__h8vfQ.text: BEST FOOD EVER! I LOVE this place. I like their cocktails too. Just a little pricey for me but wonderful for special occasions and when you have a little extra. I never turn down the blue hound.

EFeuAug20kBdJcjrZJaIew.text: Food was pretty awesome.  "Shrimp and Grits" (5/5): Pricey (~$27), but very tasty. Husband liked it a lot and I also liked it a lot!   "Short rib sliders (4 piece)" (4/5): $14... The ribs were really tender, but I felt like it lacked something. The horseradish sauce that was supposed to be in it didn't give it the 'hit' that I needed. A friend who ordered the same dish had to dip his sliders in BBQ sauce. I thought the Hawaiian roll tasted like your typical Hawaiian roll that can be bought at WalMart in those orange packages.  "Pork Shank" (4.5/5) Very tender pork. Lots of beans. Friend liked it. Wasn't my favorite.

CXK5_Jj7JWiNO1DfVyiPSg.text: My husband and I stopped into the Blue Hound, just to check out the place while we were visiting for a concert.  After glancing around we noticed a lively crowd at the bar and decided to dine there    The bartender that greeted us was named Jesse.  He gave such great service during our time here we are excited to come back and visit soon    We husband ordered a drink called the "Charlton "  which was a smoked glass filled with great enjoyment  while I ordered the English Mule.  We were both extremely happy with our selections. Looking to order a couple bites before the concert, Jesse mentioned the Boudin Balls, mac and cheese, and ribs .    Chasing the last little bits with a delicious IPA, we were on our way to the show.  Happy to meet Jimmy and the rest of the bar, we are excited to come back during our next show.   Thank you Blue Hound  we will see you soon !!!!

b329kbdhMh_292f4-NOVJA.text: Updating my review. I was here a little over a year ago and had a terrible experience. I was contacted by the manager with an apology and as a result - I found myself walking by the same place a year later and decided to try again. So glad I did. What a difference!  I'm going to chalk up my last review to a bad day. They also changed the menu a bit and a lot of stuff that we disliked are gone.   Btw - corsair gin at the bar!  One of the best in the world!!    Thank you for a good experience.

xT6KZsAqrlYsp0j9i94dtA.text: Christmas day  Brunch  Disappointment: I must admit I was looking forward to this as I am new to the area   I have been a chef with 3 degrees in Culinary Arts.  And over 35 years in the industry.  I called to inquire about the brunch the day before  I was told their would be a waffle station  along with many other items  the cost was at 37 dollars per person. $$$$$ I thought this to be reasonable  as it was Christmas morning. Our reservation was for 11:15 AM   we arrived on time. The  employees were pleasant.  The restaurant  was for the most part empty.  We walked over to the buffet  the items included scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, and fried potatoes, cold smoked salmon, bagels, Danish, and sliced assorted fruit,  a hot continental breakfast at best. Their was no waffle station  no omelette station as I was told there would be when I called the restaurant the day before. No lunch items at all   so I could not understand why they billed this as a brunch when it should have been billed as just a breakfast//  Needless to say that for over $120 dollars for a party of three,  we were quite disappointed.

fNw0YBxH3h5L3255LjP0rg.text: The Blue Hound... This has quickly become my go-to spot for cocktails and appetizers. Everything is meticulously on point and delivered with efficiency and grace. This would be an excellent start (or end) to any romantic evening. Just be sure to make reservations well in advance if you plan on sitting on the patio. It fills up fast.   The Kimchi pork belly sliders are absolutely to die for and pair excellently with a smoky martini with a twist of lemon.   Featuring fare for all manner of diets, be it vegan, paleo, gluten free and the like, this place is without a doubt a crowd-winning example of haute cuisine. We Phoenicians are proud.

HF1RC4R8bgdjA7xCoa-TSw.text: Cool ambience! Deviled eggs and flatbreads are tasty, along with the strawberry trifle dessert.

OIkHmgxdn-Oo9qzYCzpR7w.text: Excellent food and drinks. The shrimp and grits is a must. Definitely a good place all around. The atmosphere and staff wonderful

pdg45YBnXg6AnFeAbPs4Lg.text: I visited the Blue Hound Kitchen during my late June visit to Phoenix.  Amazing FOOD and drinks.  The deviled farm eggs and the Prime flat iron are winners all day!  Look forward to trying other dishes when I find myself back in Arizona...    I was moved to write this review because when I reached out to the Blue Hound Kitchen to receive a copy of my receipt, the Kimpton ... Taylor Case, Restaurant Ambassador ... to be specific, not only responded to me in a timely manner, but also attached a copy of the receipt to the email.  Very much appreciated and matched what I have experienced at other Kimptons and my time dining at Blue Hound Kitchen.  So if you visit Phoenix, check both places out ... Blue Hound and the Kimpton!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yum yum flat iron steak

gqKF2h7b2r55QfFNZptcTg.text: The blended burger was the Best I have ever had!  Very tasty and moist!! YUM!

p5OMWdElwiwBgpfMViA_9Q.text: I chose this restaurant for my son's 23rd birthday celebration. From the call for a reservation to the time we left, every interaction was absolutely perfect. The service, beautiful cocktails and food were all absolutely wonderful. I can't wait to come back for happy hour!!!

ComYhE707AIWwbOMfqJ2RA.text: Deviled eggs: Delicious, Fried Green Tomatoes: Amazing, Ahi Tuna: Very Good, Chocolate Pudding: Seriously Fantastic, Chocolate Cake: Not so good, kind of dry. Overall: Great place

XOzeNjT-w-QFJxiqElADWg.text: Went there for my birthday. Couldn't have been better.   Atmosphere: cool and smooth, industrial and warm wood.   Friendly service: prompt and with a smile. I asked for the bartender to order me a drink based on my meal and preferences and his selection was perfect   Food was great: rabbit pasta with aged Parmesan that was excellent. The oysters were like silk from the sea.   Cocktails were stellar: bartender selected The Lawless for me, and I've never enjoyed one more.   Bonus: an amazing birthday dessert and the staff signed a birthday card for me.   I'm not from Arizona but on my next visit you'll find me sipping on The Lawless at the Blue Hound.

2umYBxW8qM20X5_akecKrA.text: I was hired to handle a portion of a team building event late this afternoon on the outdoor patio at blue hound.  It was unexpectedly 98 degrees and in the sun. The "all hands on deck effort" to move umbrellas in to shade participants was handled beautifully, abd the manager and staff rocked.  Thank you blue hound.  Well done.  Excellent save. I trust this staff.

VuunuF-dBi-VYe801rtPtQ.text: The Kimpton is one our favorite hotel to stay, eat and drink when we travel. When we are in town, we usually end up downtown for events so we tend to stop by for a drink or two. At night, the place feels and looks cozy and laid back. On this night, we celebrated the year of the dog. We got 3 dots and a dash, pork shank and roasted chicken. The pork and chicken were tasty but were a little dried.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Shank, tasty but dried in the center
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted Chicken, tasty but dried
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 dots and a dash

-bpBv-VVWgAj71fBdpE2Zg.text: Love this place and by far the best place I visited in the 10 days I was in Phoenix.  Staff was on top of it with menu items and drinks. Food was excellent and exactly what they said.  Don't travel to Phoenix much but when I do I will be back. Great environment and location downtown was great for me.

KWojCpKppDEJqsOQypCccA.text: My gal and I were in the Kimpton hotel for a quick staycation and ended up going down stairs to the house restaurant, the Blue Hound, for appetizers and drinks before heading out for the night...   They changed up their deviled eggs and while they were good, they weren't as good as they once were.   The drinks were serviceable but some of the other appetizers weren't what was expected. Though they were happy hour prices the portion sizes weren't what was expected.  The bartender was nice enough and fairly engaging but she was at the end of her shift and seemed a bit distracted as she was setting up for the next guy.  We'll be back... it's good enough to visit for another round of drinks... but we'll probably end up making it one of the stops of the night vs. the place we end up at for an extended period of time.

yhZGhZJq3asQmhkG7hJSVQ.text: Cute place to visit, more in Christmas than some other Bars. Drinks were good. The guy at the door had an awesome personality greeting us on arrival, fun conversation. The Bartenders were rude, us along with guests asked about whiskey and the female stated list was too long. Other bartenders didnt smile, short answers, just rude. They actually took away from the experience and I wouldnt go back.

DFKSi_Xu_vkZ0ltgdtrH9A.text: Came here originally after reading reviews on yelp and saw the crowd because of the final four and thought we would try something else. Nothing in the area matched the decor and menu.  Lost Boy Scout was incredible with a warm roasted marshmallow on top.  Daily flatbread was a margarita style with a simple yet delicious flavor.  Our server was delightful. No complaints here.  When our check was delivered it was on top of a journal sharing our guest experiences. Unique and personal touch!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The current menu
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lost Boy Scout

kZ3pmK6Zd63OjBaBMnxa_A.text: Went to Blue Hound Kitchen just for dessert and cocktails! It's in the lobby of the beautiful Palomar Hotel at City Scape, a Kimpton Hotel.   I have been to Blue Hound a couple of times for happy hour and have not been disappointed. I was definitely not disappointed for dessert.   I had the "Lost Melody" cocktail which I have enjoyed on a previous visit. Made with pisco, coconut cream, rose flower water and a couple of other ingredients. Delicious.   For dessert I had the chocolate pudding. Served in a jar with layers of graham crackers, chocolate pudding and marshmallow fluff. Vanilla ice cream and peanuts are served on the side. Oh so good!   If you are just going for cocktails, snacks or desserts, sit in the lounge right off the lobby. Great for people watching!   Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Another Lost Melody cocktail!
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lost Melody cocktail!
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate pudding and vanilla ice cream with peanuts!

Qr8mT01nE3Y-jLgGJL8VVQ.text: I was a bit shocked at the service here. We ordered some basic drinks (rum, soda and a lime). The bartender brought it out to us without the lime but their "house lime juice". It was bitter and had a bad after taste. We told her we didn't like it and she sassed us! I was shocked. She brought us a new one, made the way we asked, and mocked as AGAIN! WOW! We were shocked. Beyond being sassed, it took 25 minutes to get the drinks and there were only 2 other tables occupied in the whole place. If you go, hope you have better luck......

vY7F2TQ-PCZPpeMrGfI-8g.text: Went recently to celebrate my 35th birthday with my twin sister and my folks.  We were all thoroughly impressed!! I get nervous taking my dad to new places. He's kinda old school and simple and trendy food isn't really his thing. But he gave it two thumbs up and 5 stars!  He and my mother both got the chicken dish. I was able to steal a bite and I know what I'm getting next time now!  My sister and I shared the melt in your mouth steak entree. And also shared a few small plates.  I could of done without the fried green tomatoes. They were just kinda plain and the crab was fishy.  We also shared the Brussel sprouts. A must! Even tho our bowl was mostly pork belly and very few Brussels, but seems like a tough thing to complain about.  I will definitely be returning.  Ambience is rustic and trendy. Kind of loud. And our server was great, but she didn't seem present in the moments with us as she seemed overly busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

d9EYvbWDe4LSl18AI8WYJw.text: Went back again for another wonderful meal and service and was not disappointed. Getting to be one of our favorites. Our waitress Melissa was spectacular

uCnLA4RXFWlDU6DOOB2_xA.text: Stopped by here for a business meeting/lunch. Parking was a bit hard, but doable.   Food was great and drinks were awesome. Service was fast, attentive, and authentic.   Trendy cool place to go, definitely a worth while when in the area.

RJYlUkENXSSW2ZxF5qPHLQ.text: Happy New Years 2016!!!   This place was my New Years dinner and I don't have too many complaints.  Thank goodness.   Blue Hound's American fare was great food and Great ambiance mixed into one.   Got there at 700pm and front desk gal said it would be 5 minutes. It was 15 minutes later and no reasoning why a bit later, but hey it's New Years so I just carried on through with a smile.   Ambiance is superb with bar seating, nice bar and seating deeper inside that had nice window views of downtown Phoenix. There were also picnic table seating outside but it's way too cold for that on Jan 1st !   I wanted something light so I got the handmade pasta with marinara , parm, basil , garlic and onions. The noodles were like angel hair and can totally tell they were house made. Sauce was pretty good though it tasted more on the ketchup side than the marinara side. Overall it was nice presentable dish with great noodles and overall great flavors.  Would I get it again ? Probably not.   Menu is fairly small , but it makes picking something easier.  Guy next to me said his meal was "average." I felt the same way ...it was good but not something to talk about. The ambiance made up for it.   If you are in the area looking for a fancy good plate and great ambiance , come check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Home made pasta , marinara,  onions, garlic and basil
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Trout
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. View of downtown - sweet seating

f1JJj9jVUtsMCtXXPDjhkQ.text: I came into town for work and stayed at the Kimpton which is a great hotel. The blue Hound is part of the hotel. I ordered the pork shank and it came out looking amazing. Great presentation but when I took a bite it was so dry and had no real flavor. I couldn't even finish it. I had some of colleagues dishes and there's all tasted great.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mPSWMBtVe4hfuuB93YGzgg.text: Amazing cocktails!! Great staff!! Really cool atmosphere, that's not over done, will be back!!

BfJqUALtEkgfKk2jyoT9Gw.text: Disappointed on so many levels.  Came here with a friend before a show at Talking Stick. Made a reservation online the night before, they had an issue finding it and hassled me a little bit until they did.  Here's the jist: this place is really overpriced for the below average quality of food, drink and service you get.  We ordered 2 starters, steak and several sides to share. Also got several cocktails.  The food is bland, tastes like it was heated in a microwave and the steak was not worth the $35 price tag.  The Mac and Cheese was dry and chalky tasting. I ordered a dirty martini and there was no dirt to it. Asked for a side of olive juice to add to it, and they brought me about a teaspoons worth of it.  Cheap!  The arm on my wooden chair was actually falling off and we had to keep asking for water refills.  Save yourself the coin and go somewhere where you get your money's worth.

J_lU8sfrF2p_fI-RHcUPCg.text: Ate at theBlue Hound Kitchen last night with some our neighbors and friends prior to the comedy club and the Cocktails and Food  was amazing!! Pork Shank was out of this world huge portion so brought it home and made hash with the leftovers for breakfast the next morning and it was crazy good! Highly recommend

kLm9epKmkcYaJYLkxLOKTw.text: We stopped here for lunch before returning our rental car just a short drive away.   We were unsure of where to park, but we were pleasantly surprised that the parking garage elevator took us right to this place !     I LOVED the atmosphere --comfy booths, wood and metal--I felt sheik.   I was a little worried about being underdressed but everyone else had jeans on too.     The food was the best part!!    Amazing burger--juicy and flavorful---accompanied the hand cut crispy fries.   I tried the Hound Beer and it went perfectly with the burger.   My spouse had the fish tacos and he claims they are the best he has ever had!   Big chunks of white fish filled a bowl and he was able to create his own tacos with cabbage salsa and guacamole.   I didn't love the wait staff.    The place was nearly empty and they claimed that there was only one table not reserved.     None of the reservations showed by the time we left.   I almost felt that I was bothering them by being there.   Overall this is a place to try--especially on days you are looking for a a classic burger and beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burger
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish tacos
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar Area

nqXPDXucLJzG4_lCyjHDPQ.text: This was such a good idea to come to. The food was amazing and the service is amazing! This was my first time in Arizona and this definitely made up for the first restaurant(the kettle black)  I went into tonight.

tecTln6wsjv16gPnYMceLA.text: Recently went here for dinner on a trip to Phoenix! The cocktail menu is extensive and all of them were really good. You need to try the War of the Roses! We ordered the Peppers, Kale Salad, and Seared Tuna. Perfect for sharing and all great.

KKjfUMZDnPmkXhdEgQPVJQ.text: What a major disappointment this was tonight.  Being Sun's season ticket holders for years, we have been going here for a couple of years regularly.  Tonight will be the last. The menu changed, the ambiance, the bar, the crowd...the kitchen, the servers. The food was ok but not much more than that. The bar scene:  no more happy hour (we were not looking for that, however, the place was quite empty for a Friday night before a Suns game) After our cocktails  (not best bartender of any year worthy)...then ordering dinner from the full menu as we always have done, I then wanted a glass of pinot with dinner,  and my only option was Belle Glos at $22 a glass..the one and only option for a pinot...I passed on the wine (out of principle)  my significant other then ordered an IPA...they were out of IPA and comped him a can of beer...Really? Enough said, we are home now and writing this while having my Belle Glos at home. Best of Luck to You in 2019..you will need it.

-Z4bQpmM8JIu3hvwwwXC_A.text: Expensive for an OK experience.  It's almost like they are trying to hard to appear hip that they forget what they are providing.  The drink I had was good but the food, passable at best.

eFxOHoMZLi0OiSRUGJCxVw.text: First night in Phoenix was spent at the Blue Hound. Great wine selection and cocktail menu: I tried a red from Oregon and hubby had a daiquiri. Food was great, for starters we got some amazing high-end tater tots, two words: harissa sauce. I had a flatbread with olives, grapes, peppers and feta for my main course (which I enjoyed so much that I tried to replicate it once I flew back home) and hubby had the pork belly, which came in a cast-iron dish. We were so full that we skipped dessert, but the menu looked promising.  Service was attentive and pleasant and I really enjoyed the modern, pub-like atmosphere.

YRlYOsiKxAgheYuURnhtBA.text: Mixed reviews- great drinks and super convenient to the Palomar hotel, but food was so-so. My bone in bass was marginal, but my husband's Kobe beef rib was spectacular! My daughter-in-law struggled through a bone in salmon steak that was not worth the trouble or the money. Dessert was amazing and we were delighted with the extensive after dinner drink options. We would try it again but I would steer clear of the fish next time the restaurant was basically empty but they were out of 2 of the main courses. Room for improvement but good.

lSnto43oOSHeAySG1Fg0gQ.text: We came to this place for our friends birthday dinner Thursday. I was seriously under dressed! but  nobody seemed to mind. The first thing I noticed was this cute coffee table in the lobby area. We sat there and enjoyed some really tasty water, yes water. So good!  Our friends arrived and we moved on to our reserved table. The server was really nice and very helpful with our orders. We had the Mini Harris Ranch Patty Melt ($10.00 small order) they were really good! I drank beer, it was a little warm for my liking. I like ice cold beer, but that's okay. Since we had a medium size group we sampled each others mixed drinks. I really enjoyed every single one of those drinks, they ranged from a really smooth relaxing drink to some with a little more kick. All had just the right amount of alcohol, so you weren't over powered by alcohol. I glanced over to the kitchen and was pleased to see a really clean kitchen area. The chefs looked like they really enjoyed their work. At the end of our evening we were so pleasantly surprised that our birthday girl was given a Pineapple Upside down cake with a lit candle on it, and a birthday card signed by all the chefs and servers. That was such a sweet touch. We will definitely be back here again.  Thumbs up guys, great work!

ntH63IrcUOP5PlMuDyYGzQ.text: This is a great place to go for a cocktail. They have so many unique drinks that you will not find at other bars. I have never eaten dinner/lunch here but have had many drinks...some were fantastic, while others were a little too crazy for me. I love the "Summer Smash", very refreshing and bonus...it was only $5.00! The popcorn is yummy; spicy and sweet! The french fries are good too! The outdoor bar overlooks the stadium and is a nice relaxing spot to hang out.

qwOGt11rhRICuXCVw0uZLQ.text: We were very underwelmed. I had reserveration @ 7pm for 4, were seated and waited 20 minutes before someone came over and served us water and said I'll be back to get your drink order.  Another 5 minutes the assistant manager came over and started apologizing that someone would help us soon.  My husband was getting upset so she just ran got a pen and took our drink orders.  We ordered our food which was ok, we did have the couple appetizier then short ribs (good) but our califlower came out 10 minutes after we were served our ribs. Wouldn't recommend, wouldn't go back.  This was our second visit, the first time was much better.

vNazfFCdXHWeuQHCLg87lQ.text: What a venue!  The atmosphere is amazing, loud and fun.  The decor is unique, contemporary goth.  And the food!  Cocktails were fabulous and unusual, the appetizers scrumptious, and the meal was memorable.  (and I'm picky!)  Don't walk, RUN downtown as fast as possible!

uztKQi5dMtv0eOGtSaslqw.text: I was excited to go here for restaurant week. HOWEVER: The portions of meat were zapped with a shrinking gun. So tiny; no bigger than my palm. The food was delicious, but I weigh 100 lbs and I left hungry. Don't waste your money like I did.

ZS8UASFm0PpNvBn9CJguaQ.text: A friend and I and our daughters were attending an event downtown and decided to try this. Brunch was all they were serving so my friend and I ordered the Spanish omelette. We split it because we were told the portions were big. They are plenty big, but we didn't even finish it because it lacked  flavor. Neither one of us cared for it. The kids wanted corn dogs and when they were eating them we discovered that they were not fully cooked. The batter was raw all around the corn dogs. My friend and I also ordered bloody Mary's. I had 3 small sips and could not even choke any more down. It only came garnished with a lime wedge, and the flavor made me feel a little nauseous. My friend thinks there was a lot of garlic in it.......we did complain about the corn dogs and they apologized and took it off our bill and offered us free desert. We did not take them up on it, we just decided we would call it quits. Would not recommend this place.

XgpQjh25KxOjDs_3ts1Zpg.text: I wanted to find a neat place downtown for a friends 30th birthday. I used Yelp's "New and Hot" search in the area and found Blue Hound Kitchen. I liked the menu and location so decided to try as the ratings were good. I was beyond impressed. I have eaten all over the world and in extremely nice restaurants but Blue Hound Kitchen's service was out-of-this-world. I had booked the reservations for 5 through opentable and made a little note about the birthday. They called to confirm and when I spoke about the birthday and dessert possibilities she was very accomodating. I had mentioned also my friend was gluten and dairy free. Upon arriving the staff had not only pulled a menu and highlighted the items upon it that were gluten and dairy free for her but then also had placed a birthday card signed by the entire staff on top! They referred to her by name and really made the whole dinner seem so special! It was almost like dining with family! I was so impressed with this service and cannot even begin to thank them enough for making it such a special evening! If you have special occassions this is the place to celebrate it. The food was fun and tasty (I'm sure most of the other reviews below go into detail on that). It's right across the street from Stand Up Live also so being able to make it a full evening out is also handy. I will definitely be visiting this place again!

_IvwAI01Cuk-4SGVsvstuQ.text: very nice vibe and setting... very friendly staff and knowledgeable of the menu. four of us ordered 7 dishes plus dessert, everything to share tapas style. love the unlimited warm nuts.., the peach salad is also quite excellent. sweet and fresh. the mussels are our favorite of the night. very nice flavor, saffron adds depth and beautiful color to the dish. make sure you ask for extra bread to dip in that delicious broth! not very impressed by the scallop ceviche taco... the taco shell was too big and thick proportionally. wish there were more ceviche in the taco and had more juice in it. the Kentucky quail is okay. was imagining it to be a whole one. the pineapple upside down cake is the bomb! definitely try it!

EcGfr_BZazmQc_KHWWlmJQ.text: I get a kick out of all the hipsters here.  Their pork belly sliders were amazing!  I also enjoyed a coffee drink with whiskey.  I wish their TV over the bar was a little better so I could watch the Suns game more clearly.

MZQXyGp8dqBUjNT-3TogQw.text: Such a lovely experience! We had some fantastic recommendations from our waiter, Ryan, who not only directed me to an absolutely perfect summer cocktail (Lost Melody), but was able to arrange for an elderberry cocktail for my friend that wasn't on the menu. The appetizers were delightful - we had the cheese plate and grit fries, which were divine - and the entrees were flavorful with perfect portions. I chose the daily flatbread with cauliflower on the side, and the flatbread was perfect; the cauliflower could have had a bit more of a kick, but that's my only quibble for an otherwise stellar dining experience.

O8BL17nsSqphEQ8WfZi5JA.text: This place is great, food was good, the drinks are excellent. The peaches and cream were a great way to end the dinner. Greg at the bar was amazing with his recommendations and charming personality!

gMGGDcOtx93fQiHNbcA3fw.text: Excellent Bloody Mary's! Great service and a wonderful atmosphere. I will be back for dinner soon.

MUfOHZN21aX0E1FY23dykw.text: I have enjoyed chef Sean's cooking for years and was thrilled when he joined one of my favorite hotels in town. Both menus have been awesome. Some of my favorites are the burrata, shishito peppers and the Ham and cheese. His soups are also great. Foh staff is always attentive and knowledgable. I would 100% recommend dining here (great scene) and staying at the hotel. Excellent staff with awesome attitudes.

ETfAratWsven5z4k71ZgzA.text: Pork belly appetizer was delish! Lovin the cocktail list and their extensive whisky selection! Stopped here while passing through Phoenix on our way to "T-town" from Sedona :) Had a great trip with great food and were looking to continue that without venturing too far from the freeway. We found this using my phone and had one heck of a time trying to find out. Turns out, it is in the backside of a hotel that opens up to a little mall like area. Any parking was confusing but we ended up there and were glad we did.  Atmosphere was definitely the chic industrial trendy gatro pub thing. Service was great and food was fantastic. My hubby and I both got whisky inspired cocktails off their house cocktail list and were quite impressed.  My husband made a "joke" about the cornichon on his burger asking what they do to make them so small and the server handled his bad joke very well.  We frequently traverse through Phoenix and Scottsdale so we will be back!  If your in the area walking around, look this place up and treat yourself to some new flavors both in the food and drinks! An overall pleasant experience!   If you are driving from somewhere else.... I might find a restaurant with a parking lot...

3yu8AxeRjKKQ9Ey-g-ZrJA.text: This review is for the bar only.  Our bartender Bobby was great.  I put his skills to the test and ordered a lemondrop and a blood and sand (not on the drink menu). I hesitate to order them because they don't usually come out to my liking. Bobby didn't fail and the drinks were up to par! The hubby and I also ordered a few manhattans and the  the Lawless.  I'm not a smoker but the Lawless was just perfect.  Get it, you'll know what I mean.  If in Phoenix again, I'd definitely come back.

BXuz-zeqU9RqNKhWel5cqA.text: The atmosphere was excellent, the food was an unpleasant experience on the pallet; there were too many complex elements in the food and could not finish any of the dishes I ordered. Maybe try it again when the menu changes

GzOxzo6DzXKw65LzGjb6jg.text: this place has amazing cocktails. Sure you can get your vodka and soda, but try their cocktail menu; you won't be disappointed.   Meals there are really good. I love how they have so many small plates to choose from. I recommend sharing a bunch of small and medium plates.   Deviled eggs are a must, as are their flatbreads.  It can get busy, so make reservations!

d13o_kq38ogFbmYRJt5TtQ.text: What a place!  My wife and I came here for our 1st Anniversary. Having made the reservation on open table I added the note that it was a special occasion.   We were greeted with complimentary champagne and a custom made salad. Our server Justis was fantastic. Walking us through the menu and offering great suggestions.   The food was mind-blowing. The BBQ ribs are the best I have ever tasted. So tender it does just fall off the bone. The fries were a nice side and rounded off the meal very well. In short everything we ordered was great!  And last but not least was the amazing desert. The chocolate creme brulee, enough for two and so tasty it left us wanting to come back just for that alone.   Blue Hound has become our new favorite spot, and we will cherish this meal for years as it was the most memorable way to spend our 1st wedding anniversary. Even got a signed card from the entire staff. Just amazing!

TTi5Wyo4g5DYiIkeE1ncvQ.text: O.M.G!!! The lemon ricotta pancakes are outstanding!!!

fn4UYq2oigdleDHyNKowUA.text: My boyfriend and I came here for his birthday. Now, for a birthday dinner, a girl can only hope that her recommendation would suffice. This restaurant was above and beyond what I'd hoped for, and totally made the night.   Our waitress was Shaura, and was totally sweet. She was super knowledgable of the menu and drinks menu. The atmosphere was exactly what we were looking for; a little modern, a little urban, and a little rustic, all in one. It's located in the Hotel Palomar's lobby, and a bit difficult to find, but doesn't affect the restaurant's awesomeness.   For an appetizer we had the Tater Tots (DO IT), and I ended up using the sauce to dip everything else in later.. an amazing blend of european spices and tomatoes and peppers. Awesome.   My boyfriend had the Pork in Belly. Sounds weird, but he downed the entire thing. AND had dessert. But more on that later. It was super tender and I could smell its deliciousness from across the table. I had the Heirloom Prosciutto, which was REALLY good. Heirloom Prosciutto, I learned, is really rare, and was most likely the best I've ever had. It had pesto and pistachio, which made it super unique.   Shaura helped me plan a special birthday surprise dessert for my man, and the entire staff even signed a birthday card for him! The dessert might have been the best part, It was toffee cake with BACON ice cream and carmel on top. Yes, BACON ice cream.   We will definitely be back.

kd6f5BW-FTop6FMbKdaB-A.text: Had dinner here last night, appetizers were excellent, including the deviled (sp) eggs with bacon jam and the pulled pork slider. I like the choice of small or larger portions. Pork shank was good but didn't blow me away, my colleague appeared to really like the shrimp and grits. The brussels sprouts on the salad menu were a great side and delicious. The chocolate pudding with marshmallow fluff was amazing. It had a graham cracker crust. The waitress was also excellent. Very happy, highly recommended.

EGLL5hk4NH3ZQukSeAmWnQ.text: Stopped in for a drink and some food and was instantly greeted by the friendly bar tender Bobby. I wasn't sure what cocktail I wanted but I knew I liked gin. He mixed me up a cocktail that not only looked great but tasted great as well! I came in a little before they opened and bobby made sure to make me feel comfortable at the bar while I waited for them to open. I will surely be back!

wk1ngZpeYMrfE_UulbU3hA.text: Another great Phoenix restaurant. I had dinner one night while attending a conference. I ordered the shrimp and grits. It was very tasty with a little kick, but not overly spicy. The English Mule is refreshing and a nice twist on the Moscow Mule. We ate outside on the patio and had a great experience. Dessert was the chocolate cake with in house banana ice cream and caramel. One of my colleagues had lunch there and said the bourbon/scotch menu and associated drinks are impressive.

7EX4gxr_bQEnynYBlKkGHg.text: Stopped in with a few friends one night for after dinner drinks and some snacks. Bartender was wonderful and was able to get us everything that we needed even know it was very late in the hour. A lot of personalized attention, and seem to really value our patronage.

tdRFEGX0TimlRG_no3pTDg.text: Thank you to Brian and his team for going  above and beyond to make our anniversary celebration special. Wonderful food  and service!  Highly recommend the deviled eggs, ahi tuna appetizer, brussel sprouts and shrimp and grits!

g4Ta0dqtqKnBrx91abt20g.text: My friends and I had just left a concert Saturday night when we decided to go out for drinks. Since we are from tucson we were not familiar with the area. We decided upon this restaurant based on the good reviews. Many times I hate asking bartenders for a drink recommendation because they more worried on how fast they can make the drinks. While we where there we were recommended the metropolitan by Michael, which was delicious! I would recommend this drink. Through out the night we also had another bartender Rob that was also very attentive. If you want a place to relax and enjoy yourself I would suggest going on a night when Michael and/Rob are working! Had a blast!

r_C-EctUbqtP0b0p9nALxQ.text: The drink I had was named The Darkness, in it was some kind of lavender infused something or other, egg white and about six other ingredients of unknown name and origin. And the bartender who suggested it was neither pompous nor pretentious.   This is the type of bar I would go to in New York City on a daily basis, but not tell anyone about because it's that good. I don't really want anyone to actually come here,  thus making it too busy to enjoy.   The drink menu is extensive and changes seasonally. Almost every cocktail is $10, which is insanely inexpensive considering the craft and talent and quality they are made with.   They also offer food late night, I think the comestibles are available until 1am?   The decor of this place is so perfect it's ridiculous. It plays off Hotel Palomar perfectly with a little bit of a ranch style with mod touches and who knows what else. It's impossible to describe and impossible not to fall in love with.   Why am I not here right now?

9n87m-cIClcEB9MK9Tp0vw.text: Preface: I'd give this place 2.5 stars if that was an option.   I met the girls for happy hour. I didn't feel like a fussy house cocktail so I ordered my standard gin & soda. Too bad they had no specials for this very basic drink ($8, I think for a single). So I ended up paying a lot more than others with their whiskey lemonades or whatever-the-heck they ordered.   After seeing the array of HH dishes ordered by others, I settled on the Kennebac Potato Fries and Hickman Farms Deviled Eggs. Both were tasty, indulgent snacks. I loved the rosemary on the fries and the generousness of the yolk mixture in the eggs (fork and knife were essential for me and my clumsiness).   The sliders got good reviews as well, though I didn't try them.   Decor was enjoyable. Service could have been better, but we were sitting in the lounge area so maybe they weren't as focused on us (however, it is happy hour in a hotel...I'd think they'd be paying attention, especially during this peak time).  All and all--an okay experience, but I know I am not going out of my way to return--especially as a local. The happy hour just isn't that great of a deal (and I wish they had more food options! Not a great selection and the dinner entrees are $20+). The inconvenience of parking downtown and so-so service just adds to my Blue Hound apathy. I guess if you are downtown it's a fine option.

-aCHy6svvjk04XfMSOzqiQ.text: The food was mediocre for the price. There are many unique choices on the menu but the taste does not match the creativity of the dishes. I had their New Cuban specialty drink & that was worth it. The drinks are good, so it's definitely a place for happy hour.

QfhUoID8FUcei99PLyJeqw.text: Despite reservation for five people,  seated in bar area with drinkers hovering around the table.  The manager was completely unhelpful,  and dining experience for all of us was terrible.  There are far better choices in Phoenix.

SwDT-K0POIj6RzI_JeY5NA.text: The food is phenomenal &the staff is awesome. Downtown Phoenix has few options anyway, so it's imperative to find a great place to eat. BLUE HOUND isn't the cat's meow. It's the Blue Hound's bark! (even better, que no?)

m152xJODgMe8bOWTQL8TCA.text: Expensive for what you get!  I ordered a flatbread pizza, $14.  Came with No Sides.  It might as well have been just bread.  There was really no sauce, topping or cheese on the thing.  For $14 + tax + slow service when it wasn't busy, I think I will spend my money elsewhere. This was my first visit to this restaurant and last.

Zc6rLwuCIixvZbif2C6REg.text: Terrible.  shrimp small and not peeled or de headed. I came to eat not to catch and clean.   Drinks are small and way over priced.   Food did come out fast and restaurant looks nice

wntABXOK8BYHtKhSUgcHiw.text: Well I have to give Blue Hound the fifth star for the service, atmosphere and of course the food.  We went with the chef's choice four course menu. Everything was perfect but I especially loved the double cut pork chop. Can't wait to return

KLCKbpj6lXcxabPbAm_v7w.text: So...I had a hankering for the lemon-blueberry ricotta pancakes and met up with some of my pals to satisfy the craving this past Sunday.  We were greeted warmly by Sergio who kept us well stocked with coffee and water.  My pals had burrata and chillaquiles; I had the pancakes and some yummy chicken sausage.  My only quibble was the acoustic guitar and his amp turned up to 11....the interior is not conducive to the volume.  Other than that, it was a lovely morning and I enjoyed the company and the chow.

Wv5XzQCWq2VcXY_XIYoSzg.text: This is really hard for me to right because I love their cocktails so very much. They are unique and different (one of their drinks they came out with a glass of tobacco smoke to infuse with their whiskey cocktail). My only issue I had was that they only had one bartender working on a Saturday night, though he was excellent service was a bit slow for a Saturday night. All and all I will still come back.

Zz5vSyCyh4CzwsLjafPYRQ.text: We came to take advantage of a promotion of $35pp for 3 courses. Due to construction we opted for valet ($10+tip). On the second floor we found Blue Hound, with a big modern seating area with a glowing fire, couches and chairs -- nice entry/first impression.   Service was sweet but bumpy. The food runner struggled with the heavy plates and seemed so eager to set them down, we kept having to redirect her to put the right plate in front of the right person. The time between the apps and the main course was way too long. No major foils but for the price level it just should be a lot smoother. To top off our slightly fumbly meal, at the end, we were asked to produce the promotional email for the 3 course deal  -- not the  confirmation mind, but the original marketing email -- even though we followed the instructions weeks ago that stated all we had to do was email our reservation with the promo code. Causing confusion and an awkward attempt by a few at the table to take out their phones in search of the email. Weird.  But drinks came out quickly (appreciated since they aren't just two-pour deals) and the server was fairly knowledgeable about the cocktail menu. Speaking of drinks ... this place prides itself on its bar offerings and almost every drink clocked in at $10 (at least). Eep. They had a whole section for booze aficionados that uses hard-to-find ingredients/odd pairings but ... I don't know. $20 for two drinks is A LOT, especially if you're experimenting with new liquors and ingredients as their drink menu encourages you to do.   Food pleased/impressed, for the most part. First course we ordered the mac and cheese, and the cheddar scallion biscuits with fried quail eggs and bacon jam (another thing about this place - they're on the bacon train big time, including bacon ice cream ... eh, I think everyone got over that trend before it even started); and roasted cauliflower. For mains we had a pork porterhouse, ribs with bleu cheese grits and pumpkin flatbread. The pork was good but not great, flatbread was a little boring (no pumpkin or sage flavors really popping out) and one of only substantial veggie options on the menu. The ribs were probably the star of the table - it's the size of a dinosaur bone and cooked perfectly. Desserts tried included fresh donut holes, chocolate creme brulee, treacle pudding and lime sorbet. All pretty good to excellent (though I wouldn't bother with the donut holes again, fresh but nothing special, flavor-wise).  In summary, the experience taste-wise was exactly what I was craving after living in the UK for a more than a year: that is, classic American comfort food sussed up gourmet style. But overall I don't know the food or drink prices are justifiable for a return dinner visit. However, atmosphere is modern and classy, the drinks were excellent and the care and passion put toward them is noted and appreciated - they're just a bit expensive for me. I ended up spending $140+tip for two and one of us wasn't even having cocktails!  If I still lived in Phoenix, I would probably file this one in the "only for happy hour" category, since they have discounted offerings for food and drinks.

ta0gWXRwNUehTGgVBgW18Q.text: Luster is on the 3rd floor. Not sure why I couldn't find it on Yelp but its a cool spot. Pool is within arm's reach and the roof top bar offers small bites and drinks.  I had the luster burger which was grass fed and my wife had the turkey flat bread. The burger was excellent... a little over cooked although. Flat bread was nothing special but the ambience was great and I would go back especially during the spring and earlier in the day... brunch and mimosas would be amazing on a warm sunny day. My only other critique is to wipe down the table... The stains were noticeable and that is not representative of a Kimpton property. Happy dining! James

rvjbaYUdBQI9-t4PzTxTBQ.text: I made reservations on Tuesday for Saturday night--  I had tickets to the ballet and wanted a downtown restaurant.  Blue Hound had great reviews and took reservations so I thought I would give it a try.  (Night before Valentine's Day so figured we needed reservations).  Someone called me on Friday to inform me that the chef decided to do a prix fixe menu ($80 for four courses) and that we couldn't order from the menu.  We were not interested and had to scramble to find another restaurant.  Poor planning on the part of the chef/staff.  Likely won't try again; plenty of other options.

6BVfo-Z19P950JMqPI2JkQ.text: Not a big fan... was out of most alcoholic beverages attempted to be ordered.  Food was decent, but service was mediocre.

LY9TqKeSqH_lP1KbhPZHUg.text: Great meal - some unusual veggie options. Brussel Sprout Caesar was truly original and tasty. Roasted squash with barley and golden raisins was delightful. When I ordered the cheese platter for dessert, however, the cheese was ice cold and not presented in an appetizing way. The fig preserves looked like it was scooped out of a vat with a deformed ice cream spoon. The grapes were tasteless. The cheese was gross.

UKX_0-8rhRDpvD6juyR4bw.text: I had a great time at Blue hound! I loved the atmosphere, the signature cocktails, the wine list, the service, and the awesome food!! This place is a must try!! My favorite menu items were the pulled pork on Johnny cakes, the tater tots, and the donuts!! I want to go back again to try more menu items!!

xhzr0FC9wG8craF-gbLc_w.text: The two stars are for the food. Because there was nothing wrong with it and it came out fast. However everything else was slow. I did not get to order another drink during my whole meal. My friend never had his diet coke refilled the entire time. We had to ask the waiter for everything numerous times. My other friend finally walked up to the bar to order his drink. The food was average, nothing spectacular and kind of pricey for what it is. Service is incredibly slow and it was not busy- empty tables everywhere.

BX5O90UmRl5lvs4m18hhXA.text: A fine choice in a hotel. Decent food. Good service.

Vycn7NTUbWBRbWKCsTUd1g.text: Our first and so far only visit was very nice. We caught the tail end of brunch after the symphony and got to take advantage of the unlimited mimosas. I am an eggs Benedict snob and seriously feel that 9 out of 10 places make them unpalatable. Blue hound not only had a good Hollandaise sauce but they mastered the perfect poached egg! Score! Our server was a tad slow but never too bad and consideration was given to the fact he had a large party in addition to the restaurant being quite busy.  We will definitely return!

nOo5iWbIUH_leqWDLk5fDg.text: This is, hands down, my favorite restaurant in downtown Phoenix! Shrimp and grits! Flatiron steak! Fried tomatoes! SO GOOOOD. I mean, AWESOME! The ambiance is everything I would want in my dream home. Nice view over looking the skate rink and Christmas tree. Beautiful. Service was perfect. Definitely a place for a romantic evening, in my eyes! Excellent!

-KW6GPa8KcQQ1G51PjuyIg.text: Short ribs, tater tots, and potato leek gratin were amazing!  Great waitstaff and ambiance.  -can't wait to go back

tCMkhMrNFf6ZY3MTYqmeHw.text: I had the Cod fish Po' Boy sandwich, it was yummy and thier fries have  a spicy kick to them.  I really like the urban look of this restaurant.... I'll be back.

DVrw6rbbNAs706osXI7bCg.text: I'll be honest, the first time I came here I got the kale salad and the fries. Kale was a little bitter, and the Parmesan just kinda thrown on, and I wasn't liking the combination with raw apple slices.  The fries and sriracha were delicious and fresh, but overall wasn't feeling it.   The second time I came tho, I was sitting alone at the bar on arguably the worst day of my life. In a haze of tears and tissues, I picked the most comforting looking thing on the menu.  10 minutes and many napkins later, out arrives a skillet of macaroni and cheese with a bag of Cheetos dumped on top. It was the comfort I didn't know I needed: the hot cheesy goodness, the perfectly al dente shells, and slightly stale fake cheese sticks that harkened me back to days of my childhood and reminded me that this too will pass and things will be ok again. So thanks Blue Hound, I will never forget that meal, and also the kindness of the bartenders and the people around me.  Much love.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CqVafhg0O3zfiQQ13rOZXg.text: Blue Hound is a bit tricky to find. Go up the stairs on the street level to the second level to access the restaurant (or you can enter from the Kimpton Hotel Palomar Phoenix and go up the elevator). They have a big, relaxing lounge area. The corn bread madeleine with green chile and honey butter are a must order to start. I had the blackened salmon with corn, garden vegetables (that night was mushrooms, asparagus and roasted tomatoes), and meyer lemon, which was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackened salmon

fMkfRYecCR-xEuC4Tsiivg.text: Shout out to Colleen excellent service. Food was delicious as well as the specialty drinks! Definitely would come back!

tWl-zviyLaH_8mngWskCBQ.text: Beautiful place in Cityscape downtown Phoenix. I would surely make this a regular happy hour spot if I worked down here. My sister wanted me to try their Outlaw bourbon drink - but they had just taken it off the menu. Too bad too. Sounds amazing with smoke and bitters. Happy hour has good drink specials, but a limited bar menu. We enjoyed house chardonnay with an order of unlimited seasoned popcorn, while husband opted for a heartier burger from the bar menu. The burger smelled fantastic and he did say it was good, except for the really thick slice of velveeta on it. Great if you like that sort of thing. Burger comes with fries, on a toasted bun with crispy bacon.  We stayed for a couple drinks and headed out. It was a Monday afternoon, just before rush hour. Not a big place but comfortable.  Great place for a business meeting, or upscale stop for a classy drink with co-workers.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar burger. Smells amazing
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wAe4GQUEGviNWgJgjUA-pQ.text: I've been eating at this restaurant for ten years. Always loved the ambience, drinks and food. Unfortunately, they have brought in a new executive chef who found it necessary to not just make some changes, but take out all time favorites only to replace them with substandard dishes. Before the new chef arrived, the place was always packed. I went on a popular Friday night, prime time, and it's was half empty. So many good restaurants out there- no need to bother with expensive mediocrity.

6iiBjbaCZMxA6UPfhdH-sQ.text: The Blue Hound was recommended by both Yelp and our hotel. It was a short walk from the Westin where we were staying. We called about an hour ahead of time and made a reservation. Good thing we did because the place was packed. It's located in a plaza with many other food, shopping, and entertainment options. You can take stairs or an elevator to get there. It's also adjacent to a hotel and rooftop bar. The place was clearly popular as it was busy and there was an event happening which the front section was rented out for. We were approached by our server-Chris R, who took our drink orders. Our very standard bourbon on the rocks for my fiance and kettle martini for me. The drinks were great and we decided to split the burrata appetizer and the homemade pasta entree. The environment was sexy and dimly lit, our server was knowledgeable, prices were higher considering it was a nice place, and the food was delicious-it also came out fairly quick. I would gone here again for the ambience-even if it was just for drinks

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burrata Appetizer.
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Homemade pasta
