4kjFNKFcsJT98qWMf7Hqhg.text: My only complaint ...serve BRUNCH?!   Super cute place. Good bar.  But on Sunday, no brunch items?

NLnEoqeQ8MdE0Wup6YwnDg.text: Business colleague and I stopped at the bar for drinks.  The Christmas drink menu was interesting.  We both got the Christmas Old Fashion.  It was good, but expensive at $18/drink. After an hour, my colleague had to run, so I decided to grab a bite at the Blue Hound.  I was told that the wait was over one hour, so I ordered a salad to go.  Like the drink, the food was over-priced... over $22 for a chopped salad with chicken.

Z1bdlPmPJ2MSMH1UOpQOsw.text: I do love this place. Never gone wrong with the food and the craft cocktails are incredible. The restaurant and bar are all upstairs off of Jefferson so you have a nice view of the area. At Christmas time it over looks the skating rink and Christmas tree so I receommend making reservations by the window so you can view PHX during the holidays.   Over all this is one of those places that is a must try in Downtown PHX!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Basmati  bowl with chickpeas and avocado yum!
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Atomic cocktail

V6Y7JalG-p1Hl-WN8v7AsA.text: Food was good. Customer service also good. Had breakfast twice plus dessert and drinks at the bar when we were staying there. Got a rare pour of Pappy Van Winkle Bourbon. Bartender let us keep the bottle!!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Long Island ice tea
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tiramisu

c6-QJK-VG9-Fa6A637cqQw.text: My first time here and it was amazing. The bar was decorated for the holidays and I couldn't feel more like I was on vacation and out of Phoenix. Christmas in Phoenix really doesn't exist so the ambience really set the mood. We were waited on by Chris and he offered great recommendations. There menu was on Christmas cards filled with Christmas themed drinks and food! HOW WONDERFUL! He recommended the Christmaspolitian and it was Perfect! Another waitress Nicholette had recommended the shots and WOAH! CHRISTMAS in my mouth lol Drinks made with cinnamon!! If you are looking for a great place to relax and enjoy drinks this is def the place! Cant wait to come back.

x6wNzJjCZrFjvrndJjBx0A.text: Had an absolutely outstanding meal here. I was attending a conference on my own in Phoenix and so opted to eat at the restaurant since it was within my hotel.  Would definitely return. The service was attentive and the tuna tartare, in particular,  should not be missed by anyone who likes sashimi. Highly recommended.

wXtTf1wyXp5cEKjqZ_6BLw.text: Our server Coleen was excellent. She was prompt, friendly and courteous. The food was excellent and tasty. I had the skirt steak was done to perfection.

N7L4QEwDBODHwBvs1T-zEw.text: This restaurant was recommend by a friend and it was an amazing experience. The wait was about 1hr for the restaurant so we sat at the bar for dinner. Phil was our bartender and server. He was incredibly helpful with menu selections and a master at bartending. He was extremely knowledgeable and we loved everything he recommended. The pork chop cooked medium well was so Delicious and we also order the lamb Occo Busso. Both entrees were so tender and flavorful. We also ordered a side dish of mushrooms and Brussels sprouts. Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious. We can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lamb Occo Busso
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Chop

D0PN_t975v9Lmos6sPF2-w.text: The restaurant was very nice. Good decor and great floor to ceiling windows. The service was a bit slow and the food came out not as hot and fresh as you'd want. Like it had been sitting there for awhile. The steak was descent enough but I definitely wouldn't say it was worth the 100 dollar bill I paid for my dad and I. Maybe just an off night because we heard great things about this place.

c8C7Lo2anAtLUN5M4TOvXg.text: I've been dying to try this place out!   After picking my friend up from the airport we were ready for some food and drinks and somewhere close to the airport.   For food, we really wanted to try the duck wings, but they were currently out of it. Bummer! We shared the seared tuna, and the corn grit fries. These are not your ordinary fries. lol ( see picture) Everything was good and they have a pretty small menu to choose from. For drinks, I love places that will just make any custom drink based on your liking. I told the waiter I wanted a martini that was sweet but strong. And that's exactly what it was. lol   I'd definitely come back for some more food and drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Corn grit fries
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seared tuna
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dXbNfaG_RFtlJcy6jB6kfg.text: Went here for a late night dinner and some cocktails with friends! The location was great the ambiance was very nice and the food was delicious.  We couldn't sit outside cause it was pretty windy but there's a nice view of the city on the patio and it's good for people watching. I had the Brussel sprouts and the were fantastic, my bf had the shrimp and grits as recommended by our server since the chef specializes in Cajun and he really enjoyed it!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brussel Sprouts
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ubiiF8DF4_-Vjt4BeNn-uA.text: After unexpectedly getting stranded in Phoenix on a Tuesday night, Blue Hound felt like a saving grace, as one of the only restaurants that looked appetizing and was still open at 9:30.  The bar atmosphere felt trendy and upscale at the same time and the menu selections were great. It was definitely the type of place I'd go back to for a proper dining experience, not jus tan I want to die because I've been traveling for the last 10 hours experience.  It seemed like the type of place where the menu changed often based on the chef's selection, and I like that. I tried the Chef Selection flatbread which that night was an arugula flatbread with grilled steak, and goat cheese. It was more than enough for me to eat, and a hard decision when there were other fantastic sounding Menu choices.

UWxGzKFK2Zmj_W7n5UuDyQ.text: First off....  This restaurant fucks! Delicious food, excellent atmosphere and extraordinary wait staff.   I had the steak and the Mrs had the spaghetti (with chicken at the recommendation of Carolina our fantastic waitress).   Carolina took great care of us and was exceptionally personable.   Let's just say the last part got me a tad emotional. It may have been the double vodkas, but we explained some hardships we experienced during the day leading up to our meal, without hesitation, the manager brought our bill and comped half our meal.   Not that we necessarily needed this monetarily, but morally this was spectacular. This show of humility is what I seek in everyday life and the fact it came on such a special occasion means the world.  To the Blue Hound, My wife and I can't thank you enough. This was the highlight of a very crumby anniversary weekend to say the least.   Thank you from life-long patrons

SQ45g7JV6BOGw-bZeep5Ag.text: Burrata with honey, pistachios, raisins, Noble bread, and a fresh micro salad. This was especially delicious paired with an Aviation and Irish coffee cocktails. Blue Hound has some of the best cocktails around! I love the ambiance and the attention to detail the bartenders have for their elixirs.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burrata with honey, pistachios, raisins, Noble bread, and a fresh micro salad.
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. An Aviation and an Irish coffee

8YCJJzKu57MahXHfm6lq3Q.text: Had the quinoa salad for lunch recently during a work trip. Such great flavor and great atmosphere. It was a little pricey but a delicious salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome lobby vibes - shares with a hotel
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lobby area

4XaItnaOEtSJzukl9mJ09Q.text: The Blue Hound is a beautiful restaurant and we were seated within 10 min. We ordered several appetizers and it was hit or miss. The sliders and deviled eggs were good but the corn grit fries were not my favorite.  The pork shank was right on the money and the meat just fell off the bone. If you're on a date night, I would definitely recommend Blue Hound.

WkS8ectlKiSDkJ6sKQhdvg.text: Second floor of the Hotel Plimpton. Two blue hounds greet you over blonde wood floors in a dimly lit setting with dark wood tables. Inventive cocktails are a great way to start. Try the lawless; the glass comes upside down soaking in vanilla pipe smoke over which a tasty bourbon concoction is then poured - incredibly delicious!  Appetizers are inviting - the shishito peppers  with siracha aioli are good although no longer so imaginative as they once were. The kale salad was fresh and flavorful. Entrees are where the fool really shines. Fresh handmade pasta with cherry tomatoes are simple but tasty.  An incredibly crispy and juicy game hen with Asian flavors over a bed of fried cauliflower was phenomenal.

THomTyIAzoiJskROsXtrQQ.text: Last night was my third time here. We decided to meet friends here while waiting for a table across the street at Bitter and Twisted. It would be an hour wait they said to get a table at Bitter and Twisted so I thought that should be more than enough time to pre-drink at Blue Hound.  45 minutes after waiting, someone finally takes our drink order. Then, about 20 minutes later we get our drinks just in time for our table to be ready across the street. So, our group of 5 had to chug our cocktails, which were mostly beers and a whiskey diet for me and a vodka tonic for a friend (so easy cocktails), and pay right away to make it in time.   My 2nd time there was before a concert. My hubs and I decided to get dinner with drinks beforehand. Food was delicious. We really enjoyed the pork belly. Deviled eggs also a treat. BUT... After ordering my first drink, I asked if I could keep the cocktail menu a bit longer. The waiter looked stressed and said, "We only have a few of these cocktail menus" wanting to take it from me. I didn't know how to respond. I just looked at him. He then left the menu with me anyway, and when he came back, I gave the menu back to him and said that I had taken pics of the drink menu so he could have the menu back.  Awkward, right? Perhaps I was out of line just to keep the drink menu longer but I was excited to see what to order next since the cocktails are good here.   That first time here? Oh, we didn't have reservations so we didn't get a table. Understandable on a Sunday night.. We ended up seating at a table thinking that it was part of the bar area and not the restaurant. It looks like a family size round table but "outside" of the regular restaurant side. It's on the outside of a ceiling to floor divider. 30 minutes later, the hostess said we couldn't sit there because it's part of the restaurant. That's why we weren't able to order anything, so we walked over to Copper Blues...

oT2ettMn6ZYUlk3nleFNiA.text: This is my new favorite watering hole downtown. The cocktails are delicious and the staff are attentive. Only wish I lived closer

RAHj23JLGnIpr8SIiNZ4OA.text: Surprisingly impressive for a hotel restaurant.  Well, maybe it is just attached to the hotel so shouldn't hold that against the restaurant.  Service was friendly and prompt,  Entrees were appropriately sized and plated for the price.  Shrimp & grits were excellent (especially considering how far removed AZ is from the South Carolina).    Thumbs up for:  service, food, atmosphere.

m1oE5yRR31DCWW0a2FhgGg.text: Only stopped in for a few drinks but it's a nice bar! I had Bloody Mary's, my friend had the Rose all day. Patrick was really nice and talkative. He was also extremely hot. We are wondering what life is like when you're that attractive? He has a bad sense of distance though. A walk to Desoto central market definitely isn't just "down the street." Anyway, we will be back for drinks!

bwEJ2_FqebEKZtw8Wv63_A.text: It's a great downtown staple. Food and drinks are consistently well done. Menus changes with enough frequency to keep it interesting. Atmosphere is nice.  Doesn't feel like a hotel resturant.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great meal.  The drink in the coupe is non-alcoholic. Hands down the best na-cocktail I&#39;ve ever had.

uLGD03PbFNZYXNFxiXIjTA.text: This restaurant is the bomb. The food is amazing and the service is wonderful. Good selection of food and great patio outside. If you are staying in downtown this is a must to go out and eat at. The selection is pretty slim in downtown so take an u ER and get here now!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beautiful
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The dog out front.
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak and rice.

_29Dx8K9UGwdqwxy0Aia3A.text: Basically... nothing here for the vegetarian.  Too bad.  It's a nice place, great location.

dAFBK8DoBtQ5enNS-R90DA.text: One of my go to spots for lunch in downtown Phoenix, but the happy hour made me happy too.  I recommend the turkey burger (add grilled onions), wings (spicy!) and shishito peppers to start.  But everything is high quality and well prepared.  I will see you again soon, Blue Hound.

YAAQ70AIk4sVglc_yWb5kg.text: Love their deviled eggs, ahi tuna salad and old fashioned with buffalo trace! The library/den wooden oak lounge feel is equally appealing. Great place for sips, eats and convo's or a quiet lunch solo like I had.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing

ODPqhy6KQshRXFLcUK7n_A.text: We, three, arrived at BHKC late on a Friday for happy hour but left within the hour. So much for the hype!  Maybe because the stars weren't aligned right, but it was not the place for us to sit and sip that night.  Many rave about the Lawless drink, let's just say that if you're a flowery flavored drinker, don't go for it.  The menu was so limited and there wasn't a dish on there that I wanted to shell out a chunk of dollars for.  Like I said, perhaps it just wasn't our night to relish in the BHKC experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Thank you note!
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lost Melody! Sweet and smooth.
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Lawless!

TFI-PQqJtBAxx3FbwnM6_A.text: What a wonderful culinary treat!! I took the light rail to downtown for a show and was delighted the Blur Hound was steps away!! So location is awesome!  Great drink menu, decor and ambiance was beautiful and for this "senior" delighted I could actually carry on a conversation with my dinner partner. I started with the roasted asparagus that was topped with a fried egg - outstanding!! The dressing was light and flavorful!! Terrific appetizer. I had the chefs chopped salad for dinner and added shrimp. The portion was nice, not too huge and the ingredients were delicious - avocado, dried corn, frigola, green, fresh cherry tomatoes - all fresh, crisp and delicious. Our server was super helpful and friendly. I will go back again for sure. I highly recommend this gem.

txYICiwcDSUlQ_w9xDAYnQ.text: I went to the bar for a cocktail before sitting for dinner with my husband. Michael was amazing, he was super knowledgable about drinks. I told him my favorite ingredients and he made me a fantastic custom drink, making me feel like a special guest.   My great service continued after we sat at Nicolette's table. She walked us through the menu and made suggestions that we wouldn't have tried otherwise. She always had a smile and a welcoming attitude. We died when she brought us a complimentary chocolate cake at the end of dinner- WOW.   We will definitely be back.

MxggqLCBn7W9SG_qqVuGag.text: The service here was amazing! Really friendly waitress and the food came out on time. This place is rustic yet elegant. I had the chopped salad which was super yummy and filling. It had tomatoes, corn, avocado, sunflower seeds and something crunchy that weren't croutons. I loved the different textures and flavor. My friends had the ribs and the coconut curry. I tried both and they were amazing. The curry reminded me of Thai food. It came with a tempura pea and carrot that you dip with the curry. AMAZING. The ribs were a little spicy, I could taste the tabasco sauce. My friend couldn't handle the spice but I thought it was good. Overall, I would highly recommend this place. The flavors, decor and menu makes this restaurant different.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chopped salad

4zHeofcoHOvtbTqNYuOXAw.text: I really liked the ambiance of this place. Cozy, with a great view of downtown.  I had the seared ahi and handmade pasta. The seared ahi was delicious! The outer crusted seasoning hits the palate last, and just adds a great flavor and touch of spice, and keeps you guessing as to what it is. The quinoa and red pepper pull all the flavors together perfectly.  The handmade pasta fell just a bit short. The tomatoes weren't a good ripe flavor, and the pasta was a little to mushy for my taste. Overall, I'd recommend this place for an overall good dining experience.

KjwLCWnb2GsKzaiIS_YZ1g.text: Being born and bred in North Carolina, I know my shrimp and grits and these, folks, are the REAL DEAL!  Wow! Shrimp tasted so fresh! And the sauce was not overpowering and the grits so authentic and creamy! My husband got the pork shank which just fell off the bone. Wonderful! Wine is pricey ($13/glass) but actually some of the better wine I've had downtown. We will definitely be coming back!

yhQJDnO7PCtQa2_j8qeY9w.text: Retarded drink menu. This place used to have wonderful drinks. They changed their menu to only photographs without any descriptions of what you're ordering. Even the waitresses have no clue then act annoyed when you ask for what's in the various drinks. Big waste of time they ruined a previously good dining experience. Avoid this place.

cDQ0RUhzRiarKe5wtA_NTA.text: Really enjoyed our evening here!  We weren't overly hungry but wanted to grab a drink. However, the menu looked so good we ordered 3 apps and salad - the shishito peppers, shredded pork sliders, the ahi starter and Brussell sprout salad.   The peppers are amazing. Flavorful and not overwhelming with heat. But every 5th one, or so, would remind us that we were eating peppers!  The sliders are a Meal! Filling, yet easy to share. Of all the things we had, we agreed the Brussell salad was amazing!  We might have had a mini fork war. My favorite part of the salad was the fried egg.  Our server was helpful and very friendly. Yes, definitely worthy of a bookmark and return visits!

4j9hdPWFc4W-ZdGVK7UZXA.text: Beautiful bar and hotel ... but skip it for happy hour and watch out for deceptive wait staff.  Problem with the Blue Hound is there are too many choices nearby to make coming back a possibility. It may feel cool, but a lot of other places nearby feel cool, too. It's worth a visit just to check it out, but then ... it will never enter your mind again.  The Whoohoos!! - Beautifully decorated, great feeling and vibe, as another reviewer stated. It feels like a nice change of pace for Phoenix restaurants. The poolside bar is awesome and I'd go back there before this place.  The Sad Pandas - Happy hour SUCKS. I work nearby and go out at least one night a week and the Blue Hound will not be on our rotation list. "But why?" you ask ...  Set the scene ... four women out after work. Not looking for dinner, just some snacks while we have a drink or two and catch up.  Popcorn - sounds nummy! Not if you want more than two handfuls. For $6, we were delivered a teeny, tiny wooden bowl that you'd expect salsa to come in. In it was two medium sized handfuls of this caramel popcorn (and a lot of kernels and broken pieces). This should be given to the table gratis, if you're going to give something so small.  Deviled eggs - Wow, the presentation was beautiful I felt like Gordon Ramsey must have perfectly placed and spaced the eggs on the plate. And the four of us, now totally stuffed from our half a handful of popcorn stare down at three deviled eggs. Good thing Maria was on a diet, of else we'd have to arm wrestle for who got the eggs.  Drinks - not the worse priced, not the best. Problem was our waiter didn't seem to have a Fing clue about their unique lineup of beers. I asked for something light and summery - to which he suggest a "summer shandy."  Assuming this summer shandy was the same as every other summer shandy I've had (beer mixed with lemonade), I agreed to try it on the waiter's "It's amazing"  What I was given haunts me in my dreams. A oddly shaped beer glass was delivered with a light, almost water color and a GIANT FREAKING CUCUMBER stuck in it.   Was I supposed to put this on my eyes? The drink smelled like a combination of facial moisturizer and salad ... both appealing combos in a drink.  That's about when my friend found the drink in their table top menu and pointed out the $10 price tag and list of liquor. This was NOT a normal summer shandy and the waiter should have told me and either pointed to it in the menu and listed the price. Granted, $10 isn't horrible, but what if I was watching my money?  When someone is trying to spend my money to raise his bill and tip, be honest with me or I'll slam your tip and warn others to be wary of the wait staff at the Blue Hound.  So bottom line ... I think this place is worth a visit, but given my experience, I will not be returning on any regular basis.

UG8659DBrFV8AgJtNIxYtg.text: Yet another amazing experience at Blue Hound! I always love going there for their ambiance and creative menu items. Not only is the place great to look at, but my server was too! Chris W was very attentive and knowledgable, especially with the cocktails. I started with the Lawless, then went to the Young and Famous and finished with an excellent old fashioned. For dinner I had the scallops which were so perfectly seared, paired with the most perfect sauce!   I heard the shishito peppers are good, I'll be coming back to try those! Thank you for the excellent service and food!

sUKgUekgm6GQbM8iye0olw.text: So I met some friends here last night for cocktails. We sat at the bar. The bartender, Juan C,  was AWFUL!!! Ordered a bottle of champagne and he didn't even put it on ice. He gave us dirty looks all night and went out of his way to ignore us. Worst service I have ever had and we still gave him 20%. The food was good but if you ever go here and you have him as a server then LEAVE!!! It was that bad. I don't think I can ever go back after that. Shame, I have always liked this place.

gtBCxphWj88RHBoh33b0CA.text: The drinks!  The drinks!  This place just surpassed Sidebar as my go-to place for fancy-pants cocktails.  The absinthe fizz (gin, absinthe, lime, honey, soda and a HUGE strip of cucumber) might just be the best cocktail I've ever tried. Anywhere. Sadly, it's not included on the happy hour menu.  Get it anyway.  Happy hour features select $6 cocktails (the summer smash was, well, a smash) and half-price flatbreads.  My friends noted, however, that the happy hour flatbreads were considerably smaller than the $12 standard we got later that night!  Ask for Zack - he's young, he's cute, and, I can't believe I'm putting "best" into one review twice, but he honestly gave the BEST service I've ever received at a restaurant - hustling to get us several rounds before happy hour closed (He even went the extra mile by rounding up an ice bucket so that the last-ditch happy hour beer ($3)  - ordered while a half-full beer sat in front of us - wouldn't get warm!).  What a very happy happy hour, indeed.

3pCpLodd9n4p1zOKJRMS_A.text: Had an amazing brunch at Blue Hound today! The Spanish Omelet was absolutely fabulous and out service by James was near perfect! Going back as soon as I can!

zfV30LkCzQK20eEmeoo0cw.text: Beautiful drinks. Excellent whiskey selection. Amazing bartenders.  I've only had food here once, but it was scrumptious. I'm a sucker for gourmet-ed up southernish cuisine.

jXRhombgFubXJdQhvI7jUg.text: Don't waste your time making a reservation as they won't honor it. I made reservations app 2 weeks in advance for a birthday dinner with guest here booked for 630 this evening. The restaurant called and confirmed my reservation and table this afternoon. We arrived at 625 only to be told, sorry but we seated other people at that table and can't honor your reservation. The hostess refused my request to speak to a manager, we ended up driving up town and eating at the St Francis. Don't waste your time dealing with these people.

srzwVVZVyVTcfYapIWVRHg.text: Alright, you're ballsy enough Blue Hound. The food had gotten a lot better here. The menu always looked good before but didn't seem to deliver. It's not bad, little pricey compared to some meals for the same price. The booths are incredibly comfortable and I don't mind paying $10 for strong cocktails. I'm cool with it.

vG_GGquIPrri7QZlCtT-Uw.text: Came in for dinner, a little too keen on itself.  Average cocktails, average food and average service. charisma bybass in my opinion.

waGS_gcDHcYRNBMQBCLMlg.text: Came into the bar area with 6 people for drinks and appetizers. Great atmosphere, drink menu, and food menu! However, the bartender Greg served first round of drinks and never came back! We flagged a barback to order appetizers. All empty drinks with no attention, we asked the barback for our tab. The crabby bartender was the reason I didn't give this place five stars or spend more money.

UPGe99ANowHiSR0ghhMrkA.text: Blue Hound is an incredibly relaxing and classy place to go to happy hour downtown. The atmosphere is unbeatable and the bartenders are fun! Although their happy hour flatbreads are not big enough to get full on, they are delicious. I've tried all of them, and I like them all! I like their natural daiquiri, but my favorite drink was called, I think, 'Summer Breeze' off of the happy hour, but I'm not finding it on the online menu right now, so maybe it's seasonal.   The next thing I want to try is the pool patio bar!

r2FU8wijNUPcYg-m8G2RMw.text: What a seat to watch the over 45 crowd head to the Van Halen concert! Yep, that's our generation doing shots of tequila with Coors Lite chasers.   The conversational slur:  What type of tequila you got? (we're quite picky) Aw, never mind that's good (too drunk to care)   So wow it was crowded with some drunks, cool folks and young'uns.  Bartenders maintained their cool with the escalating demands... Then normalcy returned with a pleasant jibe that allowed us to absorb this fun space within the Palomar.  Menu was reasonable but bar had the most options with unusual whiskeys, oversized rocks, and signature drinks without too much sugar. Ceviche enjoyable with well brined scallops, shrimp, and chili threads.  Guess the one nagging detail was how the bar treated a young man, under dressed but paying cash...geez they requested drink payment right away then they almost double charged him for the drink when he paid up for the later  entree. Meanwhile, we hadn't even offered a credit card for our honest tab. Can't figure out that one.  Loved the oversized rocks with the whiskey and nice pours. We will be back!

_PlSTYzNYHrrGA4AwoFYlQ.text: Came here for lunch and I ordered the chilaquilas with a bloody mary.  Everyone does their chilaquilas different so I had NO idea what to expect.  Well well well there people - when it arrived - layered meaty chip goodness with a fried egg on top!!!  I was in mouth watering heaven - and it was a HUGE portion, couldn't finish it.  The meat was tender, green chili was sweet and the bloody mary went so good with it all. I will definitely be back for the dinner menu - without a doubt.  Nice lunch surprise and left needing a little nap.  Thank you Blue!

LykHMnAnVVYP7QNGcegtmQ.text: This is a great place to come on a date with your honey !  we shared some snacks and were asking questions about the hand crafted cocktails and the waiter liked us so much he gave a free cocktail to try and we loved it! It had smoke infused bourbon, not only dramatic and inventive but delish!  I cant wait to go back for more.  Foodies will love this place!

-nsO3HMF4FkYyBX19PtqxQ.text: I had a friend who stayed at the Kimpton hotel that the Blue Hound is in (I hadn't heard about it prior to this weekend) and she had a dining credit at the restaurant, so we decided to check it out.    The bad:  Our server was initially very distant and not particularly friendly. However, after looking him in the eye, saying lots of "pleases" and "thank yous" and just generally engaging him, he was so much friendlier.  The only other negative is that he seemed to get lost and didn't check back with the table often.  We would've ordered another round of drinks had he come back more often. Getting the check with difficult as well.  The I also had a friend that ordered the flatbread (not sure if it was pumpkin or sweet potato, but it was along those lines) with sage...it was a good concept, but not savory enough.  Now the good:  The server lightened up and was very sweet once he got over his initial standoffishness.  The drinks were pretty decent.  I was looking for a Moscow Mule, but the server informed me that they don't have ginger beer, but ginger simple syrup.  So we kind of improvised and it was still good.  Everyone ordered a drink off of their specialty menu and enjoyed it.  Food wise -the bottomless popcorn - YUMMY!!  And they were generous with it.  As I mentioned above, my friend ordered the flatbread - consensus at the table was that it was too sweet and not savory enough.  I ordered the trout - DELISH!!! We shared a couple of the chicory salads - pretty good...the dressing was nice and light.  Others at the table ordered the mussels and the flatbread of the night and they were all very happy.  Overall, I'd give the place another whirl...particularly for drinks!

9vgcRovzyv0hEtbmruMRog.text: Came here for the first time for my girlfriend's 40th birthday dinner.  Our waiter, Chris, was awesome and offered amazing selections for drinks and food.  I chose the Lawless and Lamb Shank.  The drink was ah-mazing!  Smelled like a man and tasted smooth and delicious!  The food was fantastic.  Added the juice or sauce from meat to the risotto and made it taste spectacular.  The apps were good too....the rice and cheese balls...forgot the name.  I will definitely go back!

uGWkQ3jFzevg-t8aeJuIVA.text: Delicious. Our group shared the deviled eggs and fried green tomatoes, both of which were terrific. I had the shrimp and grits for my meal which didn't disappoint. The portions were HUGE.

Ja5M7n0f5mnUWbSkM_VOFg.text: Had heirloom tomatoes with grilled swordfish, shishito peppers and the bourbon smash, and that was the best meal I've had during my entire stay in Phoenix.

XcC_H4EpMLYTqTGXsOSJKQ.text: I visited this place last week on my first visit to Arizona. By far the best mixed cocktails I have ever had.  I work at a hotel/restaurant in Bakersfield, CA which is the same style theme as this place. The female bartender was very friendly and helpful with my future wife and me. The short rib sliders were delicious, but the house mixed cocktails were out of this world good. When I come back to Arizona, I'm definitely going to stay at this hotel, because it is WELL worth the money. Thanks for all the hospitality great ambiance.

Ylvpv2wlC6vb6Botld8lUQ.text: Don't waste your time or money. Sat 7:30p, we walked in and got the best table in the place with no wait.... Not a good sign. Our server was so amped up it was concerning. The brussel sprouts came out basically uncooked. We sent them back and they came back out after we had finished our entree, super dry bland pork chop. Go somewhere else, anywhere else.

-pKb4t4G2ltoc3Ox2NxGHw.text: The Kale Cesar Salad is amazing.  The steak on the dinner menu is right on if you ask the server not to poor the salad all over it because the steak will taste too vinegar-ry and tart.  I like to have my steak served without the sides piled on top of it.  Just incase I dont want the flavor mixing.  The trout is a MUST HAVE.  The decor is beautiful and very modern (reminds me of the NE restaurants).  The servers are AMAZINGLY polite and the bar tender is the same.  The greeter or host sets the tone with a beautiful smile and welcoming warm and polite "Welcome"  Great job.

8aY5JWUVFpmID4YR1as42w.text: It's 3 months after my initial review and the prosecco is still not chilled enough. What up????

u_D-pgnafujhoECN_TqY_g.text: Me and husband have fallen in love with the bar right away -  classical and new/innovative hand muddled cocktails & FUN ambiance was a recipe for perfect Friday evening. Slowly venturing into food menu - not as impressive as the cocktails ... up to few months ago - seem like the menu has significantly changed. Although originally we were planning only on drinks and couple of appetizers, we were so impressed with the food that we continued ordering more and more of the new menu - as we had a full dinner there at the bar. All the flatbreads were wonderful - my husband's lamb was a bomb - and they even wrapped the bones to take home for our dogs ;-O Also the pedestrian area that allows you to walk right in (very unique in PHX) makes it perfect spot to enjoy urban life - coming from Prague - this makes me feel closer to home.

0YRf7sgdszm4WuZeokBJaQ.text: I took my wife to this restaurant last night for her graduation along with my dad her brother, her mom and her mom's boyfriend.  I think I ruined all of them to going out to eat at other Kitchens forever.  We started with tater tots, charred pork belly sliders and the family farmed cheese plate.  I don't think anything says family dinner like reaching over each other for another delicious bite because everything is addictively good.  Up next we had the cured strawberry & fennel flat bread, crispy salt and pepper shrimp,  BBQ short ribs an added bonus was something Chef Brent whipped up was snapper on french role with a sweet jelly and citrus aioli.   I would have never thought white fish and jelly would go together but I was so very wrong.  For desert with had their pineapple upside down cake with date ice cream, chocolate Creme Brulee, and finally the strawberry shortcake served in a jar.  This is my first review I have ever felt the need to write and I think that I need to work on my description because I certainly cannot describe the amazing flavors appropriately with words.  What I can do is encourage you to find out for yourself and enjoy every minute of it.

PAsgpOSEff4khi3yS7WGSA.text: Ain't nothin but a HounDuke, Yelpin all the time! Try the Flintstone sized ribs, and pardon the pun but, bring a Doggy Bag, it's a meal fit for a Great Dane!

wdZpSUtQ2Tq7NJiFi6hSmw.text: Excellent experience.  We loved the cauliflower, peppers, and cocktails.  The desert menu looked great but we were just having apps and drinks.

TOPC_HcXcJa4ZVV9DFGNVw.text: the atmosphere was wonderful and the service was excellent.  the food, not a flavorful as i  would have liked, for the price. a good place for an afterwork drink but thats it.

rScXARcWCX0PsgeQrUvXsQ.text: Went to Blue Hound a couple of nights ago for the first time with friends.  The hotel and restaurant had a cool and hip atmosphere.  We were seated promptly at our reservation time and the place was not crowded.  Our server was pleasant and knowledgeable and recommended several things on the menu including the special which was soft shell crab over an artichoke coulis with fiddlehead fern.  I ordered the special (and a shot of gazpacho) and the others at the table ordered a flatbread pizza and tater tots (yum!), the salmon, and the chicken.  When the salmon came out, it was such a tiny portion and my friend commented on it.  I had an option of ordering one or two crabs with my dinner and I opted for one after asking our server if it would be plenty of food.  I should have ordered two.  The food at Blue Hound is creative, ubber fresh, and delicious.  However, we all left still feeling hungry due to the small portion sizes.  We talked about ordering more food but the items are quite pricey and our bill was already over $100 without tip (only two of us had an alcoholic drink).  We eat out frequently at all of the new hip and trendy places that are opening all over Phoenix and feel that with all the other restaurants who are now offering creative farm to table food at  lower prices and larger (yet reasonably sized) portions, Blue Hound has some adjusting to do.  It would be a tough sell to get me to go back unless I knew our bellies would be full and our bill not so high.

K_mMkIbBEttezi_XBjm6gA.text: Went to Blue Hound for brunch today and I left  disappointed. I ordered the the brioche french toast ($12) and received one piece of toast that was marginal at best. If I am paying $12 for a piece of toast it better be exceptional, which was not at the case here. My husband ordered the spanish omelette which was decent, both portion size and taste wise, but the taste was still nothing great. His biggest complaint was that his coffee was not offered to be refilled one time. Service wasn't terrible but it was lacking, just as the food was. I really wanted to like this place but unfortunately I won't be going back.

5WEkKAiOTAmZoiWPTlQs3A.text: I was so excited when they built The Hotel Palomar at City Scape. I love the sustainable concept and reused materials and art that make it so unique.  The blue hound kitchen is a very hipster and very kool. Joe and I went there on our date night a few weeks back. I don't know the bartenders name but his handle bar mustache was fantastic I loved his style. This guy was absolutely talented. He wasn't your run of the mill cheesy bartender you normally run into out here. The drinks were awesome and unique... Joe ordered an oaxacan punch he loved it. next time we go we are trying the smith and wesson.

nYgd2RGqi7W2MKHzxkpe_Q.text: I agree with another poster who loved the urban vibe of this restaurant/bar. What a cool place! We had a reservation and were seated immediately. Once seated, we waited for a while for service. I flagged down the manager, and a server came over immediately. The drink menu is extensive with over 30 specialty drinks, so I decided to forgo my usual beer for a fancy beverage, a Absinthe Fizz. My husband stuck with a glass of Pino. When our drinks arrived, mine was frothy and delicious! I highly recommend trying this drink if you want something refreshing but not froo froo. We order the tater tots as an appetizer, per a suggestion from a Kimpton sales rep my husband met through work. I ordered the Yellowfin Tuna Carpaccio and my husband ordered the Kentucky Fried Quail. The tots were wonderful, but I really didn't get the sauce. It was cold and did not have much flavor. Our food arrived while we were working on our appetizer. The entrees were excellent! Portions are small, but were fine for a light dinner. We actually went across the street to Copper Blues for a drink, then we returned to Blue Hound for a nightcap. We ended up sitting in a cozy booth by the bar upon our return. We ordered the Mac N Cheese to split and Tommy's Margarita. The Mac N Cheese was wonderful, but the portion was quite small. On the flip side, the prices are super reasonable, so if you are really hungry, order 2 appetizers with your meal. A couple of kinks, which is to be expected when you choose to dine at a new restaurant.  There were many items on the menu I wanted to try, so we will definitely return!

X47nGjBOg6xYOQnAZtZaiQ.text: Love the vibe. It was so nice to sit on the deck and watch the ice skaters while enjoying my dinner. The bar looked like a cool place to hang out too. Good energy. Nice lighting and decor. The food was... Pretty good. I tried a number of appetizers. The deviled eggs were unexceptional. They tried doing something interesting with this sweet bacon in there but it could have used a bit more punch and a little less sweet. The deviled fried oysters also lacked that punch. But they were tasty on their own and nicely fried. The grits they came with were an odd accompaniment. The short rib sliders were quite good. Although again could have used some other flavor - some tartness or some spice to offset the umami short rib. The Brussels sprouts were outstanding! Sauteed with a Korean style barbecue sauce. Not too sweet, which I often find to be the case. I am definitely going to steal this recipe! I will probably go back and try an entree next time.

F8vBo0pdBdTg8vRiRt6p4A.text: We came here for a birthday party with an area that was reserved. The restaurant knew we were coming and expected a large cocktailing crowd. The problem was management only placed one cocktail server in this area and she was not well trained on service. We sat down and ordered a btl of wine, a beer, and two appetizers. The food arrived with no napkins or silverware. The bottle of wine arrived 15 mins after the food with no bucket of ice. The beer never arrived. I finally scolded the server and she brought a beer, but never brought out napkins, a manager never came and asked us if everything was ok, the food runner was the only person responsive. The food was ok but the service was pitiful! I ran several high end restaurants in NYC and would have been fired if I ran a restaurant like this place even for one night. If they do not get their act together it will be closed shortly! I won't go back!

HiMiX6tzvnWQZHWW27wKSQ.text: We went to the Blue Hound during Phoenix's Mardi Gras festival. Surprisingly the bar area was practically empty. There was a wedding party of approximately 8 people getting their picture taken at the bar while lifting champagne flutes but other than that the place was empty. Two bartenders were at the bar, I won't say working the bar as every open space at the bar (all seats except where the wedding party was) was cluttered with detritus from the previous patron and the bartenders were not doing anything but chatting with the wedding party. We stood at the bar (no one near us for ten feet to a side) yet were firmly ignored for 5 minutes. I guess they must have a different revenue stream than customers as they sure lost two that day. We went to Tom's Tavern across the street and had some great cocktails. I understand difficulty in getting service at a crowded bar, but come on, two customers at an empty bar and you never even greet them...

lzExGz5_hIve23p_fCgOtg.text: I was staying at the Palomar off-season and spent most of my time here at the bar, sauntering in after one activity or another and only had apps to eat. Also knew one of the cocktail servers.  Fantastic cocktail bar with an antique concoctions menu and bartenders who know how to make old school drinks, bartenders were friendly and knew a lot about their trade, tools and drinks which was both educational and unusual.  Place is a bit pricey for what I think you get but it is a Kimpton hotel bar so.  As a hotel bar it did the trick, neither amazed nor dissapointed.

e3L4bSrMEs0qDh5kgeQeWg.text: Perfect addition to downtown... Best margaritas, flatbread was superb and the service as superior.   Leave it to Kimpton to do it up right; very nicely done and we will be back many times over!

I9QLnDdXi7PN0SUYWRoCWQ.text: Fabulous decor inside. Really cool place. They had music, ( a very talented guy on guitar/vocals ) which was great. But from the moment we sat down, the service was slow and the food took 50 minutes to be served. The restaurant was not busy what so ever, so there was NO excuse. Just another example of a restaurant  with poor to no management. It seemed like the place was being run by a bartender, on waiter, and a cook..... So much potential, but they don't take their fine establishment seriously. The "bottomless" Bloody Mary seemed to be mostly mix, next to no vodka.

NNLfhhMLOm0-s-Fqa2ySLw.text: By far the BEST pineapple upside down cake I have EVER had. The ambiance of this restaurant is extremely modern and sleek. Overall I really enjoyed my experience at Blue Hound and will definitely be back soon to try more food!

5rI0iyiaS_XXAdL1z5NtCw.text: Good food and great service! We stopped in about 1/2 hour before the kitchen was going to close.  The menu was really intriguing, and set up so that you can order and share small plates.  We enjoyed the Kale Caesar, Roasted Cauliflower, and a flat bread.  We also had a delicious Chocolate Creme Brulee for dessert.  The atmosphere is really appealing and our waiter was helpful and friendly. We'd definitely go here again!

uK0ck0IpVlnH_Pgn2-RiPA.text: I was prepared to like the place.  The atmosphere was great, busy urban vibe, views of Cityscape (the ice skating helped), very different than the normal for a Valley restaurant.  The liquor choice were impressive, but the martinis were skimpy.  The service was spotty, at times a bit intrusive, at others, hard to find the waiter.  We sampled two appetizers.  The pulled pork johnny cakes were wonderful, the tater tots  not so much (they were more like hush puppies in texture).  I had the BBQ'D Kobe Beef Short Ribs for the entree and my dining companion had the New England Diver Scallops.  The ribs were quite tasty and went well with the bleu cheese grits, but were a bit fatty.  The scallops were a tad too salty and had some grit or shell.  Willing to try the place again because we enjoyed the environment, and this is a decent achievement for a downtown restaurant in a hotel, but there is room for improvement.

STPoKXlEOQHi8W7CW843hg.text: Nice comfortable place--itis what we need.  I think the service was slow and they need to improve on that.   First we had the pate.  It was ok a little dry and plalin.   The bread that was served with it was too hard. We had the trout-which was cooked perfectly and had just the right amount of spice.  My partner had the rositto which was great.  He also had the ceviche.  The ceviche was way too bland like the pate.  Maybe they are being careful on the spices.  It has only been open a few days so they need a chance to work out the bugs. If you like your food on the bland side you will enjoy the food.

MKQMMqAuMYUWmRtIrwZxSQ.text: I came to dinner  here  to celebrate my 33 year anniversary, unfortunately it was not a very good dining experience.    The first mistake was the confusion of this restaurant and its theme.   When I asked the waiter what the theme is ,he said it was like ordering Spanish tapa's a little bit of everything .. but when you look at menu I didn't see how that was possible... but ok. I was given a drink menu,  I was impressed with it.. but I'm more of a traditional mixed drink person. So I figured they must have a great bar service or fantastic bar tenders .   I ordered a Manhattan straight which just means without the ice.   Well somehow they got confused how to serve it  as I watching them they were pouring the drink  into a on the rocks glass so naturally it doesn't fill the glass because it's without the ice.. It was the funniest thing to watch .    So the waiter comes over with a look of concern and tells me they would like to serve it with the large ice cubes they offer.. at that point I just accepted the drink that way.. but all they needed to do was to serve it in a martini glass.   Now for my wife's drinks...    She orders a margerita  with a agave syrup the drink comes and it tasted sour no hint of agave  she sends it back.. she orders a plain Gin and tonic.. drink comes and guess what the tonic was flat..   so at 10 dollars a drink or more .. I would have expected something  extra ordinary instead we got something that you would order at your local gin mill.  Ordered the flatbread as an appetizer  it was really good so I figured ok let's forget about the drink fiasco..  Main course  Blacken sea bass.. It was good but filled with too many bones I had to pick at the fish with my hands so that I would not swallow  the bones.   My wife ordered the lamb meatballs she liked them and so did I  but not worth the price.  So what did like about this place..   our waiter was very good, the manager came over and bought us dessert because of the drinks fiasco, beautiful urban style setting.    Would I come back?  probably not..

s97kYAsLwfCzOSMx-lTBjA.text: Blue Hound is a nice casual dining restaurant that is a mix of cute and rustic with all the screaming football, baseball and basketball fans coming in and out to watch TV and drink some drinks.  I dined here 2x on my trip and thought both times it was very mediocre.  The Brussels and the cauliflower apps were my two favorite things on the menu.  The Brussels were great, they were dressed with a Cesar dressing and parm cheese.  The brussels were cooked perfectly both nights.  I was very pleased with these... I really could had these for my main meal with something else small on the side.  The first night I had the scallops and they were pretty decent, I would say just nothing special.  The 2nd time around I had the seabass and it was incredibly fishy.  I am a FISH GIRL... so fishy doesn't bother me, however the seabass was just not cooked incredibly well and I didn't think the flavors came together.  I thought the atmosphere was nice.  The drinks were pretty good too!

TVHD1o2-XZh3alZbtZvNlw.text: The Sea Bass was exquisite!  Perfect combination of flavors. By far was the wonderful service from James!!

uOJ_7FDfFIEGIlLxQu_v8A.text: One night I stop in for a couple drinks and some thing to eat. The food was really good and the best part of the night was the bartender Rob he  was very nice and the drinks were great He shore know how to make a drink. I will definitely be back at least you get a few drinks as long as Rob is the he really know how to make a customer feel welcome.

vw7BANquaUnnhTLZ_gYkxQ.text: I came into Blue Hound recently and I received spectacular service. Rob was friendly, professional, attentive, and very helpful with recommendations. I had a delicious meal and a fantastic cocktail. The atmosphere was perfect. I definitely will be back with others.

oPVTZB6MlpoIm1M839CSjw.text: Ask for Rob, his old fashioned's will change your life. Came here with my now fiancee!!!!!! Finally!! A man who can drink like I can!

aWlncU5bcDPyVzzIcE8iQw.text: Best service ever. Jackson and bobby were very attentive and willing to answer any drink questions. Would come back anytime and refer to anyone.

cbOUB02r8Zs2YvBSI3ZL7Q.text: This place is great! Service was fast and courteous. I loved the old fashion. Rob A was the perfect bartender! Will definitely return.

OFfP6hGsEemr6bue4M-IiA.text: This is the third time that we went to the restaurant and I have to say whoever hires people here now needs to get fired. HORRIBLE service. Hostess has no idea what she is doing and let's get real she's not performing brain surgery here. We decided to sit at the bar and only two seats were open, both of which the bartender was saving for his friends. What a mess.

1B_mSU9PZgE-HZqJv4R2lg.text: Great new, hip spot in downtown Phoenix!  I was so excited when I heard a Hotel Palomar was coming and couldn't be happier with the way it turned out.  The atmosphere is hip, relaxing and just plain cool.  The bartenders/staff are very friendly and efficient.  The cocktail menu is extensive and I was not disappointed.  The summer smash was well made and very refreshing.  This will definitely be one of my "go to" places in my downtown neighborhood.

k0IZ-iZ9gEj81qZETjRtBA.text: Waw. That's all you can really say about the quality of food at blue hound. The restaurant certainly lives up to its name ... When you get your food you will feel blue... And it will look more for a hound than a human. My food had no flavor and literally came out hotter than the a Kim Kardashian Instagram selfie... She actually might have been the head chef because the meal totally lacked creativity and taste.

P2lIpi-5ZpaWfxEPAMcjpw.text: Great restaurant located in downtown Phoenix. Close walking distance to local sports and other great bars/restaurants. The Blue Hound has a nice, relaxing atmosphere and a menu that puts spins on some classic ingredients. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a different menu in the downtown area.

2p0g4Cyr5ZCO0xwFlut-eA.text: Good place been to Blue Hound a few times.  This Sunday went for Brunch. They were out of Short Rib Hash. Disappointing. I might call ahead next time. Party of 11 took up most of the customer service. I will visit again but I will make sure all of menu is available.

xitZnzgzq7w502wLA2MFGQ.text: Had high hopes, but we were very disappointed in Blue Hound.  My husband treated me to VIP tickets for Train at Comerica so I treated him to dinner prior to the show....so wanted this place to be great.  Our creds: late 30's executives...DINK's so we enjoy fine dining often. Favorite Gastro-pub in Valley: Citizen Public House Scottsdale...also love Cowboy Caio in Scottsdale.  Pros: - walking distance to downtown venues - industrial chic decor - best cocktail menu I have ever seen  Cons: - Ironically, the food. Appetizers: pork bellies and cheddar biscuit apps. Pork bellies...we KNOW pork bellies...all over foodie menus across town...these were like rubber bacon. If you want fantastic pork bellies, go to Citizen Public House or Arrogant Butcher. Cheddar biscuits were good but nothing interesting. Dinner: husband had pork neck..it was nice looking but very ordinary and bland. I had Fried Quail...it was yummy...tasted exactly like KFC...came with cold corn bread, cold gravy and precisely 5 cold beans...could not taste the foie gras in the cornbread. Husband asked for bread to have with his pork neck soup...server said they didn't have bread but he would ask the kitchen...he came back with 2 tiny crostinis in a soup bowl...dry, tasteless, odd.  - The service. Hostess (on 9/30 at 5pm) tried to seat us in an almost empty dining room at the one table right next to the table bussing station. REALLY? We asked for another table and she said we can't have any other table because she had to save those for groups of 4...completely understood so we took a table in a far corner. 5 minutes later she sat a couple at the 4-up...she was also unfriendly and didn't seem to want to be there. Our server was blah and wasn't at all passionate about the menu options...Servers at Arrogant Butcher are awesome!  In closing...if you want a fantastic foodie meal in downtown, go to Arrogant Butcher...if you are in Scottsdale, go to Citizen Public House..ENJOY!

7p3ApPQb0MII-PoC_lW91Q.text: Great place for happy hour.  Came in with some coworkers on Thursday and had a great time.  Rob makes the best Old Fashion I've ever had. Greg made one of my coworkers a Lawless and they loved it as well.  Definitely going to make this a regular stop.

-wR9qgF0RepvdNVylc0Plg.text: If you can handle a little douchbaggery, this place is great! Fun foodie menu. OUTSTANDING bar menu. Artisan drinks all the way and bartenders (hehem sorry, mixologists) who really care about the craft. Highly reccomend!

yGfY1dvyY3sV-uvAw6uA-A.text: Had another wonderful evening at blue hound!! I've been there once before. Ambiance is like no other in Phoenix and Chris W. was amazing! Make sure to try the Lost Melody :)

7sITvpckTY4kOLDsBsAClg.text: Overall I liked this bar and will for sure go back.  The food was unique and the service was "as expected" given the recent opening and a quite busy bar.  The drink selection was vast and both of my drinks were unique and tasty.  I was horribly distracted by one of the bartenders (who was called the "master mixologist" within her earshot by our adorable bartender who looked like Sandra Bullock).  It seemed she had developed the cocktail list, which was impressive, but witnessing her snooty attitude and condescending interactions with the staff, my drink suddenly tasted as bitter as her personality.

KGZ_CmL-CXyRiYfInlVOLA.text: The atmosphere is great...the food is not so great- a little bit too experimental and not quite getting it right. The tater tots are the only thing I'd order again. No to the flapjacks, the cornbread salad combo, and the red snapper. Maybe next time, l'll just come for cocktails like others recommended...

nqcMIjguzmZiXkAIWGbKrw.text: The atmosphere is very upscale/romantic. The menu is limited but in a good way. Try the homemade pasta - it's unreal!

e5SCLs4IqkF5mXfpHrJm9A.text: Date night done right. The hotel was sold out, so needless to say the restaurant was packed. Which is a good sign! We had an extremely knowledgeable bartender that helped us order drinks and food. We had the shishito peppers and fried green tomatoes with crab. Ended with the Arctic Char. Amazing service and amazing drinks.

JOCcQmvJCytWrto6CpDLXg.text: A Foodie Delight  This is my third time at Blue Hound and haven't been dissapointed yet. Being across from US Airways Center and the ballpark make this one of the top choices before an event. The Pork Belly sliders are my go to for every trip.  It is a great place to taste a few different things when you are with a group.  Our server this time was Caleb and helped us narrow down our selections.  And though Sangria is not on their menu (it should be) they whipped a very tasty one up for me.  The only negative thing I could come up with is the noise level.  It is a fun place to be but the acoustics can make it a little hard to hear.

Td9eEh_l6KCp5vpogvwTHw.text: Blue Hound blew my mind!  I know it has been said 100 times, but this really IS what downtown needs. No more chains or mediocre hotel restaurants - but a classy, unique downtown destination with an honest to goodness "mixologist" running the bar.    They offer a decent sized happy hour menu featuring about 6 of their cocktails at 6 bucks a pop, $3 beers, and $6 flatbreads,. I had a smashing good time with my Summer Smashes and enjoyed tastes of all the well crafted cocktails my friends ordered.  We were even given an ice bucket for a can of beer (classy! Like I said!). The flatbread was so flavorful and rich, even though it was a bit on the small size.  Our waiter, Zack, handled our large party very well and didn't bat an eye when we asked for separate checks.   Nicely split sections with a lounge, bar, and restaurant Blue Hound can host a variety of different moods and a cocktail for every occasion!

w7yeyWe6dEJZy8IP2gcfgQ.text: I was really excited to find an Oyster po'boy downtown. However, I was really disappointed by the po'boy. The bread tasted like the burnt flat top, the oysters were soggy and not cleaned and the remoulade was not very flavorful. The fries were overpowered by the rosemary and parmesan. Overall, everything was a greasy soggy mess. I was very disappointed by my $16.00 lunch bill. Two stars are for the great service I received.

wGSr3gYtaPQIRENLPVnWaw.text: We started out with the Shishito peppers which have been amazing every time I've had them. Then Moved onto the Pork Shank and the then the homemade pasta & the Elote..  All AMAZING

nl0NA0yUj9T0D-ZBsTxFjQ.text: I really love the concept of "tapas", and Blue Hound has American-ized it.  The menu is a collection of interesting dishes that can be ordered by size, and are meant to be shared with your table.    Definitely try the bacon jam biscuits with the quail egg - easily the best thing I've ever eaten in Phoenix, a True gem.  The flat breads were decent.  Also had the BBQ ribs and homemade tots - all of which were tasty in small quantities, which is exactly what tapas are meant to be.  The atmosphere is a bit hotel-ish and overly modern hipster.  Even the wait staff is overly-casual in attire, although they were all quite friendly and attentive.  This is a great place to take a date and show off - check it out

hS6ECPNisaBqshmvJwAPAQ.text: While the first time I came here was a solid 3 stars, the second time was very enjoyable. This time I ordered the cheese board and just like the last time, there were like 3 cheeses, pistachios, another kind of nut, jam, bread, etc. Very good and plentiful. Last time, we ordered the warm mixed nuts that were really good but I couldn't eat too much of it. My husband ordered this pork dish that had hominy, and I don't remember what else but it was freakin awesome. I kept eating out of his skillet. Yum. My $10 specialty cocktail was knock me on my ass strong but good. I gave it to my husband after while because I would have been drunk just off the one. I guess that is a good problem to have. The service was top-notch. She was just the right amount of attentive and did a great job. The decor was bright and modern. I really enjoyed this last experience.

2XdehctXG9OrY4hoEf07Iw.text: A friend of mine and I decided to have dinner at Blue Hound Sunday night. We figured it would be steady but slow enough to enjoy dinner.  The decor itself is amazing! Very well decorated and unique, from the lighting fixtures to the coffee tables.  The food of course, was the best part of the night. Sergio was our server, and was able to help us by explaining the drink menu and the dinner menu. He made great suggestions for both, noting that for the dinner menu, it was more tapas and family style which works best for me. Sergio was also very attentive through out the night.  The Summer of Shandies cocktail was very yummy that I might just try to replicate it at home. We tried a number of dinner items, all which were full of different but great flavors. My favorites though, were the tomato heirloom salad, zucchini corn dogs,and  the short rib. For dessert, I would recommend the cake n shake. the cake part is definitely sharable but the shake, too good to share :)  Both managers that were on the floor, Cheyenne and Matt, even stopped by to check how our evening was going.  For the quality and the attention to detail that is spent to create the variety of cocktails and food, the value is definitely justified.  I cannot stress enough how wonderful the service was and how delicious the food tasted. I will definitely be back for dinner and to try out Lustre the pool bar!

usUk5EK0_71RWc_wnCpiXQ.text: I'll comment on something that was great first - the decor! Very modern but warm with wood, glass and metal. It's a bit loud, but it was Friday night, so pretty busy. The seating was comfortable, nice looking bar, etc. The the lighting over the bar area was gorgeous.   I really wanted to like this restaurant - Phoenix Magazine certainly did...it's on their Top 10 New Restaurants list in the current issue. From the raving review, it sounded great -- so a group of us hopped on the Metro and headed downtown to try it Friday night.   To sum it up, Phoenix magazine needs to hire new food critics - this is not one of the top 10 new restaurants in Phoenix this year.   The service was mediocre. The waiter forgot 2 dishes, and was irritated because we were trying to figure out who owed what on the bill...while we had our coffee.  For appetizers, we had the Tater tots, deviled eggs & the caramel corn for appetizers: The tater tots were very flavorful. The deviled eggs were okay, but not great. Just not spiced well. The caramel corn was really good with the chili pepper and caramel sort of blending together.    The short ribs on a bed of blue cheese grits was really very good, probably the best thing on the menu.  The pork neck was bland. The ceviche was not very chilled, and also tasted bland. The Kale salad was ok, but kinda just a big pile of chopped kale with dressing on it and a few croutons tossed on top. Two people had the mac & cheese and thought it was good, but the serving was really small.   The wine I had was pretty good, but they didn't have the one on the menu that I wanted so suggested the wine they'd replaced it with. (only the replacement wine was $12 a glass & the one I'd wanted was $8!)  Several other people had cocktails and they all enjoyed them. So I'm thinking the bar is probably the highlight of this restaurant!  Sorry, but Blue Hound is just not even near the top 10 new restaurants.

GZQYrd_E3PxujBUeVYQ3KA.text: A few friends and I stopped in for drinks before the Phoenix Mercury game the other night. Rob and Michael were super helpful, answering all of our stupid questions regarding the cocktails even though it was pretty busy in there. We got well lubricated on this yummy vodka drink - "Lost Melody" I believe it was called. We didn't try any food, but I definitely recommend coming here for drinks, the bartenders are awesome!

FEpI8wq1DU0JwflKFEnIEA.text: The food was certainly good. I really like the South meets Southwest concept. The dining room and bar are pretty small, so the atmosphere is lively even if there are only a few tables occupied and a few guests at the bar. I think its a really good idea to offer most dishes in a small or standard size - perfect for sharing and portion control.   The service is still a work in progress, I believe. Its a new restaurant, so its still getting into the swing of things.   We saw Chef Stephen Jones working in the kitchen and I thought that it was cool that he was there personally overseeing the kitchen.   We tried the highly recommended Kentucky Fried Quail and the Tater-tots. The quail was delicious! But all of the accompaniment were a little bland I thought.   Overall the food was innovative and delicious- but somehow a little less than what I expected from "one of the best new restaurants in Phoenix."

EDzF0ZGA5D2B6l2maM_y0Q.text: Chris W was a fantastic waiter. The dude killed it. Would come back and ask for his service.

Sl6w0IxuSSweI5hM-U5dkg.text: I really really wanted to love this place but I just can't give it more than 3 stars.  I shouldnt have been so surprised for the cost of my meal but I have to say - I left the restaurant with buyer's remorse - I paid that for that?  The tater tots had such potential but needed a bit of something more. And I was disappointed with the Mac and Cheese portion and again the perception that something was missing to really take this dish over the top.  My husband loved his hamburger.  Tip:  If you are gloing to be known for your cocktails, please make sure you have the ingredients in stock.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ITHBDoOJ7A8oYn6PYeGUyw.text: Before a Suns game recently, my Family and I stopped into Blue Hound for some drinks and appetizers.  We attempted to go to Arrogant Butcher (been there many times), but it was packed.  Having heard good things from another family member, we decided to give Blue Hound a try, and I'm glad we did.  The inside decor is trendy and simple.  We sat at the couch by the door (since that was what was available) and were quite comfortable - except for the occasional draft from the door.  Our waitress was ok, she wasn't entirely too friendly, but she took care of our needs.  As for the food, we ordered pretty much all the appetizers.  The biggest highlight was the scones with bacon jam.  In fact, it was so good, it's inspired me to make these two things at home to see if I can replicate it.  We also had the popcorn, which was good and the sliders, which were alright.  The pizza with duck was great (could have been crisper) as was the other items we had.  Based on the previous reviews it seems this place, being new, might be hit or miss.  I'd say give it a try if you're in the area... why not?  Trust me, it's worth a visit for the cheddar scallion scones with bacon jam!

taTglQ2XNTtDOvECRZRkhQ.text: I went here with a group of friends for a Sunday breakfast a few weekends ago and it was a pleasant experience. We had to wait a bit for everyone to show up and there was ample, comfortable seating especially as this is connected to the hotel right next to it. The decor is very trendy and modern with a mish-mash of great furniture the comes of looking lovely.   The selection for breakfast was a nice variation and everyone seemed to enjoy what they got. It is a bit pricey here, for example a small glass of apple juice was abut $4 but personally that's why I just stick to water wherever I go. Our waitress did seem a bit scatter-brained but the service was good. I don't normally get a chance to try out places in downtown Phoenix so I'm glad our friends suggested this place. If I had a chance to go here again I wouldn't hesitate.

JFAD0GZT_53UslUa_9lMhA.text: I almost cried during my meal here because Phoenix needs this restaurant SO BADLY.  It's hip and kind of elegant at the same time with stylized comfort food that's familiar but new at the same time.    The cheddar scallion biscuits with bacon jam and a sunny side up quail egg...sublime!  Basil risotto was simply perfect and a great vegetarian option.  And while the lemon blueberry cheesecake was good, the accompanying tortilla ice cream changed my life; I could have eaten an entire plate of the ice cream alone.  Blue Hound is attached to the new Hotel Palomar, which is also well worth a visit, if only to see the ultra cool Arizona wing back chairs which I now want for my living room!

9bQyLfUkWgz0sKT1BTYHwQ.text: We had friends come into town for a visit. We took them to Blue Hound for lunch. We had an amazing experience!  The food was great and fresh. My son had the BHKC BLT. It was amazing with green fried tomatoes.  I had the crab cake sandwich with a salad. The service was awesome also. They were friendly and fast with their services. We highly recommend the Blue Hound!

IoXCi9UvmEUoL5Uh8hsUVQ.text: My wife I came here for the first time today. The food is different which is what we like. Good food! Good bloody Mary's! Good Service!

Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great crab
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love the pork and egg nachos

KErFTfsLXB-7x8quHuZgvQ.text: Slow Service and Overpriced  Two and a half hours and $136 for 10oz of alcoholic beverages, 6 tator tots, flatbread, dry chicken and cold steak.  I went here with my wife for our 5-yr dating anniversary.  We had a $50 gift card, and I naively came here thinking we would have a "free" meal, but it didn't even cover half the price of our dining experience. The drinks we got were good, but they just cost too much for the tiny little glass of cocktail you get.  My wife's amaretto sour couldn't have been more than 2 or 3 ounces, and it cost $15.  So yeah, you pay a lot for little cutesy cocktails. The tator tots and flatbread were probably the best things we got ($20 for those two items). My wife got the herb roasted chicken for $24 and the chicken was pretty bland and dry.  I got the flat-iron steak ($30), which tasted really good.  The only problem was it was cold-well, cool rather.  But it was as if the steak had been sitting on my plate for 25 minutes before I got it, which may be just what happened.  It took an hour to get our food after we ordered it.  After 55 minutes of waiting, I had to leave to go re-fill our parking meter, so I got to get some exercise in the middle of our dining experience.  It was like our outside table was forgotten.   Our waiter was great, but he had a bunch of inside tables, so we just hardly ever saw him.  My water glass was usually empty, and we were typically waiting a while before we could order something. The atmosphere is cool, and I did enjoy the tator tots and the taste of my steak.  If the whole meal had been closer to $50, and if the service had been faster, I could give this place 4-5 stars probably.  But as it was, it was just too expensive for what we got.

c2NFg_yOtNwzXYq_rBBAlQ.text: I'm staying at the hotel and often try this restaurant. Very uneven quality, in my opinion. I ordered some chicken bites last night and they were completely undercooked. Super gross! In addition, the woman who sat me at my table was most unpleasant. She did not smile or offer any friendly advice. Two nights in a row she was equally rude, and I am a nice and handsome guy! I have had a decent meal here before, and the wait staff has been very nice. Bottom line: you're taking your chances at this place. They are a bit big for their britches.

rP3-fVu7qNHc9t0FMpHHNA.text: When the cats at Cityscape want a posh drink and food, no better place than the Hound. Thanks Blue Hound for the many years of grand service and food. Get your Hound on.

v3LbC7ZADcOVmk5zIPwSjg.text: We stopped in at Blue Hound on a Friday night, surprised to find it much less busy than expected. We seated ourselves at the side bar and were promptly greeted and given menus. The cocktail list is intriguing and extensive, without being overwhelming. The food menu had a number of great options--a mix of comfort food and little plates that all sounded delicious. We went with the cheese board, which--at $22--was a bit pricey, was well worth it. It was comprised of 3 different cheeses(a manchego, an aged cheddar, and a delightfully funky sheeps' milk cheese), plus marcona almonds, prosciutto, Granny Smith Apple slices, dates, coarse mustard, pickled green beans, pickled peppers, and a lovely spiced flatbread and a soft brown bread. I ordered the Brown Derby, a bourbon based cocktail that was exactly what I'd been craving--a wonderful balance of sweet and tangy. Hubby had the Zombie, and it was the best Zombie we've ever had. Overall, Blue Hound is the perfect spot for date night--laid back but still romantic and interesting(without being pretentious), and the service was top notch.

c8qP9610Pk5i8U1v7Frf-g.text: I have a few friends that Rave about this place I've been wanting to try it for a while now find it in I was little skeptical at first cuz the hostess was not very friendly to say the least had a sour look on her face overall unfriendly never spoke to us one time as we are walking to the table the server was okay at best didn't really know much about the menu ask what would a duck wings I don't know their duck I figured that much out myself and you know I'm getting probably one of the best burgers I've had in a long time pretty decent size I would say 8 oz like the bun not too squishy not too firm lightly toasted and super juicy I would say I would rank in the top 10 had to Fry's with it was not impressed really soggy and too salty no bueno a funny thing the water was probably the best one I've ever had wish I had their filtering system on my house definitely go back to the Burger maybe next time I'll sit at the bar

4mLE_Uy9OX9kHwBiS1JOSg.text: You know what I love? I love it when you decide to try a new, kinda pricey restaurant, and they just KNOCK IT outta the park! Blue Hound was such an exceptional experience on Wednesday evening, that I went back on Thursday. What else do you need to know, right?  With a funky but upscale relaxed atmosphere, the Blue Hound compliments the Kimpton Palomar hotel in which it resides. If you've stayed at a Kimpton, then you know that they have a great understanding of what's important, and what's not. Is the decor in this place a little jumbled? Absolutely. Are the servers simply first class? You betcha.  Oh yeah, the food...   ;)   The first funny thing you'll notice about the Blue Hound is the menu - the left page has a bunch of food dishes listed, but the right page... hmmm, this looks like ALL cocktails...!?!? Yep, the entire right page of this simple menu is cocktails -- and for good reason. The cocktails here are just epic! And the food -- while clearly playing a supporting role -- carries the experience superbly. The appetizers are unique, delish, and fun. The entrees are very hearty portions, and with exceptional presentation and flavor.  Particulars? Too many to cataloge, but now these. The pork chop entree is simply massive -- it's actually two pork chops. Totally wonderful, but consider sharing. Shrimp and grits was the bomb. Shishito peppers appetizer was novel and fun to all. Boudin balls were gobbled up before you could blink. Heck, you could just order 2 appetizers per diner and be more than satisfied.  And oh yeah.... someone in your party MUST order a "Lawless." On my first visit, that someone was me, and I was thrilled with my choice. The Lawless is a rye cocktail that's embellished with -- ready for this? -- vanilla tobacco smoke. The cool part is not just how fun it is to watch them prep it, it's that the smoke MAKES the drink!  Blue Hound is a little pricey, but if you are in downtown and want a great meal, it's more than worth it. Next time I'm in Phoenix, I will definitely plan to eat -- and drink! -- here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;The&#34; pork chop. It&#39;s actually TWO pork chops, so you&#39;d better be hungry! It&#39;s prepared perfectly, but ask for an extra side of chimmichuri.
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The &#34;Lawless&#34; cocktail, with vanilla tobacco smoke filling the glass and the pour in process. Absolutely EPIC drink -- a MUST TRY here.

HvJrK7RKyCB2pnuKT9D71A.text: I'm staying at the hotel so I thought I'd give it a try. Hip atmosphere overall. I had a nice lunch with a view of downtown. I had the chop salad made with locally grown greens, pepitas, cotija cheese and grilled chicken. Good size portion enough for two. It was tasty and fresh. I also have the deviled eggs which were beautifully presented. Not really the traditional flavor but still pretty good. I'm curious to try their dinner now.
