b7sR4-sgbp6BC_ODAik7sg.text: I don't even know where to start this review...every single item that I had was carefully crafted and delicious from my cocktail to my entree!   I'd bookmarked Blue Hound on the recommendation of a colleague and jumped at the opportunity to take a friend there from out of town. The hostess who sat is was warm and friendly as she walked us to our table. We were about 15 minutes late for our reservation and had a good joke once we arrived. Once we were seated, per usual we are talking more than paying attention to the menu; however, Christopher was still very attentive and not overbearing.   For a cocktail I had the Lawless and it did not disappoint!! The frozen glass over a tobacco skillet and the whiskey poured after was the perfect balance and was amazing.   For appetizers, we ordered deviled eggs and pork ribs. The eggs had a sweet bacon pop in the middle that gave the last bite that WOW effect and the pork ribs were perfect.   For my entree I ordered the blackened salmon and the fish along with its pairings just had all my senses in overdrive!!!   I must admit navigating to the restaurant was a bit confusing at first but, I'd only knock off a .1 of a star! Now that I know exactly where it is, I should have no problems but my friend will say I'm logistically challenged no matter what!

3FIkSYip5tMg7Q2-Pch9bA.text: The location of this place is fantastic, especially this time of year. It over looks the ice skating rink downtown.   The food was pretty good, although I felt it was a little costly for the food served.   The seared tuna salad was pretty good.

t8aTq5lu-senpme_Tad7hg.text: Didn't even realize this was a hotel restaurant until I started my review! Went for dinner with co-workers and we had a great meal. For starters we ordered the Shishito Peppers which were good, but not charred enough for my liking. Everyone else loved them! We ordered the grilled pork belly and fried oysters as well. Both were delicious. For our meals we ordered the Arctic Char and Prime Flat Iron, all were mouthwateringly good! Drinks were plenty and they have a great wine menu. WHen I'm in Phoenix again, i will definitely be back!

uvU0xZvhvBpoysDnogr6Dw.text: Bland food service was OK left hungry I know I sound like I'm complaining but place felt stuffy and staff acted like they were doing us a favor.

r7vqa-XbkDjcnj-zeDXAwQ.text: Great lounge to have delicious cocktails!  Great drinks and yummy food - shrimp and grits was very tasty. I ordered quite a few sidecars...  Staff is polite and on point. DTPHX has great places where you can jump around to!

5Ne-dme4VdwCXFoBxwxTKA.text: Loved this place. We used open table to reserve a table for two and got a nice private one with a view. Everyone was so friendly. Loved the appetizers of fried green tomatoes with crabmeat and the deviled eggs with bacon jam. The handcrafted cocktails were amazing and a great compliment to the meal. I enjoyed the flat iron and my nephew had the pappardelle. We were too stuffed for dessert but they sounded very satisfying. This was a great way to cap off our amazing Arizona vacation!

loxLsvKWSwzdSPff6TYKKw.text: The service was great the waitresses were so knowledgeable about the food! Everything I ordered was super awesome including the desserts and drinks  I will definitely be back!

_ulCJmRchu6VlEHqKnqf0g.text: Came her to wind down after a busy day on a Saturday night.  I had been to this spot with friends about 6 months ago and wanted to give it another shot.  Sure glad I did. The bartenders were great and very attentive - you could tell they really wanted to make sure everyone was taken care of at the bar.  Then have a great selection of bourbons - I went with Blantons and Hudson Baby Bourbon.  Got a little hungry later and ordered the shrimp and grits which were outstanding - the shrimp, andouille sausage, grits, everything was on point.  Saved half of it for the next day.  This place does a nice job and they seem to only be getting better.  Will return soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing shrimp and grits.   Get some!

XUa1JMjYtq4xMNVsqvia2g.text: My 1st time in Phoenix and this is the 1st place I chose to eat at. And my my my am I satisfied with this restaurant. From being greeted right when I walked in, the beautiful bar, the restaurant set up, the music, the vibes. The restaurant is modern with a rustic feel. Loved all the wood. My server Daniel was AMAZING! He was so genuine, friendly, welcoming and knowledgeable about ALL the menu items, as well as the area. He also suggested a few cool bars in the area to check out which was really helpful. I ate the deviled eggs and the BLT w/salad, the ahi tuna, brussel sprouts, flatbread and sliders. Didn't wait long for the food at all and the food was QUALITY. On top of having a great experience, as I just left the restaurant I ran into a gentlemen wearing a blue hound uniform outside, his name was Logan. And he is one of the sou chefs. I told him the food was sooo good, and we chatted a bit. He was nice and told me to come back, so I came back that evening with my friend once she landed. I enjoyed both times eating here, 5 stars across the board. Thank you Blue Hound for your hospitality...I will be back! :)  -Britney Valerio

zB71V3Hl0_GHoe09w3FK6Q.text: Delicious! Great service and the food was wonderful. Love the variety of menu options as well.

-IC1_y3G8NlneCln5nBkew.text: There were three of us and we're seated promptly at our reservation time.  Waitress was very attentive and needed to be told to slow it down, that we were in for a lesierly meal.   For appetizers we had the fried green tomatoes with lump crab meat ( dreams are made from these - delicious ) and also the deviled eggs ( good - but too cold ).  For entree I had the shrimp & grits - had to remember my manners and not lick the bowl clean.  Also ordered by our guest was, as she called it, "The Pig", it was the chop - literally fell of the bone.  She said the gravy was very good.  A great place to bring a client or out for a nicer evening with your spouse / date.  BTW, very nice scotch selection!

sHCwZ2G_-_C2v9YfsWkKtg.text: My partner and I visited Phoenix this past weekend. Right before our flight back home on Monday evening, we wanted to grab a quick bite and beer during happy hour time, and stumbled upon Blue Hound (more like read many Yelp reviews on good happy hours nesrby). Walking in to the place, we were caught off guard because it is very beautful inside with very high ceilings - and a very business dinner, elegant date type vibe. Seeming to be underdressed (who would have though for a happy hour), we were greeted upon arrival and quickly seated - in a perfect little secluded two-seat table overlooking downtown. The happy hour menu was simple with delicious bites and decent drink specials - we had the chicken wings, mac and cheese, and shisito peppers with their Blue Hound beer. The chicken wings were cooked to the perfect texture with the right amount of sauce I was looking for (not smothered), the mac and cheese was of a white cheddar variety topped with cheetos - this was a little runny but delicious nonetheless, but my partner felt ir would've went well with some bread, and the shisito peppers were cooked to perfection with a very simple seasoning - I'm used to these with salt and these didn't have that which I liked but others may not. Lastly, their house beer was only $5 during happy hour and it was a very solid beer for a lighter variety - had great substance without being watery or off flavor. Looking over their regular menu, I wished we had more time because the plates sounded delicious, and I was confident they would come through with the same quality as their happy hour menu food. We had the pleasure of being attended by Carolina. Her level of attentiveness was of perfection - She checked in at all the right times in a very genuine, professional, yet laid-back fashion. She made sure everything was brought out quickly and even made some awesome recommendations if we wanted to replicate the shisito peppers after my partner inquired about the seasoning. She definitely made our visit that much more special. We will be back again to try dinner if we're ever back in the area :)

ytlkh1rlcZOow7iu3m9hDQ.text: I can't tell you how amazing our waiter James is. We had such an amazing time. James guided us through so many gorgeous craft cocktails. Seriously, order the "lawless". Stephanie, their drink MASTER, whipped up what I assume is a tobacco voodoo orgasm concoction. You will not be disappointed.   Thanks so much for the amazing drinks, the phenomenal tater tots  and all the laughs James!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

pqPffL7URFnXHX-JOoY2Mg.text: Had Colleen as our server. We were celebrating my birthday and she went out of her way to make sure our meal was special.  The chef accommodated my request to switch side dishes with another entree.  We stayed in the hotel (Hotel Palomar) and that was amazing as well. A great staycation!!

nEzxAEC6i8AB_VspDgx_ZA.text: The first time we visited this place they treated us a little weird upon our arrival but once we were seated service was very good. We visited again this summer and our experience was better. We both had the flank or skirt steak, something like that. A little disappointing that they don't have ribeye or filet. They have an interesting menu but they have very limited options. We also had the shishito peppers. We were staying at the Regency hotel nearby, so I don't have details about the parking situation, it will probably be paid parking.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Steak from the menu, skirt steak I think

BcK5SIdZirw21QV4yXns4w.text: Food: 4 Service: 4 Value: 4  Found this place on a whim as my team and I were traveling here for work. A quick summary: great atmosphere, versatile enough to host dates as well as larger groups, a menu that could feed any type of consumer, and a full bar to help pair your food with the best wine or create a fun cocktail.   Coming this a large group, we of course started with appetizers. This is where my only complaint lies - we were served a meta and cheese board, but they never told us what the different meats and cheeses were... we had to guess and the waiter also wasn't familiar when we asked. Past this, the food, atmosphere, and value were all spot on. And if you do go, you cannot miss their homemade pies. The crust literally melts in your mouth with the amount of butter baked into it.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork Pork Shank
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seared Tuna
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Artisian Meat &amp; Cheese Board

k_sv117VpjPCEkHm3VdRpw.text: Walked in at 8:15 on a Monday evening after doing a day trip and was in search of apps and beers. Comfortably busy we found two seats at the long bar table across from a video roadie who was with Muse and Walk the Moon. (FYI The Talking Stick Arena is across the street.) The waitress was very prompt. She didn't have a beer/wine list, but we told her what we wanted, a Weiss beer and a stout. She didn't have either, and brought us samples of beers similar. That was nice, but didn't get the names. All we know is that one was a lager, the other a wheat beer. Ordered a shrimp cocktail and Mac and cheese. Both were good. The venue is modern and stylish with the large bar in front and restaurant tables in the back. Check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mac and cheese in a small crock.
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lots of bar drink selections
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Really tasty shrimp.

tru7Why7vecz7D8qJFaVzQ.text: We just stopped in after sushi to get dessert. It's a nice set up very elegant and the desert was actually pretty good. We got what I believe was a fig cake with a side of ice cream and pudding which was lightly honey with strawberry and it was also really good. Of the two we liked the pudding more.   It'd be nice to check out the rest of the menu options down the line :)

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pudding and fig cake with their respective side of ice cream.

VhcmvCwJ532k8MrHMEFRMQ.text: Excellent food and excellent service.  The ambiance was excellent as well. My husband and I went for dinner. They sat us in the dinning area...which allowed us to have a nice dinner for two. The have a bar and lounge area were others were watching the basketball ball game. My husband and the filet migon and I had the salmaon. Both were prepared to perfection.

9aN2YKOU6fZiwtqyYtVc8Q.text: This spot came up during my research of tasty food, and also recommended by locals. There was a blue hound dog welcoming us next to the host/hostess station. The first area is occupied mainly by a large bar. They had a few happy customers enjoying some drinks.  They had two dining areas, one with the bar and the back room which seems to be the main dining area. The space is pretty dim, producing relaxing and romantic atmosphere.  The cocktail menu had a name and description of the drink on one page, followed by the photo of each drinks. It was nice to be able to see what the cocktails would look like before deciding which one to order. I actually picked the cocktail from the photo, since I knew I wanted one with egg whites on top. I went with a cocktail named Lion King. I loved the egg whites, exactly what I wanted! It was topped with black berry which was a bit sour. The cocktail itself was really tasty, sweet and elegant, delicious cocktail.  For food, I decided to order two appetizers as both appetizers and main, so that I can try more than one items without stuffing myself. I ordered Corn Grit Fries and Pulled Pork Sliders.  Portion of the Corn Grits was more than enough to share, my co-worker also got to have couple of pieces. It was a bit too heavy to stay in one piece, as I tried to pick it up with a fork. It was tasty but I think I had a too high of an expectation, that it didn't wow me. Pulled Pork Sliders were much better, very tasty and comforting. Really enjoyed it!    I ended the dinner with a dessert called BHKC Pudding. It was simple but very tasty. Creamy and velvety with nice firm consistency. Nice way to end the pleasant meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JQD0SZTfVmKp--2kDM8pcg.text: My fiancee and I went here a few months ago, and I still feel compelled to write a good review after all this time.  First, the drinks are amazing.  Unbelievable bar tender.  I had some gin drink (can't remember it's name) that had an ice cube with a piece of rosemary frozen into it.  Delicious!  Second, the food is amazing.  The salad I ordered was very delicately put together, completely with paper-thin slices of radishes.  The steak was even better.  I felt full and content.  Great place!

kvBpF-hymIH8KXSxA01riQ.text: I have attended twice over the summer. Once to celebrate my graduation and another for a friends birthday. I was told we were not able to have a reservation for a large party for my graduation dinner, yet the staff was super kind and accommodating and we ended up getting a table for all 13 of us 1/2 though ordering drinks and apps.   The point that was a little annoying was my friend was able to organizer the birthday dinner and have a table reserved for 10 and was told they can use the fridge for cake if needed (for a fee, but I would have liked to do that). The good is amazing (blackened salmon for sure) and the atmosphere is definitely a vibe I love, I just don't know what miscommunication happened between who I spoke to and who my friend spoke to. If you want to come here for an occasion, it's phenomenal, just be sure to ask all of your questions and know what you can and cannot do. Enjoy, drink, and be merry!

HS_o2OtzR0I6rmt_by1WQw.text: I had dinner here one evening while staying at the Palomar. I wasn't given the option for a table since I was dining solo, so I cozied up to the bar, which was fine by me. I had friendly, attentive service, and there is a full menu at the bar.   There is only one vegan option, but serious props for that, as a lot of hotel restaurants lack even meaningful vegetarian choices! I had the crispy quinoa with vegetables, and it was good. I don't really have much else to say about it: it was good.. not bad, not great.  They have a huge selection of interesting cocktails, which I heard other patrons commenting positively on.   I am not sure I would make a point to come here, but it was definitely worth the visit while staying at the hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Props for having a vegan option! Crispy quinoa with fresh veggies

B4r-0ahkDg60pSgBhx61Eg.text: Stopped in for dinner with friends while we were all in town for a conference. The salad I ordered was delicious: full of so many things I enjoy. But we also ordered a bunch of things to share, including fried chicken pieces, which were amazing. They also have a full bar. We liked the drinks so much, we came back with more friends the following afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

owLneTxRqicmgrlLOl6xOg.text: Last night we ate at Blue Hound Kitchen and Cocktails. It has a great feel to it. The menu doesn't have a lot of options but thankfully they do have some gluten free options on their menu. We started with the cheese and meat board.  It's hard to go wrong with cheese and meat. I had the shrimp and grits and my husband had blackened salmon. He said his was good, not the best he's had. My shrimp and grits had a great flavor. It had sausage it in which gave it a great taste. The service was pretty good. I think my favorite part was when they brought the check in a book where you could write messages. I thought that was pretty cool. It's not a huge place so I do recommend reservations so you don't have to wait too long.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Eg775h43B4d7HSMsjAV1Jg.text: This is one of the most underrated restaurants in Phoenix!!  I have been here multiple times and have always been delighted!  Yes, it's pricey but worth every penny!   The menu is small but there is a nice variety. The specialty cocktails are wonderful and each dish is thoughtfully created, prepared and beautifully plated. This time we started with a bread plate and the pickled vegetables that came with it were so good!   I ordered a sirloin with horseradish sauce. The steak was perfectly medium-rare as I ordered. My husband does not eat meat. He ordered the Caesar salad and loved it. Our dessert was lemon meringue pie!  Yummy. Our server was attentive without being overbearing and the timing of the meal was great. If you are looking for something new, intimate and really satisfying I can't recommend the Blue Hound in the Paloma's Hotel highly enough!

8s1X_eynQ7-ookXOhFzngQ.text: Came to eat dinner from the hotel Palomar. There is no real eating area, it is more like a bar feel. The food came out fairly quickly. I ordered the Sirloin (which comes a la carte) and a side of the Roasted Maitake Mushrooms. They came out pretty good I could not complain. I only felt the meat should have been served with a side of some sort. I didn't stay for very long. I didn't request any drinks either.

Sk6yIrP7-QSLnZYmWw4Rvg.text: First we had to check the dress code with the greeter. We had on shorts and sandals, while most of the clientele were the professional/preppie types. I reviewed the drink list and thought they were a bit overpriced at $8 for a can of beer, $15 for mixed drinks, and various prices on the wine selection.  I had water.   We ordered an appetizer selecting the chicharrones ($9). They were bought out rather quickly and tasted like they were fresh out of a bag purchased at the local Walmart.  They added some nuked cheese dip and charged me 9 bucks. I've had these in Houston and my expectations far exceeded what they delivered. The server was generous and did not hesitate the remove the charge.   I had their shrimp and grits ($28). The presentation was rather plain, but the meal was pretty good. Their rue is more tomatoey than creole, but good and a nice twist. I initially considered the serving size small, but after finishing my meal, found it quite adequate.   Would I recommend this place?  Maybe if you wanted to impress a date or celebrate a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits   Andouille sausage, tomatoes, green onions
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The shrimp and grits were delicious, but overpriced! I&#39;ve have better in the $18 range.
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. ...Spiced Chicharrones

_Is5K-AHZjugf45fQqdGWQ.text: At the Kimpton Downtown for the Holidays and the staff so caring and attentive to the smallest details the hospitality so special.  The Bar Menu Burger is so right and breakfast served fresh.  Everyone wants your satisfaction with an attitude genuine and hard to find elsewhere.  Returning soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ready for the Holiday season

z0oIF1XuRlAp0L4AeDNUFA.text: I came here last night for my friend's birthday to get some drinks. The bar and restaurant is really nice and the booths are super comfy with cute, plush pillows. We had already had dinner before coming here, so did not get anything to eat so this review is strictly for drinks and menu.   This was my first time here and I guess they changed their drink menu for Chinese New Year ( year of the dog) for the entire year. How unfortunate for the servers this entire year. The new menu is very large and all pictures. The last page does have an explanation of the origins of the drink but no explanation of what is actually in the drink, not even the alcohol type. If you are a fan of alcohol drink roulette, this menu is for you. We are not fans, so our poor waitress stood their with us for a good 20 minutes every time we wanted to try something else. What a waste of time. I came there to talk to my friends, not the waitress. No offense to her.   The first drink I ordered was the one with boba in it. It had a matcha like flavor to it with coconut milk. It was ok. What made it horrible was the boba at the bottom. It wasn't under cooked. It was still raw. The boba balls were super hard.   The second drink I ordered I think it had gin in it and it had egg whites in it. It had a really light and airyness to it with a touch of lime. I liked this one better than the first one but still didn't love it.   The last one (picture not taken) was a cocktail that was mostly a mixtures of bitters and that one surprisingly delicious. The drink was rather on the smaller side though so keep that in mind.  The tiki drink that is in my pictures looked cute and my friend ordered it. She seemed to like. She didn't say one way or another.   Dont forget to park in the parking garage below the restaurant. The restaurant validates parking so parking will be free, which is nice.   Drinks- 3 stars.  Drink menu- 1 star. Ambiance- 4 stars. Free parking in garage- 5 stars Total- 3 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

DAeZ1cWkN0Wvzi4VXK82gA.text: Sucks. Way overpriced drinks. Absolutely no happy hour. The patio was closed during on my last visit which was on a day with beautiful weather. Why?   Worst of all, it STINKS badly of cheap artificial plug-in air fragrance. I got a headache just from being there for 20 minutes.  I will never, ever return here.

wxXWln0qgC0U5lJfK4j2PA.text: Drinks: Good. I like the different flavors. It must have been a good bartender cause i felt it was worth my $9. I'd come here just to get a drink anytime.  Main Meal: Boyfriend and I got the steaks.  But we both really thought the steaks were just "okay." Not too memorable. The heirloom tomato panzanella topping didn't seem balance out well with the steak flavors or something? Of course the balsamic worked though.

sk7D4DcUxnLNxOP0oHhmRw.text: Went here for lunch with my mom & her friends today. Over all the staff was great! Two thumbs up. How ever the food was okay, they gave us the wrong flat bread & when told they let us have the wrong one to munch on (we were starving!) and made the correct one - I think, it said pork belly was on it but it looked more like brisket. They also gave us some Carmel popcorn (the best part of the meal! Then at the end we ordered 2 cappuccinos but they were clearly espresso with no milk, and had to request half and half to go with it. So in short- okay food, excellent service, with some hiccups that were addressed extremely graciously.

lYDysYTHy3_UoaEi-hiqEQ.text: I give them 5 starts for follow up! I've been here a few times, lunch,  dinner, drinks. .. Can't say the experience is consistent. Sometimes is great, others just OK,  and sporadically amazing. But,  I have to say the manager is fantastic. After waiting to be seated for our reservation for a while my family and I ended up leaving.  It was raining and we were cutting it short on time for the Paul McCartney concert. No big deal, it happens. But I was surprised to get a call the next day from the manager!! Talk about going the extra mile. .. She apologized,  I said no worries,  I thought that was it. But she said to come for drinks on her, that they would have my name saved for whenever I came back.

T373-fYhCPYLdkXf4hJPtQ.text: We were staying at the hotel and decided to eat at the restaurant in house. Menu was over priced, dinning room was loud and our food just OK. We ordered Salmon (very small dish), corn (didnt care for it much), lamb meat balls were just OK, and seafood chowder was not as good as I expected. All in all, just an OK place to eat.

NEi5s5rJe1-7gv6hTFpSQA.text: I went here with my husband for brunch. We ordered the chilaquiles and biscuits and gravy with coffee. The food was good and the coffee was particularly good. Our friend joined us shortly after our food arrived and also ordered chilaquiles. This shouldn't have been an issue since our food came out quickly. But, after 35 min of waiting he canceled his order. Apparently the waitress put the order in, but the cook overlooked it.

pOqgmLrTDgtzR-qKbawdGg.text: Stopped by last night with a friend for a quick drink and a bite to eat and was really happy we did! Great food and drink and exceptional service!

S3hbDjLTjIy5WpFxMBtG2g.text: Fantastic brunch! The food was delectable; huge portions! We ordered a couple items that were unable to be prepared due to lack of ingredients but the staff went above and beyond to compensate. Amazing service and super cute birthday card for Mom. Love this place!

UIGKS_qFzCfUadBwpGSjYg.text: I know it's been said already -- but I will echo: this is the type of place downtown Phoenix sorely needs. As a frequent visitor to the area, I've noticed that there is a definite lack of urban, food-centric downtown restaurants with an eye towards innovation. That's what the Blue Hound gives you. The ability to choose small plates or full size entrees is also a nice touch, giving guests the ability to do their own tasting menu of sorts. And with lots of interesting dishes, small plates is the way to go.  Went this past weekend and can tell you, the food was wonderful (bacon jam!) and the atmosphere was great. It's a double edged sword - you don't want to have to wait for a table but it does make it feel more city like when there is a wait. Staff was attentive and Luis the manager did a nice job of going table to table to make sure every guests got a visit.   I'm hoping this place stays for awhile and continues to come up with creative ways to bring a more urban food scene downtown!

sfcv54gWZl4OFoBHusgF0g.text: Totally good. Great atmosphere, excellent service, cleverly varied yet affordable menu. Upscale but reasonably priced at the same time. They have a really great food selection for  any group, accomodating all dining predilections and hunger levels ( half plates available). Drinks excellently prepared though slightly pricey. Save money by hitting happy hour when the special mixed drinks are $7.

KDdLzQuSpPLLtZAhOOKkcw.text: Pork belly was awesome and they whipped up the best Bloody Mary I have ever had.  I strolled in during December/January when it was cold and chilly outside, and decided I didn't want to go find something outside in the cold.  I am really glad this place is conveniently located in the Palomar.  Atmosphere was great, but food was better.  My waiter was also really nice, perfect balance of attention, but also gave me and my honey some personal time.

c9LKBgQaUFuHL_z9l1yiKQ.text: This place is great. Food was delicious, server was very attentive and it was perfect for a quiet business lunch. Will definitely be back!

BV4flR3tExpf9ZP313j7_g.text: Came here for Sunday bunch, and loved it! Ordered the Chop Salad (without chicken) and a mimosa. Definitely recommend!

f2kSOBmHDz0VaAUpNbhcfg.text: I Love this place for food, fun, cocktails! Its just a happening kind of a place with beautiful people

A17oR3zbetsXXTwSMOvPcg.text: I'm a foodie and a discerning customer. I enjoy many of the qualities of a restaurant that aims to be a finer-end establishment, such as this one, but I can equally enjoy a hole-in-the-wall if the food and service are good.  This restaurant had neither.   - Incompetence - I just had an evening here with a large group.  The management was very professional, as was our waiter in tending to our guest's needs.  Several things went wrong, however, and the food is just not good.  We ordered plates of the fries and aioli for the table.  One friend is severely lactose-intolerant, so we asked that fries be provided without the cheese.  Finally, 20+ minutes later his fries arrived, but still with cheese.  His entre later in the evening also had cheese he asked not to be included.   - Overrated Drink Options - It's True there is an encyclopedic drink menu, although most the options are overpriced for what you get.  When I was waiting for friends at the bar before our meal, the bartender was rude and stopped filling my order halfway through to talk to her coworker for several minutes.  - Horrible food - Let me cut to the chase on this one.  I ordered the lamb meatballs. I got a full entre. They were inedible.  The lamb apparently died in a pepper mill explosion. I should have sent the dish back but we were already behind schedule on the rest of our evening, and I couldn't wait for them to correct the problem.  I can't think of the last time I ate something that was so horrible I couldn't bear to finish it. I like almost anything.  There were other problems with the food.  The greens in my salad had spoiled.  Many other guests did not enjoy there meals.  It's True that most of the entres are overpriced, so they offer "medium" sized or tapas options. This is just pretentious.  If your entre was decent enough to eat, customers won't mind paying more.  Several people ordered the salmon full entre and it was a thinly-sliced piece of barely cooked salmon on a plate.  The food all came in stupid iron pans that are too small to reach in and cut your meat with a knife.  - Checks - For our dozens guests or so, our polite waiter was not polite enough to allow us to charge the bill to separate credit cards. I don't know how you're supposed to pay a $500 bill in cash among so many people. We should have brought a cpa to tabulate our invoice.  The waiter did include his 20% gratuity, thankfully.  In conclusion, skip this restaurant.

u_APW0uuz9sLM_09sjHH2Q.text: The best happy hour in downtown Phoenix.  The cocktails are delicious, the staff is eye candy, the crowd is... a little stuck up at times but that's their problem, not mine.  My Friday night's usually start here and end at Hanny's for dinner and that is the recipe for a perfect end to a work week.

AaoGUEF1F0FAO6LvO_9xpQ.text: Popped in for brunch after arriving in town for a conference. The salad was good, but not great. But you had me at "bottomless mimosas." Staff were friendly and helpful, service was good, atmosphere was great.

j-nKw5_iRvYuanjItFWemA.text: Unable to review this place nor do I think I want to. Left 2 messages, sent an email for a large party reservation. No one has called or emailed back. Customer service is always one of my top 3 when reviewing or recommending. So far, F.

2dnRjFGQgjH_-v-Su92opw.text: Holiday gathering with family and friends.  We hit Blue Hound before we went to Lucky Strike - great combination. Drinks at BH was second to none (lemonade and Jack, ahhhh).  We sat at the bar first: bartenders were helpful and went out of their way to create the drink we wanted. Fantastic.  We sat inside (must say the patio looked off the hook) and enjoyed ordering 7-8 appetizers to share among all.  I think the appetizers are comparable to the entrees as far as variety.  Not sure the waiter was too happy about a table ordering just appetizers - but oh well, we are the patrons, right ??  Definitely be back.    One more thing that was great - they validated parking in the underground garage.  Yes!!  No nickel and dimming here....

MhaUAwwkHux85Z87BmnDVQ.text: Blue Hound.  Oh how I want to love you.  I've stayed at the Palomar in San Francisco and was so excited they built one here.  I figured the Blue Hound had to be awesome.   The decor is what I expected.  Super hip with a floor to ceiling windows that gave us a great view of CityScape from our table.   The menu is very intriguing with items such as fried quail, cheddar scallion biscuits, and Kobe beef short ribs.  All of those items were fairly tasty as well.  The short ribs were a little difficult to eat and I think they were cooked a little too long.   The service needs work.  We wanted to get a bottle of wine and asked our server for a recommendation.  I understand he was no sommelier, but figured he'd have some knowledge on their offerings.  I let him know my tastes and said I normally get chardonnay, but would like to try something new and would like to hear what he recommended.  He said if we like chardonnay, get chardonnay.  Mmmmmmmkay.  So much for trying something new.  I am allergic to eggs and asked him if the fried quail was dipped in an egg wash before frying.  He replied by saying he had no idea things were dipped in egg before frying and that he learned something new.  I like to go to restaurants to try new things and trust the servers know more about the menu than I do and can assist me in finding the right options.  I got the impression that servers here are just order takers and food runners.  I recommend a little training on the menu items for the servers.   This was my second time at Blue Hound.  The first time we sat at a table in the lounge area for 10 minutes and was never addressed so left.  The food was not memorable enough to overlook the lackluster service.  I was invited to a birthday there recently and opted to meet the group after they left.  They let me know the service was terrible again.  It's a shame.  If the employee vibe was elevated, this could be a great spot to hang out at while downtown.

dKIbd0nDO4t7B7Izt6FZxg.text: Excellent food and drinks!  Manager Zach Harte helped make it a great experience for us as 3 sisters waited for Springsteen!!

avaYnCXMfQwiugFyTe4POA.text: This is by far the worst, over priced, basic food I have ever eaten. My suggestion is to avoid this place at all costs. Who ever reviewed this place has even half way decent is lying to themselves. Service was mediocre at best, wait time was a joke and the hostess had the odassity to ask if I had a reservation. I looked over at the dining area and said, " Do I need one". Normally, I would have but my wife and I saw how empty place was and decided, "Hey, that looks like a quite place to eat.  Not to many people". Literally it was a Saturday evening with about 5 tables full and 15 open.  Either way I base my reviews on the food quality and service, both were terrible and I will never suggest this place to anybody.

mi1e_PNgfKG97VURhkhGDA.text: Selection was very good for two couples headed to a show. Hearty pork shank or light, tasty beet salad. Take your pick. The cocktails were not a typical selection. Fresh mint or rosemary adorn the glass rim. Nice draft beer selection.  Must mention the excellent service. Our waitress was knowledgeable and enthusiastic. She was a trusted companion right through dessert!

_yA6dG9bJ4ceyCtgU5M2Tg.text: A little overpriced and not the greatest of food, but it's solid if your in town as a tourist or there for business and want something close in downtown.

mAFNDVmA3oZgVdjv-NGCXg.text: Great food and service, but kinda pricey.  Great date spot!  Loved the ambience.  Our server, Kevin, was great.

1elmdABjhAThkiAOyOlrSQ.text: The chop salad was crazy good!  The trout was cooked perfect with a really smooth brown butter.  Excellent outdoor seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

q5oxgjNw-CvdtJxL_8VtIg.text: The food was great and well thought out all around. They have a great tap with awesome beer options and great service at night. But, the real amazing service happened in the morning when Mike Ma (on the receipt) at the bar went out of his way to help me find some ginger ale.

wGozSbXt1tr3_xwj8lqUGA.text: Loved the atmosphere. Very casual chic.   Our server was prompt in greeting us and very nice. He resented cocktail menus and I couldn't decide because they all looked delish! My friend and I started with the Desert Gin & Tonic and Lost Melody. The Gin & Tonic was extra good because it was made with premium ingredients but mine was sublime! One of those dangerous drinks that will go down easy and sneak up on ya.   APPETIZERS:   TATER TOTS: smoked bacon, chive, romesco sauce  - adult version of the school lunch favorite. Very tasty.  CHARRED PORK BELLY SLIDERS: kimchi, peanuts on King's Hawaiian bread - We ordered the half order (2). But after we were done, we looked at each other like...we should have ordered 4!   DINNER:   POT PIE: root vegetables, mushrooms, swiss chard - Pretty darn good. I didn't even miss the meat!   BBQ'D BEEF SHORT RIBS w/ Anson Mills' blue cheese grits - One large Flintstone bone in a cast iron bowl. The meat was tender and the flavor was amazing. The taste and texture of the grits were on point too. My only "beef" was that it came out room temperature. Which made the grits congeal a little. I was very disappointed by that and felt the dish could have been even better if it were hot!   MORE DRINKS:   LAWLESS: Breaking & Entering bourbon, bitters, wormwood liqueur, tobacco smoked glass. Great presentation and perfectly balanced flavors.   Finally - desert was the Pineapple Upside-Down Cake and coffee. The cake was really good. Again a classic that was on point. They must have a thing with food temperature, because the decaf coffee was ice cold!   Our server was overwhelmed by a large table at the restaurant . We often felt like things took too long...like the food, the check and clearing out plates between servings.   Otherwise, we had a great experience and I look forward to going back.

R_QYjxtyYDtmELEiTA_-Jg.text: Very cute lounge-y bar type feel, despite having big screen tv and the game playing. We had dinner for 2 in a big booth with pillows, so much fun!  Waiter was super friendly and helpful without being overbearing! Drinks were strong and delicious!  We ordered the BHKC chop salad and a pasta dish- both were great, the salad was amazing! I loved the atmosphere and the quiet low-lights loungey feel!  Would come back here in a heartbeat!  We almost walked out without paying by accident! Because it's attached to a hotel, our server brought out the bill with the total, tip, and signature line. So (having had a drink or 2) we calculated the tip, signed, and got up to walk out. Only then did we realize we never have our credit card! Of course, we went back immediately, I would have felt terrible!! Yikes!

7yzAdCeiDvc6S0HDDhWUDA.text: One of the best chopped salads ever!! I added chicken and boy did I get more than my money's worth. I also got a side order of the house fries that have rosemary and Parmesan . Delish!!! Great selection of cocktails, beers and wine and was pleasantly surprised to see they gave Cava by the glass beside the usual champagne and Prosecco. Great service and cool atmosphere. Great for date night or funky place for lunch

5YRlQxNc6vZVpFkUuA_ARw.text: The food is spectacular! Came here the first time in 2014. Going back to AZ this weekend for a getaway and definitely planning on stopping in for lunch. Super excited for the roasted corn.

gC1VBNvhdPe7A8gWZ8K_fw.text: Gastropub ? Had dinner there was some friends after a day at the convention center. The space was very nice, the service very good. While my friends enjoyed some main entrees, after we ordered a few appetizers like Boudin balls and corn fries which were both very good, I ended up having for my meal just some sliders and small beat salad. Though the sliders were very small, I was amazed at how tough the meet was. The salad was very nicely done. All the meals well presented. I would go back.  As I look back at the menu, I am not sure I would call this a Gastropub. I will continue to look for funky food !

yvN6A1LmYwk4VZFpRrSEaQ.text: A bit pricy but the atmosphere is incredible. Dark and beautiful hotel lounge/restaurant. Drinks & appetizers (fried green tomatoes, peppers and cheese and meat board) were fabulous. Entree's were good but not great (pasta and catfish). I would definitely go again but I would probably stick to the apps and drinks only.

2rWUy8_xK_WqBzchXHXkMw.text: Blue Hound is an upscale bar and restaurant downtown. I had a little trouble finding the place because it's on the second floor. I really likes the corn grit fries. It's a little pricey but the food and drink is great.

a81UwkDtmAK61BzZSoO5Mg.text: The best downtown.  All around fantastic. Wonderful dinner.   Shrimp and grits like there's no tomorrow.

36vlMpZnsC3cG2avW-MhiA.text: Went here twice, during a 3-day trip. From other Yelpers, seems like the place for cocktails.  Round 1 - Thursday night after 8p dinner:  Food: 1. roasted chicken - a little dry but big portions;  2. paparadelle with meat sauce - salty but good texture in the pasta.   Drinks:  1. lawless - amazing with when the tobacco-smoked glass! If you like bourbon, this is a must try. 2. old fashioned - nice use of the big orange rind, gave it a deeper taste.  Round 2 - Saturday night after 7p, drinks only at the bar: same drinks as above! Thanks for a great last drink in Phoenix!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Extra seating area outside of the main bar and dinning room.

DQWnNwiHpZ6iDlB6VDydKQ.text: I would like to give this more stars, but was only there for shared appetizers before a concert. Service was prompt and courteous. Our waitress' demeanor was a little dry once she realized it wasn't to be a high dollar ticket. We shared the fried green tomatoes and the flatbread pizza if the day. Both were delicious and just enough for two who had light appetites. However, I think the $ rating should be $$$ and not $$. I would return.

RfZIc3aDkcNDVXSNtQk7Vg.text: We really enjoyed our dinner at the Blue Hound. We brought our 6 year old and felt comfortable with him. The service was great and we enjoyed a range of flavors with our meal. Easy Open Table reservations before the Suns game made getting a table simple. Ordered the cheese, meat and fruit platter to start. Nice wide range of flavors with no stinky cheese. I shared the blackened salmon with my son and my husband got the port shank. Salmon was moist and flavorful. Green beans were perfect with it. Pork shank came right off the bone and mixed nicely with the beans and rice. For dessert the fruit crisp with vanilla ice cream. There were no left overs of anything! I had to  to take away a star because it was a bit overpriced. $115 for an appetizer, 2 entrees, 1 glass of wine and 1 dessert to share.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The pork shank was super flavorful and came right off the bone!

fbgZrc8x3IN4ufiXEHI4FQ.text: What a beautiful, sexy restaurant!  I came here on Friday night with my three dear friends for a much needed, relaxing dinner out.  We decided to use the 20% Yelp discount voucher I received the night before at the Summer Splash and Dash event, and as soon as we were seated I gave our waiter, Chris, my Yelp discount card.  We ordered drinks and I was a little overwhelmed by the large cocktail menu.  Not overwhelmed in a bad way, but overwhelmed in a good way...it was enormous!  My friends all ordered their own drinks and we placed an appetizer orders: the "endless" caramel popcorn with Ancho chilies, and half orders each of the tater tots and the seasoned Kennebec French fries.  The tater tots and fries were both hot and delicious and came with tangy dipping sauce.  The caramel popcorn was intriguing with its slightly spicy end note.  We really enjoyed the popcorn, but sadly while the menu description implied it was a refillable menu item, it wasn't refilled when we depleted the bowl and so we only got a very small serving.  After finishing our first cocktails we all placed our dinner orders, I ordered the large order of the Kobe beef short ribs with the blue cheese grits, my girlfriends both ordered flatbread pizzas and a salad and our lone male companion ordered the lamb meatballs.  We also ordered additional cocktails to go with dinner and I took the chance to order a drink the waiter recommended called a Bermuda Triangle, which was cold, fruity, tangy and massively potent too.  (Wow!)  Our dinners all trickled out at different times and us three ladies at the table had all been served for a full 15 minutes before we eventually grabbed the closest waiter in the vicinity, Justin, and had him check on our companion's missing lamb meatballs.  Justin happily obliged our request and disappeared into the kitchen only to reappear with the lamb meatballs in less than 30 seconds.  How long they were sitting there waiting to be delivered to our table was anyone's guess.  Sadly our own waiter wasn't aware of this hitch because he never came near our table that whole time.  I knew there was a problem though when the people who came in a full 30 minutes after we were seated had been served their food (including an order of lamb meatballs) and the three of us ladies had all been served and our friend was still waiting for his entree!  After everyone finally had their food we all started to eat and I wasn't at all disappointed with my Kobe beef ribs!  They were so generously sized I could only eat one, however the grits were utterly unremarkable and I basically ignored them in favor of that massive, meaty rib.  I also tasted the lamb meatballs and they were fabulous, although the hot pink sour cream they were served with was a bit oddly colored.  Not long after we finished eating our waiter reappeared and he volunteered to clear our table and package the second, untouched Kobe beef rib for me.  We also placed dessert orders and chatted while we waited for dessert to appear.  Oddly our desserts, including my Panna Cotta and my friend's seasonable sorbets, were all served with forks.  I had to ask the waiter for spoon instead.  My Panna Cotta was a tad too soft for my liking, but the pool of foamy citrus sauce it was sitting in was very good and deliciously tangy, although to be quite honest I could have done without the flavorless, unidentifiable curls that topped the Panna Cotta.  Seriously, I couldn't even identify what they were, they were that tasteless.  We paid our tab and tipped our waiter on the pre-discount amount.  (It should be noted that we would have tipped him more, but leaving us to sit for 15 minutes as our dinners cooled and we politely waited for our companion's missing dinner entree was no bueno!)  So all in all this was a pleasant dining experience and I expect will venture back soon, but next time I'd love to have more follow up from our waiter and I'd hope that all the entrees all arrive around the same time too.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My very large short ribs!

D7sAijd9rj3JRohzxSENJw.text: Our server (Molly) was smart, engaging and attentive. We shared deviled eggs (uniquely prepared with bacon jam-delish) and short rib sliders that melt in your mouth. We also shared shrimp and grits for our entree. Perfectly cooked shrimp with tons of flavor but not excessively spicy. The creamiest grits you could imagine.   I ordered the Lawless cocktail... if you are a bourbon drinker this will knock your socks off. Bourbon, bitters and wormwood liqueur, poured into a glass filled with loose-leaf tobacco smoke at your table. It's a captivating presentation and really yummy.   It was a birthday celebration and they treated me very well!   Don't miss this one.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Celebrating our anniversary. Amazing food. Flawless service by Simone. Best Old Fashion ever by Ethan. Can&#39;t miss!

U7LZQs1FWEChjuouXbVbCw.text: Really great place for new age american cuisine. You walk in and there's this great sculpture of a blue hound.  Then you're seated and the menu is seasonally appropriate. The flavors are well balanced and presentation is great. I went with some friends and we shared the deviled eggs, shishito peppers, and seared ahi salad.  I love that there are large windows as well as an outdoor patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The blue hound at the entrance to greet you

s4r8O_uZpJYPgexAxFiWJA.text: We came here with my coworkers after work to grab some glass of refreshing drinks! We decided to hang - out and give some space for ourselves to relax and chill- out for the long tiring day.  We already came here several times and consistently this place always gives us a great time. We like this spot because it has a nice interior and great atmosphere inside. It was so comfortable to stay inside while having our drinks.   We've got here our different refreshing drinks base on our standard and mine was the Boba cocktail; the taste of it was so great and totally refreshing. We all had one thought it in place; great and amazing selections of cocktails.   "Til the next hanging - time again.

h9bdLl1pnJchKW-fsB2D1Q.text: The setting for the restaurant was nice; major misses in the drinks and food- -the girlfriend had a top shelf drink and it was too strong of all spice -old fashioned I had was very basic -the berry mule she had was too fruity -ordered the pasta carbonara with no peas and it came with peas  Staff was friendly but the attention to requests on orders was lacking.   We paid so we didn't have to return food on top of the first drink we ordered.      Not worth the price.

Wx0vqweDO-AKHVusvQ6BFQ.text: A friend and I came here on a Tuesday night. We sat at the bar. It took a while to get the bartenders attention when we showed up.   We both ordered a beer and saw the reviews for the Chopped Salad. I added salmon to mine and he added chicken to his. The salads were good but I would not pay this much again. Overall my individual bill for 1 beer and a salad was close to $40.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chopped Salad with Salmon

gwcU1sctz87ZiiqpSl9G8w.text: Our first meal when we land in Phoenix for lunch, it's inside a nice hotel that smells awesome. We expect the food to be somewhat amazing but it was just ok, the ahi bowl was good and fresh according to my friends. I got the chicken bowl that was kind of bland, they should've some kind of sauce to go with it so it'a not as dry and tasteless. The steak sandwich was probably the worse, so dry and it's slices of roasted beef rather than a steak. Even when more sauce doesn't really help. The best was the Brussels Sprouts that we almost got another round of it. Not much options on their menu either.

Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

MPV_vIzOU-tf00jrq6V9FA.text: I can't really fault anything about our dinner experience here in terms of the quality of the food and drink and service. There was mixed feedback about the price of many of the menu options (including the steaks, which come a la carte) being above average in cost, but at the same time, you can also look at it as paying for a quality experience. I do feel, though, that the staff ooze just a wee bit too much pride about the place, as in spreading it a bit thick. I agree, but at the same time, I'd rather the food and drink speak for itself, or the reviews I read, and maybe a teeny bit by the wait staff. Please don't channel your inner car salesman.  So one thing about which they pride themselves is their cocktail list, in particular their varieties of old fashioneds, which is an instant win for me. I tried their "A Joke and a Coke, but Classy" which, at $15, competes with places like New York on cost, but it was justified, an complex blend of flavor with just enough sweetness that it would work as both a before and after-dinner drink.   We only ordered one appetizer, the focaccia, but even that had options for gluten restricted diets, such as the marinated cauliflower. Everything (except the bread) had a distinctive lemon flavoring, which was especially interesting with the baba ganoush. My entree, the Faroe Island Salmon, was cooked to absolute perfection, and again the roasted mushrooms complimented the meal.   The staff were really attentive (and persistently informative), but it was all good in terms of meal information, recommendations, etc.. It was a very enjoyable experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My salmon was cooked perfectly.
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A variety of our drinks for the evening

yvEV_XUK7vutwCDvrIHDTg.text: Thought the cauliflower bowl with quinoa, carrots, and sunchokes would be a light lunch. Sadly, was too salty and oily for my tastes.   My colleague ordered the chopped salad which was almost laughably huge for one person to eat for lunch- maybe a good option if you're hungry!

_n1QVy_i5nnD_s0PSDXMTA.text: So I ended up here because Scott is doing a work function this week so I came along! Let me just tell you... I've only had one meal here but it was spectacular. I ordered the pasta carbonara and it was everything I wanted it to be. Honestly might be the best pasta I've ever had... I'm struggling right now on trying not to order it again tonight!!! Not to mention you can't top the view out the window as well. Being in downtown Phoenix makes me feel like I'm on vacation but not too far from home. Today I enjoyed a day by their crystal clear pool and also had delicious French toast for breakfast! This place is definitely worth the money and very quick service!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. PASTA CARBONARA JUST ORDER IT OK
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee.... so delicious.

yGQGvJ19A4UQoH0Kan04kg.text: The cocktails and food here were outstanding.   We had the salmon on a bed of mushrooms and shisito pepper puree, the charcuterie plate, and a few of the signature cocktails ($15/each).   Not at all cheap but gorgeous decor and delicious food. Go for a business meal or a special date.

InWtU-taD6jxOWf4zxkQjw.text: Savory food, great atmosphere and delicious drinks!  Parking is easy and close to stadium

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Relaxing atmosphere, the BLT and Egg Sandwich was light and tasty, Almond Jerk Dusted Cauliflower was very flavorful!

S50LgUkHOkmrW0HzGTZ04Q.text: Grossly over priced.  Made a reservation for 6 at 7pm. 2 of our friends arrived at 6:30 to have a drink and were constantly pestered by the manager as to where the rest of our party was. She had to be told it was a reservation for 7pm and to check with her host before she came back again.  We all arrived at 7 to chat and get appetizers. Drinks were slow to arrive and dinner took almost 30 minutes to show up. They excuse was that the chicken was slowing down the entire dinner.  My carbonara was so cold I was embarrassed to ask for it to get microwaved.  My friends 8oz steak was a joke in terms of size and a bit of rabbit greens on the side .   Our waiter then needed bothered to split the check into 3 like he was asked and arrived with gratitude already applied (which he was entitled to) but he was smug in telling us about it as if he expected more tip. $460 later. Absolute joke.

DOgfubhkdLKvvC57rCuHZw.text: What a lovely seating area on the patio with nice lights and the great skyline and City view. Nice ambiance for sure on the patio.  Server was very attentive and helpful... Food was served very quickly and efficiently.  Food: Cioppino was generous with seafood but broth was sparse, flat, not rich or sumptuous, like I've had at nice trattorias in California. Also it wasn't red, like I expected, but yellow and not plentiful. I had orgasmic cioppino before and this was not in any way close to what I have had before at the place I mentioned. I am not a cioppino snob or expert but just a plain person who expected something else and was disappointed in that sense.  The appetizers were great: burratta, chicharrones  My friend enjoyed his shank,I tried my husband's pesto pasta and my other friends shrimp and grits which I found tasty... Nothing mind blowing.  The cocktails OMG. They freaking served a kalamata Olive in both my friends martini... WHAT IN THE HELL. The server apologized that they ran out of the Spanish olives so they used that... That's embarrassing!! They claim to be a cocktail bar and then they do this?? Ok, rant over.  Let's just say the food was tasty overall and the view was really nice...but 250$ worth? Definitely not. You're paying for the swank, The view, the location (Like other downtown "hip" spots)  So my conclusions: glad I checked it off my list, wouldn't really bother to go again because nothing was mind blowing and wouldn't drop that same amount for "not mind blowing".

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Meh flavor cioppino, bread was amazing tho

SlSZMuTdyVjazzryZovyVg.text: I really liked the decor and vibe of this restaurant, super modern and sleek. I came here for lunch while in town, and I'm sure glad we did. I had the most delicious burger and fries here! The burger was cooked perfectly, which is difficult for me to find since I like my burger cooked all the way but not burnt and dry. I loved everything about this burger and highly recommend for all those coming here and debating on getting the burger, get the burger! Also, the fries were amazing-perfect crisp and flavors!   I hope they open one of these in LA! Or if they have a sister company in LA, someone please let me know.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of the best burgers I&#39;ve ever had

InnCQOt7928wgnmFU6rDUw.text: Came here for the Miracle Christmas themed pop up bar. When I got there with my friend at around 7 it was already very busy. The best thing about this bar is definitely the ambiance. As soon as you walk in you see all the cool Christmas lights and decorations hanging from the ceiling. All of their holiday cocktails are served in different holiday themed mugs served up by their jolly bartenders who were also in Christmas wear.   Shout out to whoever crafted their cocktail menu! We tried most of the cocktails on the menu and they were surprisingly all VERY good. I think my personal favorite was either the old fashioned or the mai tai inspired yippie ki ya mother f***er. Be prepared to drop some serious cash on drinks here! The price for these cocktails is a bit too high in my opinion at 15-18 dollars a drink.   All in all the drinks and festive ambiance of this place is spectacular and if you don't mind the premium price tag on drinks, you should definitely check it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Snowball Old Fashion / Yippie Ki Ay Mother F*****r
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Miracle Cocktail Menu
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Miracle at Blue Hound

jbhL3V6phWcBgR8wjUiPfg.text: [breakfast] Solid hotel lobby spot with some hit and miss for food (see below for the recs and the risks)  + (related) just outside the restaurant, but had to mention it... sit in the bright and comfy second floor lobby "living room" with complimentary coffee  + croissant is flaky and will make a proper mess all over you -- just like it's supposed to! * croissant was a bit chewy and stretchy in spots, but had nice airy layers  ++ egg white frittata with roasted tomato, asparagus and arugula. For the win. Beautiful, light and flavorful!  ## avocado toast. Miss it. Radish dry and faded. Avocado needs seasoning and hard-boiled egg mince did little to enhance.   SERVICE # sketchy and inconsistent. Host stand is not staffed at breakfast and inbound guests are lost and don't know where to go.  Day2 I sat at the bar and every guest was confused.  TIP: The restaurant is FAR past the lobby and bar at the very back of the room.  ---- Please either staff the host stand, remove it for breakfast, or add clear signage to direct confused guests! ---- # first day, host/(manager?) was on his mobile phone trying to get support for a broken POS # second day, host is coordinating construction/maintenance team with ladders  +++ day2 servers were smiling (you cant help but break your grumpy morning mood and smile!), friendly, helpful and accommodating.   AMBIENCE  + Beautiful wear facing floor-to-ceiling ceiling windows are glowy in the morning and a great illumination for your food and the rest.  + upscale-hip meets used (but sealed) dark-wood tables ## music is a bit loud for breakfast but in line with the ambience of other public areas.   ROOM SERVICE Having seen pics of room service, I know this kitchen has more to offer and I look forward to trying it again next time!  Thanks!!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flaky and buttery. Pretty good, I&#39;d say!!
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chill relaxing spot for a cuppa or shot!
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg white frittata. Roasted tomato, asparagus, arugula. For the win.

ua12Fewg5CIQtyS3k0mZTw.text: First time visiting the blue hound and overall was pleasant experience. Although  i know its a higher end type of place..it is still way overpriced . Most if not all meals don't come with sides so for a 35-50 steak to have no side included and be expected to fork out another 8-10 dollars fir a kid size side is a bit much. I had the pasta and it was tasty and good but bucca de peppo and carrabas are better....just being honest. We had desert and to their credit they were also good but small and if sharing only expect a few bites between 2 people . The atmosphere itself is very nice in the cityscape location and the restaurant itself is very nice but quiet so expect that vibe and type of social environment. Would i go again maybe but knowing the cost and that i can enjoy the same type of meal for less it might be questionable.
