FrXrH-tLJBSENdUl_osjVQ.text: I have many business meetings here but I am not that big of a fan. I get a burger and salad here mainly and its okay. I don't know if i would recommend this spot with other restaurants near that are fantastic like Arrogant Butcher or Hanny's. Maybe just not my cup of tea. Also i have only gone at lunch time so maybe the food is different at night but just my thought. Its a great location downtown and good atmosphere.

pPWpVTtMrJ55Q3PyBPCKTQ.text: Went for happy hour and it was wonderful. The Rosemary Fries and Shistake Pepper small plates were delish! The drink menu is amazing. The restaurant itself is very pretty, hip, eclectic, and clean. The bartenders make you feel at home. Did not eat dinner here but it looked great. The negative is that this place is pricey.

qfEPH4qynjJJ536_9DpDFA.text: What a great experience we had when we dined at the blue hound on May 5th, 2015. The food was beautifully presented yet still relaxed. The service by Jeremy was outstanding. He was clearly knowledgeable and enthusiastic about the food he was serving.   Each dish was delicious and interesting. The shrimp with creamy grits sets the standard for this somewhat trendy dish. I will have a hard time ordering it any where else now! The beet salad with dates was beautiful and we'll composed in nice bite size pieces that made it easy to get all the flavors in one bite, a detail often overlooked when form takes precedence over flavor.   We will go back soon to try the many other dishes we wished we had room for!  Great job Blue Hound. A howling good eatery!

r-74QM6JyNSzG5YRwsVxFw.text: Went there for lunch today, nice spot wouldn't have found it but it was recommended to me! The new BHKC salad was perfect, my husband had a shrimp salad and enjoyed that too!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy BHKC salad !

XUXZkM1cIdhxeE-NeZHP_Q.text: I liked the ambiance of the restaurant, modern and upscale. The cocktails were special and stood out. My favorites were the Lost Melody and Black Mamba. We had a great server who was very knowledgeable about the spirits. He gave us a few history lessons... It was interesting. Started with the kale salad but wasn't blown away. I had the chicken as my main entree and it was full of flavor and delicious! Shared the chocolate pudding with marshmallow fluff for dessert. SO GOOD. Will definitely return for the cocktails.

pzKjdUTjccG6e3nJH-NbHg.text: This place is a joke. Trendy- yeah. Big deal. Service at the bar for brunch on a Sunday morning was literally shocking. Bartender didn't smile once, I swear. It was not busy at all, yet it took her 10 min to make us 4 mimosas and another 5 minutes for a bloody, because she was busy cleaning other glassware right in front of us.   Food took 35-40 minutes to get to us and was absolutely pathetic portion size wise and wasn't even that good! She never asked us how anything was and we all left there still hungry (and broke).   We were never offered refills on our "bottomless mimosas", had to ask every single time.  The only silver living is that a manager or just other co worker came over to us and was friendly and accommodating, since our check was wrong. I would never come back here ever again. There are so many other amazing places, especially for breakfast near this place. Don't waste your time or money!

BhKv8HDx7qodDn8WLkro1Q.text: I love this place.  The food is great and make sure to order a Lawless drink.

XomqZIDunq9EUI4ccE7Iqg.text: The Chef here is amazing, food perfect, service awesome, the bbg mesquite was perfect, the shishito peppers with the miso to die for. Chef came out to speak with me, going to come for dinner, try out some steak.sine of the sweet corn soup.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bbq sandwich

8z23sEqaMf-pyDnqzbapwQ.text: DOG Gone it the meal was PAWS-itively filled with unexpected surprises and masterful execution. It was something to YELP about.  You will BARK about having a great meal here if you share a bunch of small plates. Many of the plates come in small or regular sizes. The prices are very reasonable with one of the small plates starting at just $3.  We started with these really great Sazerac CockTAILS. They were so good we couldn't help not to LAP them up. It was outstanding and a very strong $10. drink.  Who doesn't like to WOLF down Blistered Miso Shishito Peppers and a small size Small Family Farmed Cheese Plate served at the perfect eating temperature with very tasty house made saltines.  The Elote Style Corn was so fresh and was something to HOWEL about. The corn tasted like fresh corn you'd get from a farmers market and found out if did come from local McClendons Farm.  Another TAIL WAGGER is the Jerk Cured Scottish Salmon. The flavor of the potato complemented the jerk seasoning with the salmon that was truly unique.  The Kimchi Pork Belly Siders might give some people a new LEASH on life. They make you a little nuts because they have peanuts on them.  We ended the meal sharing one Massive BBQ'd Beef Rib over Blue Cheese Grits. I feel like a HEAL saying this but it didn't say on the menu that it would be topped with a pickle fruit. It came out with pickled peached and I didn't mean to pick a BONE with anyone but we had to send it back since my husband has a peach allergy. LICK-ity split the Chef sent out another and graciously apologized for not noting that on the menu. The Short Rib really was the most MASTER-ful Rib I ever had anywhere. Not only was it caramelized meaty and succulent. it also had this chewy leather meaty coating around it that was awesome with those great BBQ smokey flavors. I usually don't eat ribs because they are too fatty for me as this one was in places for me and I note for other people it might be too fatty but for some people this is bliss and what they are looking for. The top or curved part of the rib is the less fatty part and I could eat from there and what I ate from there I really enjoyed and can appreciate how good it really was. The Blue Cheese grits really went well with the rib and were really great. It's a shame I had to pass on the picked peaches.  I felt like CHASING the waiter down for one of those interesting desserts that they have here but when he presented the dessert menu I just had to MUTT-er I was too full to cram in dessert and had to take a WALK.  I don't mean to be a little RUFF but Blue Hound Kitchen and CockTAILs might leave you STAY Hot under the COLLAR in a Good Way.  1-15-2015 Chef has changed since my visit.

uomU6JoCkrpyrJd4Igo06g.text: The bottom line with discretionary spending, which eating out represents, is value. We don't indulge in this luxury a lot. So each experience matters. The Blue Hound offers real value. We enthusiastically recommend Blue Hound Kitchen & Cocktails. Here's why.  My wife and I recently took our dear friends and neighbors to the Blue Hound to celebrate a birthday. They had never been there. We will all be back (no surprise to us). A thank you call the next morning said: "Dave had a grand time last night!" That was the point.  As always, the food was outstanding in all respects: presentation, taste, value, and service. To the latter point, our server was Ryan. He does a superb job of making his guests welcome, with just the right balance of politeness, knowledge, attention without being overbearing, and sensitivity to the mood of the experience. He clearly knows and respects the quality offered from the kitchen and the bar and that made us comfortable with each of us customizing our orders. Yes, we all had different entrees and they were outstanding.  A real experience for the guys was the amazing Lawless cocktail. Ryan put us on to it and we just had to try it. Astounding! Just that would be worth a visit to the Blue Hound.   We went early on a Sunday evening--a good choice if you want a quieter, more low-key experience. Noise levels were non-existent and, of course, the staff's attention was more easily obtained. But we have been there during quite busy times and the quality of their offerings did not suffer in the least. Noise levels are up then, as they are in most restaurants at such times.  One of our friends is a design professional; his wife is a design genius. My wife and I are neither, but we have over 50 years of experience in creating a contemporary living environment. One of the things that made our friends' first experience here so special is the exceptional attention to design detail in the space; the use of wood, metal, glass and lighting all combine to indicate that someone really cared to make this space so inviting.  Parking is validated; a convenience. Total cost: $3!

4uo0ZOczsBVb1UDH7Y0MzA.text: Food was good, service was absolutely amazing!  James was an enjoyable treat and an excellent waiter.  He bantered and was responsive and knew what was great on the menu!  Thanks James!!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tots!!!

E-h6En5uMYrPeeWjmfe-BQ.text: This was my first visit and it was a great experience for Father's Day!  I did my Yelp due diligence but always expect the best.  We did a 5pm early dinner, so it was a slow, Sunday holiday afternoon and a shame considering the amazing Father's Day menu.    As a Vegan its not my kind of food, but I found plenty to eat and they offer GF, V, VG.  But for my Dad it was perfect!  Crazy special menu for Dad's with to die for beer mustard!  I'm surprised I didn't find that advertised anywhere when searching for what to do in Phoenix for Father's day.  Shame!  We were served right away in the bar and got attentive service right to the dinner table.  Our dinner waiter Chris was excellent and talked us through the whole menu.  We didn't want for anything, he took us all the way to then end with a to die for dessert.  Environment, ambiance, layout, vibe & view... all excellent!  You can Valet park with hotel and they validate it down to $5 + tip.  Based on reviews the Tater Tots and cauliflower were excellent as reviewed!  The bacon is inside the tater tots not on side, but both are a must.  The grilled broccoli was good, but nothing special.  We shared all that and Summer Panzanella - with grilled fruit and cornbread and it was good but it wouldn't bring me back.  The waiter, cauliflower and dessert would!  But plenty more to try on menu.  Father's day menu was incredible and unique from Pate, beer mustard, pickled cauliflower, pork chops, onion gravy, 3 drinks ales to Scotch and literally a "root beer" float made with ice cream and ale beer!  Upon waitor's recommendation I ordered the upside down pineapple cake and it literally melts in your mouth... incredibly delicious!  All in all a very good experience prices from $5 - $50 on menu!  So works for everyone, great venue for business, nice occasional dinner, drinks, date, happy hour.  Definitely worth a visit!

1B3ZZPr0F1A-W06upWy7uA.text: Been seeing a lot on line about this place & brunch. We were in the vicinity one night & ducked in for a snack & a cocktail. We weren't sorry. The bartender was knowledgeable about the full menu & of course cocktails. So after some brainpicking we went with 2 hand crafted delicious cocktails. Our snacks were some deviled eggs that I'd read were delish & they were. So we're 3 for 3. Good staff, app & drink. We will be back for brunch. The pancakes sound amazing. I mentioned to the bartender that wanted to try the popcorn & asked him if he liked it himself. Like how spicey is it etc. He said it's a perfect mix you really should try it on your next visit. Then brought us a sample. He was right it was good. That's the kind of exemplary service all bartenders need to exude. It's all about the customer.

jAGBrPqVnp2vr6xYdj7P3g.text: This is the second time I've been her for dinner before the theater. The food was fabulous & service stellar.

-1pPM0Fgwgvk95ZMtYNg0g.text: Great staff quick service and amazing menu. You need to start with the fries, Charred Pork Belly Sliders, Shishito Peppers, Hickman's Farm Deviled Eggs and the International cheese plate called Family Farmed Cheeses and if you are still hungry, order the seafood stew called Low Country Stew and/or the ribeye. If you like to drink, please order the Lawless. An amazing whiskey drink with some great aromas!
