sTYBsE5YzelTfdMfsCWRVg.text: What a nice little place, I really must say I liked it! Very nice looking place, with great customer service. I loved the scotch, over one large ice cube. Perfect for me. Happy Hour was a nice end to a rough day. A little hard to find parking in the downtown area here. However, it is quite a busy place,so I guess that is why. I had no idea downtown was jamming like this!

AHtcwaIoBQECQkv7k-sLUg.text: As with all our reviews, we rate Food, Atmosphere and Service.  Blue Hound nails it on all fronts.   The food is unique - I've never even seen most of these dishes on any other menu - and ranged from good to "Oh My Gawd This Is Amazing!" The bar is stocked with a terrific range of spirits with a particular emphasis on small batch American liquors.   The atmosphere is inviting with lots of comfortable seating and a good size bar to sit or stand around. The restaurant is located in the Palomar Hotel and - in keeping with the general vibe of an upscale/downtown hotel - has high ceilings, lots of wood and glass and a modern-but-not-too-trendy decor. It's a very nice place for a date or an evening with friends.   The service was terrific. We sat at the bar and our bartender Jesse, who was quite knowledgeable,  kept us hydrated without interjecting himself into our evening.   Cheyenne - who is, I believe, the Food & Beverage Manager - dropped by and talked with us, sharing her experience in the food industry in Phoenix. Cheyenne has been at Blue Hound since its opening and has a great sense of downtown Phoenix history of the hotel/restaurant industry. She's quite an asset to the Blue Hound.  We had the privilege of meeting Executive Chef Stephen Jones who personally delivered some of our menu items. This guy is good. He's created a menu that's a combo of southern-home cookin' "Comfort food with a grown-up flavor palate" and Asian fusion that doesn't exist anywhere else in the valley.  Chef Jones is a kind, generous and wonderful host who is quick with a smile and knows how to entice your adventurous side, delivering on all aspects of a dish. Food should taste as good as it looks and it does so here at Blue Hound.  Chef Jones does that and more; he's got a flair for the unexpected and a terrific flavor sense. Tater tots are not just simply Tater tots. Deviled Eggs are not simply eggs and Cheddar Biscuits are not just biscuits.    Downtown Phoenix needs more places like this to elevate the flavor palate environment in order to become a "go to" destination,  Blue Hound is doing it's part, others need to join.   The Food: if it seems like we ate a lot,  we did. We were treated to the very best Blue Hound has to offer, The food was exceptional.  We tried everything on the "Snacks" menu except the cheese plate and enjoyed it all. There's something here for every taste.  Shishito Peppers: This is a usually mild but sometimes hot small pepper, that's blistered and served in miso & sesame seeds and seasoned with sel gris. I abso-freaking-lutely loved these things. The texture and flavor are perfection in an appetizer. The Miso is exceptional and the sel gris (salt) is the finishing balanced touch done right.   Caramel Popcorn: This was actually pretty darned amazing. The menu says "butterscotch with ancho chile" which sounded a little iffy to me, but the execution was flawless. They call this endless which means if you are like me, you could eat about 8 pounds of this stuff. Very good.  Deviled Eggs: This one is surprising. It's "just" deviled eggs, but its garnished with brioche, smoked ham and dijon. The flavor is subtle and rich, and the eggs are so creamy it's criminal. This is another dish you could easily eat waaaaaay too much of.  Tater Tots: Chef Stephen nails it on this little dish. The texture of the tots is fabulous, and the upfront initial  flavor of potato and chive is oh so nice,  lets not forget bacon too.  These are tater tots for grown ups. You can use the dipping sauce that is served on the side but theses little babies don't need anything added. They are dangerous mouth popping snacks.   Potato Fries: French fries are one of those ubiquitous dishes that can be really boring. Not here. These are sliced in wedges, steak fry size, and perfectly fried and seasoned. The outside was crispy and the inside soft and creamy. Seasoned with aromatic rosemary and a very nice parmegiano-reggiano cheese, and served with a not-too-spicy aioli, its just another unique twist on what's normally an oh-so-common food.  Cheddar Scallion Biscuits: Oh My Gosh. Just try 'em. Trust me.  All we had on the "Farm & Garden" section of the menu was the Roasted Cauliflower, but in typical Chef Jones fashion, he puts a unique twist on it with pistachios, capers and currants. However, everything else on that section of the menu looks absolutely fabulous and we are eager to try it all.  The "Sea & Ocean" section of the menu looks very appetizing. We tried two dishes which pretty much blew our minds: First, the Bay Scallop Ceviche. Chef Jones said "It's not what you think" and he was 100% correct, it was uh-maz-ing! Second, the Jerk Cured Scottish Salmon: buttery and melt in your mouth. Both were utterly unique and ridiculously flavorful.  There's more on the menu, but there's just so much two people can eat in an evening.  We cannot wait to get back.

SwOVCk6P5KZE7uHm4POXdw.text: I'd love to be able to give a glowing review, as we've heard so many wonderful things from other people. Unfortunately, we arrived at 10:30PM looking to have cocktails and light snacks with a party of 6. We were not able to sit at a table because we were not all planning to order entrees, in spite of the fact that the restaurant was mostly empty. Poorly played Blue Hound... Poorly played.

3pMx9E52oOUbwL7ebQSH2Q.text: My lil bro and I came here for some pre-Suns game drinks and apps. The bartender was very knowledgeable about the plethora of liquors and drinks that they had on the menu and I was very impressed that he was shaking up drinks with one hand behind his back. The bourbon old fashioned that he made me was absolutely fantastic! Having recently returned from a trip to Japan, I was pleased to see the Japanese whiskys (yes, it's spelled with no e in Japan) that were on the menu. We got the short rib sliders and the blistered shishito peppers. The sliders were just ok, but I loved that they came on mini King's Hawaiian rolls. The peppers were spicy and delicious - it must have been the sriracha aioli. People around us seemed to be enjoying their food as well, so I would love to come back and try some other things on the menu.

3d-1oLQsfj43uXyXFWp7jQ.text: Decided to make a reservation here before a concert in downtown.  I had the shrimp and grits and my husband had the roasted chicken.   For an appetizer we went with the pork ribs.  The food was VERY good.  Not to pricey for the place but yes it's pretty poshy.  I would totally come back for dinner.

BMSkNr8qk4lrAb5605chhw.text: I currently went there for Valentine's dinner with my husband. I enjoyed their 5 course meal except the fish I had was a bit over cook and no taste but other than that everything was great!

JDRrgEAnOfmy6dbI5MRoGg.text: My husband and I had an early dinner before going to the symphony. We had a great time. Danny took care of us graciously and with a good sense of humor. It's a great very open place; it's in the Paloma's, which caters to a seriously hip crowd. We both had a the Lawless bourbon cocktail flavored with tobacco smoke. It was excellent, but I guess I can't say I've never smoked anymore. We split the shishito peppers which were great. Ric had the roasted beet salad - amazing presentation and taste. I had the Kale salad which was great. I tried the shrimp and grits - my grandmother from Louisiana would have been pleased. Ric had a steak, which he thought was perfect. No room for dessert, but we'll definitely be back.

iib-9YVIcPMGePehhC2epQ.text: We stumbled upon this place taking a road trip from New Mexico to California one Thanksgiving. I'm not sure if it was because it's down the street from the Phoenix Suns arena but, it was an amazing experience as we realized that they served upscale 'soul' food and it was actually one-of-a-kind. I would definitely recommend this spot especially if you are passing through.   One thing that really stood out to me was the bartender, or should I say mixologist!? We could really tell the difference and the drinks were amazing! Along with the delicious food, it definitely did not hurt that we got great seats and an ice skating rink was developed outside the restaurant that day!   We were really able to enjoy not only the food, drinks and ambience of the restaurant but also experience the vibe of the town and the local families. Definitely a treat!

57c1qzqgR176TKcOKMC2rw.text: Probably the okay-est restaurant I've been to. Took a forty minutes to be seated. The waiter was great! I placed my order and a few minutes later, a different staff member came back to tell me they were sold out of the dish I ordered. By the time I finally ate, the quality of food was decent, though small portions. Felt "blue," forgotten and unseen by staff. Felt happy to leave.   I returned the next night as it this were a toxic relationship and I was asking to get hurt. I spent the last 24 hours, writhing in pain from the food poisoning I received from my first visit. My friend was so poisoned from their food, she only wanted soup. I explained our predicament and pleaded our case. "Just soup," I said, ending my plea. The bar tender could give a flying flip that we got poisoned by THEIR restaurant. We ended our trip with a small sprite that cost $3.50. If you value your GI system, pride, and hope in humanity, skip this restaurant.

AtSSKKuzs3pl54hUNQiamw.text: I am so in awe of how in awe I am at Blue Hound that I just want you to go. Part of the appeal is all the sensory surprises, but in case you need some motivation:  THE OFFICIAL TRANSCRIPT OF WHY I F*CKING LOVE BLUE HOUND:  - Most egg whites (plus one whole egg, for good measure) on a cocktail menu.  - The boozy, housemade horchata situation.  - The drink thing with the whole egg in it also contains creme de mure, stout, and whiskey.  - There is a literal smokeshow that accompanies the Lawless (a tobacco-smoked glass of bourbon, wormwood liqueur, and house-made "truck stop bitters.")  -  Vodka's day at the spa in my mouth: grapefruit liqueur, coconut cream, grapefruit juice, rose flower water.  - The cheese plate. Fig spread. Good bread. Pungent chevre.   In essence, if you pray at the temple of the cocktail God, welcome to salvation. Experimental, complex, artisanal, thoughtful, refined, and fun as hell... heaven. *abandons religious metaphor* Love craft cocktails? Put your physical form at this bar.

JvoPggELB1IKb5CoAPENnA.text: Blue Hound is s great bar / restaurant.  An outstanding lounge.  The cocktails are inventive and very tasty.  The food was amazing.  I had the deviled eggs and fried green tomatoes.  They were perfectly made / cooked and an absolute delight to eat.  Excellent location in Phoenix, near a few jazz bars.  I will definitely be back again.

K5mThcgKoNf9lh66lQ1fBw.text: Cool place. We came in specifically for drinks, though I've heard their food is great.  The place was not busy at all, so we were easily able to grab a seat at the bar. This place has a nice warm, east coast big city type feel to it. Love. They also have a nice little patio that over looks Central and the west part of Cityscape.   Our bartender was very nice and patient w/ us while we decided what to order. I decided on the Floradora, a drink on their hangover menu (not because I was hungover, but because it sounded delicious). And it was, and was gone far too quickly for the price, about $9-$10 a piece. Price aside, their craft cocktail menu is vast and they also have a nice Bourbon, Gin, Tequila, and Scotch selection.  I would definitely recommend this place for happy hour drinks.

QZOt8cbSoVzvOdT4La0w2g.text: As hotel guests...I'm shocked at the level of service on a Thursday night. We sat at the bar for a good 15 minutes with empty drinks and watched the bartender wait on customer after customer that walked up next to us and didn't even acknowledge us. Will never be back to this establishment again

57-yjfKKILMLGfFmHXyeEA.text: This was our first time to The Blue Hound. We dined here for restaurant week ,this past week. The restaurant is a little loud,given the design of it. We could still talk,but definitely not a quiet romantic place. The parking is $5 for the hotel valet with a stamp from the hostess stand or 2hrs complimentary in the city scape garage. We had the farmer's market greens and the heirloom tomato appetizers. We loved them both. For our second course we had the swordfish and the skirt steak. Our dessert was pineapple upside down cake and the chocolate brioche.(all of this was $33./person) There is a patio right outside the main restaurant area, but it was not being utilized the evening we dined. Hope to be back  soon and try the poolside bar (HH) and the restaurant with the regular menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. pineapple upside down cake with vanilla ice cream
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. chocolate brioche dessert
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Skirt steak entree

LmemSOawFt0N6-WHFaJrGw.text: I've only eaten here once or twice but I always stop in for their cocktails. One of my favorite places downtown.

YQN85xzyB_Y8TOC3KuAChw.text: Two stars.  Because, I really have had better.    A group of my foodie friends and I met up here in order to sort out the deets of our upcoming podcast.  The dude who made our reservation made it for four instead of five, so it took us a little while to get a table.  Not that big of a deal to me, especially since said dude bought a bottle of wine for the group to share.    At long last we were taken to our table.  Our group nestled in to our cozy booth and perused the menu.  I already knew there wasn't much for me to eat there, as I had checked their menu online.  My cohorts ordered some appetizers: tater tots and deviled eggs.  Both dishes looked good, and everyone seemed pleased.  The service began to get a little shotty at this point. It took a while to get waters to the table and there weren't any napkins or silverware at the table until we asked for some (after the appetizers were delivered).  Two of my friends ordered appetizer salads/soups which didn't come until the entrees came.  Salad friend ordered with no walnuts, he is allergic, but it came full o' nuts. Soup friend was presented soup and no spoon.  Soup friend also ordered several items and was told that they were out (which I can understand, given that there was a Suns game that night), when plates were dropped at the table servers were VERY quick to disappear, leaving us to literally have to yell after them for the missing stuff/refills.   As for my meal, I ordered the Citrus Marinated Olives and the Chicory Salad.  I let the server know of my vegan/gluten-freeness and he was helpful and accommodating.  The others seemed divided on their meals.  Lots of meat, that's all I can remember of what they had haha.  Eventually, the manager came to the table to apologize for all of the little mishaps and said a round of drinks was on the house. Fine by me, I thoroughly enjoyed my Tito's gimlet, thank you!  Then the executive Chef came out to apologize as well.  It was a nice touch.  All in all, I might give them a second try, but with all of the great places out there, Blue Hound might want to step up their game.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Citrus marinated olives.
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Deviled eggs.
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tater tots.

-JuG4S-opDmqHquf4PRlgg.text: Wow! Super trendy spot! I didn't know this existed downtown until my friend decided to go for his bday. Love the atmosphere! We sat inside but the outdoor patio (which is on the top of the second floor of the Palomar hotel) looked more inviting, with those little string of lights hung across the patio and some plants out there too. I'll have to sit there next time we have dinner there. I had the homemade pasta which half of our table ordered. It was so flavorful and a great portion that no one had leftovers.  The hostess was super friendly, complimented me right away -which actually seemed genuine! Thumbs up! I noticed on the menu it said happy birthday on it. I'm not sure if it's because we were celebrating a bday or if it's on every menu. The bday celebrant didn't want any dessert unfortunately when they were offering, but the restaurant did all sign a bday card to give to him. Which blew our minds! What a caring staff.   We are definitely coming back for the next birthday dinner- and this time we will order dessert!

yOm-4Hjnivkzv2gdwBRSoQ.text: Hi fives to Kimpton and Hotel Palomar for bringing The Blue Hound to downtown!  I have finally found a spot (without having to drive to Scottsdale)  where I can get a truly wonderful Old Fashioned with a large block ice cube.  The decor is awesome, hip and elegant with beautiful lighting.  They have a very long wooden bar that I haven't been able to move past so I can't really comment on the dining room.   I am not sure why everyone keeps mentioning small portions... I have had several dishes and I didn't think they were small. Quite frankly I think Americans are overfed and used to large portions that could easily feed 3 people from one plate. Either way I ordered the ham steak and eggs and my friend got the KFC Sandwich and they were both HUMONGOUS!  In fact the ham steak  was the size of the entire plate! We both ended up taking half our meal home. I have also tried the flatbreads, the tots, the deviled eggs... All unique, distinct and palate pleasing.   They do a great happy hour and the bartenders are awesome. This is my new favorite spot in Cityscape.

gnWlSEzA8HMY39S1vFXnfw.text: Cocktails only- the service is spot on with a serious craft cocktail list, which is creative and inspired. Had a great evening prior to dinner.  Will return!

ZickDVVo-H9HLF1MIb8daA.text: So we turned up a little early for our 7:30 reservation on Saturday. Like a whole week early. Opps.. Unfortunately, we wouldn't be in Phoenix the following Saturday. And the place was packed, people waiting outside, not looking good.  Enter James the floor manager. He says "let me see what we can do" and goes off. Comes back a couple of times to confer with the hostess and finally comes back one last time with a thumbs up. "Patio table OK" he asks. Well, we just came to Phoenix from 10" of snow and 10 degrees back in Colorado. 72 degrees outside sounds great. And it turns out, the patio is a lot quieter than inside. SCORE!  Next batter up, our server Christopher takes our drink order. Yup, they have Redbreast Irish whiskey. SCORE!  When Christopher returns we decide to try some shishito peppers, deviled eggs, brisket sliders and boudin balls for an app. All were excellent and gone in a hearbeat.  I was looking at the trout for my main but when my wife and sister both ordered it I decided on the pork shank. Not sorry that happened.  When the pork shank arrived, pulled the bones out cleanly and had the tenderest pork shank ever on top of the white beans.  I don't know about the trout, but my wife and sister looked like they were licking their plates when I finally looked up. SCORE!  Normally, I'm not one to overfill myself with dessert, but my wife had to have the chocolate cake something or other so I opted for the vanilla bean pudding with raspberries. Nice, light, tasty and not too filling. SCORE!  So much like the Cubs grand slam homer in their 9-3 victory over the Dodgers, we scored a grand slam thanks to James, Christopher and those guys, whoever they were, in the kitchen.  My advice, make sure you put this place on your list to visit. I know we will again... and maybe even on the right day!

aCEFsfSGZIdnQKA-KsYkNQ.text: Excellent shrimp and grits, great beer selection,  nice ambiance for a small group. Lots of great new competition, but Blue Hound holds its own.

UdnUlJ0Ini55hdKS6heO4w.text: Excellent! 2 of us shared deviled eggs, chopped salad and Shrimp and Grits! Wonderful! And hubby loved the scotch menu and the English Mule was amazing! This place has a great ambiance too! Perfect for downtown Phx visitors!

FM72j3vwhWm6GT7rpXN5Kw.text: Got the ahi quinoa cakes which were to DIE for. The grilled peppers were also amazing. My coconut cream vodka was pretty good too. Really nice waitress. I couldn't order any of the entrees because I'm vegan except with ahi. I'm sure at a place this nice the chef would've made me something special but I hate to be a bug. I got the pasta and it was okay, I don't love tomato but I think anyone else would enjoy it. Would've liked some bread for the table.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Literally one of the top 3 things I&#39;ve ever eaten

oBfIsLjgO7Ijrsc-yiniuQ.text: Lots of style, but very little substance.  Blue Hound is apparently one of the "best new restaurants" in Phoenix. Yikes - our experience here just didn't live up to the considerable hype this place has generated.  Menu: the menu is...interesting. It looks like they took every foodie buzzword they could think of, wrote them on slips of paper and pulled out three or four for each dish. "Hmm...we've got short ribs, and blue cheese aaaannd grits - great!" I mean, what is foie gras cornbread???  Atmosphere: super stylish and well executed. It fits right in with the Palomar - upscale without being overly trendy.  Drinks: BH has an ambitious cocktail list and a decent wine list. I appreciate the inclusion of a decent sparkler by the glass.   Presentation: just like the interior, the dishes here are beautiful. Everything that came out was perfectly plated and looked fresh and delicious.  Service: we had to wait almost 30 minutes past our reservation time, but BH comped us some drinks so that's cool. Our server did a fine job, considering they were very busy.  Food: here's where it falls apart. It doesn't matter if your joint is stylish, your servers are great and your dishes look like works of art unless it tastes good. And for the most part, our party of 6 said "meh". The sole exception was the giant short rib which fell off the bone and was truly exceptional. My flatbread was described as " chorizo, fontina and arugala". What I got was a giant cracker with a dusting of cheese, 3-4 tiny chorizo slices and about 5 arugala leaves. Two others ordered the cod and the reaction was "well, that was...unusual".   Prices: expect to pay a premium for small portions.  I think Blue Hound has tons of potential, but unfortunately our experience here was not up to snuff. I'd pass Blue Hound by for the time being.

-pc6ssOlJtzAtJrEcrhGrg.text: The hours listed are not transparent. I searched for "steak" in the "10pm" timeframe. We arrived, the kitchen closes as 10 & only drinks are available, which is NOT specified on the site.

AaaZ9iILvgTwGZdURud6Vw.text: Came here for Brunch and had a good time.  Service was friendly and quick.  The food was delicious- I had the French toast.  Only drank a mimosa and it was fine.  I liked the atmosphere most!  This is a great place for a girlfriend brunch away from kids.

6MmQPUM2Fi6NEbzFbv7H2w.text: This place provides a generally pleasant evening. The food is Good enough. It has an elaborate mixed drink selection and the server was delightful and well mannered. This place is just kinda what you would expect in this part of town, In this price range , in a hotel. It's nice to not be disappointed.

JqfOCx0Oa0VT6gidUjNUNQ.text: Went her after a Diamondbacks game. Came between lunch and dinner (3-5). They only have a limited bar menu during those times.  Friendly staff and nice setup.  Had the Blue Hound Burger, it was recommended by the waitress, very good. Not listed, but you have the option of having a salad instead of the fries.  Look forward to trying this place out for lunch or dinner (full menu).

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EHktGMgHA4GjPlC460Nctg.text: This used to be my go to restaurant for dinner before an event downtown. I had a reservation last night before the concert and when we arrived the place was chaotic. We were told that the people who had the table in front of us were not leaving and it would be 15 minutes or more to sit down. We asked if we went in the bar would they come find us and we were told no, we'd  have to keep checking back with the hostess stand.   The manager ended up seating us in the bar and service was very disappointing. We wanted to have a glass of wine with dinner but it took so long that the wine arrived after we had finished eating. They said they were out of clean wine glasses. When they finally brought the wine, the  glasses were dripping wet all over - they hadn't bothered to dry them.   And one of the wines was wrong and had to be sent back.  I brought a friend who hadn't been to Blue Hound before and she said she would not go back.  I think I will look for other options in the future.  Pretty bummed about a disappointing start to a big night out.

2M5jAEHOhxjryYauUW-ZyQ.text: All tables had a reserved sign on them. Bar top was full but also fully staffed. Not one bartender made eye contact, we stood there for 10 minutes and not one of the servers would even acknowledge us.  When she did she said no reservations, and the bar was full.  (Duh) we then watched servers take people to the "reserved tables" when asked how they were reserved, we they said no reservations again. We had looked online to find where the best bartenders were in Phoenix. This google placement had to have been paid for.  If you are going to charge 18 dollars for a Manhattan, then you should employ a staff who can at least say hello.  We left thirsty and in search of greatness.  Where we found in a dive bar of all places. The esthetics of the blue hound was super savvy. Think rich velvet chairs and many leather bound books. We loved the hipster uniforms, and butchers aprons on the bearded bartenders. Yet the lack of personality flushed it all down the toilet.    We both bartended for years, our standards are no different then how we would treat guests in our homes, you should share that feedback with your team.

N12emDVO9bMNx9NO1biaHQ.text: great vibe and food, however not sure it is worth the price.. for 3 slivers of tuna and two of watermelon (literally slivers, 1"x4) as an app and a beer $30.. it is AZ, it is frozen fresh.. I get better rates in San Diego

2BWglTY3xKeJSPcmPsPLKQ.text: Blue Hound has been on my list for a while now.  Finally got to get down here and have some food and drinks.    It's on the second level just above Squid Ink.  The place was 70% empty on a Friday night so it really wasn't the best sign.  We were seated by the windows in the back corner and had our own little private booth.  The decor and ambiance is very sleek.  Felt like a really cool place to hang out.    Our waitress was polite and took our drink and app order.  I got a whiskey sour with egg white.  My wife ordered a moscow mule.  We also ordered the corn grit fries and shishito peppers.  The corn grit fries were excellent.  They were really nothing like fries.  They were more like cheese tater tot sticks.  The bacon and cheese in them was very tasty.  The weird part was the sauce that came with them.  It was almost like a marinara sauce.  It really didn't go with the flavor of the cheesy tater tot sticks at all.  The shishito peppers were also excellent.  And the sauce with them was perfect.  I'd order these again in a heartbeat.  The drinks were good but awfully short and not worth 14 bucks a pop.  We split a kale salad as we were going to head to another spot nearby to have some food and drinks and didn't want to blow all our appetite here.  The kale salad was okay for me and my wife loved it.  Overall Blue Hound was good and in a great location with good service but I'm thinking this is more of a place to come during happy hour as it was a bit pricey for just our couple apps and drinks.

3M28hSvkEwby8Zavc3n8FA.text: Food was not good.  Hamburger was not what I expected.  It was expensive too. I knew the restaurant is pricier than other places and I purposely went there expecting great food AND service. However, it wasn't worth it.  Service was below average too. Never got my drink refilled.  I won't return.

QAu0JbJhKng7CZ5njKzCtQ.text: We went to Blue Hound because we had to wait to go to another bar. We enjoyed the drinks and food so much that we decided to stay here instead!   The deviled eggs are delicious. I also really liked the chopped salad which was quite filling. The flatbread is good for sharing with friends. The cheese player could have been bigger, for the price I was a bit disappointed.   I had the French Quarter which uses Woodford Reserve, one of my favorites. The Old Fashioned here rivals The Gladly / Citizen Pubhouse, but is still not quite on part with The Hudson in Sedona in my opinion. My fiancee got La Belle Fleur which is perfect if you like sweet and pretty drinks.   I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French Quarter
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Waldorf salad
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. La Belle Fleur

d-o6ZCstb2HDG_MGqMcOqQ.text: Second floor of Hotel Palomar (Kimpton) was hard to find not knowing that. Super high end cocktails made with a lot of attention to the details. From burning smoke into glasses to old school drinks using egg whites... Cocktails are absolutely first rate.  Interior is posh, cozy, cool. Very comfortable with restaurant, bar, lounge chair seating options. I started with the Hamachi Crudo ($15) which was ridiculous. I pondered ordering a second. Smoke infused caviar - oh my. Entree went with Short Rib and Scallop ($55). Delicious. Wine selections by the glass were somewhat limited (one Chardonnay for instance) but not enough to diminish the experience.  They had about five reds and five whites to choose.   Definitely worth the trip especially if you are downtown. Walking distance from many nearby hotels.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lobby entrance, waiting area.

CjNrOnlVni5VDX93n4K1kA.text: Another great find from my coworker. Located as part of the hotel, this restaurant was amazing from start to finish with exceptional service from our waitress Natalie! Even the menu was cute and had whimsical categories like "Just Like Mama Made" and "Light as a Feather." The Lost Melody was my favorite!  To start we had some amazing cocktails and had appetizers such as the corn grit fries, bacon deviled eggs, and short rib sliders. The corn grit fries were perfectly described as mozzarella sticks meet cornbread. The bacon deviled eggs were absolutely perfect, a different twist to a standard deviled egg. The short rib sliders were the star, tender meat with horseradish on a mini King Hawaiian roll. AMAZING!  Most of our table of 10 ordered the flat iron steak. Cooked perfectly, a little too rare for my medium rare taste, but really good. Fingerling potatoes and crispy frites were a perfect component to the dish. They also have yummy housemade pasta, friend really enjoyed her pappardelle.  The best touch was that with an opentable note saying it was our coworker's bday, they not only brought a great dessert but a card signed by all the staff including the chef! Who does that nowadays? So thoughtful!!! I didn't think I would like the chocolate pudding with marshmallow puff, but it was really good! I ordered the chocolate cake with peanut butter caramel with banana ice cream because it sounded so different and I like that combination, but would have to say the pudding was much tastier!  Overall, such a great dining experience from beginning to end! Will come back if I'm ever in the Phoenix area, as it was the best dining moment I had during my short stay here.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wonderful bday card signed by the staff!
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Special cocktail of the night
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon deviled eggs

SMObKm_ycUPIzNKqytDqxA.text: So glad my friend recommended this place!! From the amazing service I received when my party of 2 became a party of 8 to the actual dinner service, I was impressed. The cocktails were delicious (I ordered the war of the roses). Dinner was also delicious (the pork shank). Tender cut of pork and the fennel sausage tossed in the rice & beans was rich and full of flavor. I will definitely return! Is vday too soon to come back?

La3f49K6zym_d_XRudbjwA.text: Brand new to AZ and tried Blue Hound for the first time tonight.  Vibe inside was very chill and relaxed. 6 of ya sat for dinner and cocktails.  Our server was extremely friendly and patient with us and had great recommendations. Best Shrimp and Grits I've ever had!!!!  Easy to park close by.  I'll definitely be back for more!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Large variety of cocktails!!!
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits with Andouille Sausage...  ate every bite!!!

L8oFfwcgSydiqh7HnW0zRw.text: I love this place.  It's a fun place to go before heading to an event downtown or just a nice spot for dinner. They have great cocktails. The chicken bites are a yummy snack for the bar area.

Lg51Rg74duol7MDKwbdeJQ.text: The place was a bit hard for me to locate especially since I don't know downtown well, I didn't realize it was inside the Palomar hotel. The ambiance of the restaurant is chic and very eye appealing, it's trendy & unique design and furniture make it a definite posh spot for an exquisite ladies night out or afternoon catch up sesh.   We were seated right away by a very personable host & greeted by our server within 2 minutes of being sat.  He started us with some cocktails and appetizers while we perused the menu.   Some definite must try- Fried Green Tomato: sounds a bit strange right, but they were surprisingly good. Up for a new treat, these are for you! Deviled Eggs: bacon jam I don't need to say anything else  Shishito peppers: the furikaki and aioli ... Yum! Seared ahi salad: the bed of lettuce they used was fresh and a refreshing variety when added with a piece of the seared ahi  Cocktails- loved my dirty martini but was shocked when I tried the Lawless. The drink is made with bitters, wild turkey and this awesome smoke type concoction that adds flavor to the glass itself. Honestly, watching it be made was the fun part!   Parts of the restaurant over look a part of city scape which can be beautiful so if ever on a date night be sure to request a window table.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar

cVXpFuaG3loYk_O9CcBVsA.text: I have eaten here 2times. Both were over priced and poor quality. The service was sub par, the food served was underwhelming. How can you fail on a board? Will never go there again.

1pOxfqYghmXnXhz0pyuKmQ.text: This place was fun and the food was good. We went buy late  with a huge group - there were 8 of us. Our server was pleasant and knew how to manage a big group well.  I wasn't very hungry so I just ordered an appetizer: fried tomatoes. They were very tasty and came with crab meat as a garnishment. My friend ordered the salmon. I didn't try it, but she said it was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried Tomatoes
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oh..The deviled eggs were some thing special! Underneath the yoke was a carmilized bacon jam. Super tasty!

zdtOdSRIc-UhUhRU_JdA2Q.text: Love this place. Came here with my husband for a romantic dinner on our mini vacation and were satisfied. Food is good, service is great, atmosphere is cool and relaxing. Highly recommend

ptE-Qgk7Jkrgrndn8kU6mg.text: This is a stellar restaurant in the midst of a sleepy downtown. If you are looking for a memorable meal in downtown Phoenix this is your place. The ambiance is great with gorgeous light fixtures and comfortable seating. They have a large bar for drinks with a good happy hour appetizer menu. At dinner, try the mussels in a garlic/ginger beee broth. The pappardelle sausage Ragu was delicious. Great place!

XcQADE49zXFGMYjhbJGXdQ.text: Great place to grab a drink. Staff members were friendly, decent wine menu and beers. Had a chance to eat their blackened salmon and it was great! Good vibe and music.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

7Xtpv0oUSzcWfao5HHtj-w.text: I am a connoisseur of fries and they have literally the best fries I've ever had in my life. I dream about them. Also everything else on the menu is superb. But I'd die for those fries.

7pCq3nl_P2a6iRVtC-jsnQ.text: This place was ok .  Came in because we were looking for a good cocktail while we were in town.  The cocktail was pretty good.  But the atmosphere was a little off.  The bartender was ok , was quick to make the drink and take our cards.  Didn't want to start a conversation or ask about what were in the mood for .  Which is something simple to do , that I get most of the time when I go to cocktail bars.  Just a simple customer service thing that I appreciate.    Again the drink was good .  But the place just didn't seem to have an identity .  I probably wouldn't go back.

od7Q4c-ZgntJD898JnCcEw.text: I think whenever I come downtown for an event I end up here to close out my night. The atmosphere and overall vibe suits my likings and the appetizers/ drinks come with a bit of flare that stand above your basics eats.  It's located in the Palomar Hotel off the upper deck level so people get a bit confused. If you don't come thru the hotel, escalators are on the side to take u up a level so look for the great big ol doors to the entrance  One particular appetizer is my ultimate favorite here and that's the BHKC deviled eggs... these jokers are so damn good i find myself getting 2 or 3 orders because I'm sharing my 1st order with friends and hogging the last one!!! After our group had the deviled eggs (and a few Moscow Mules in) I headed to the kitchen to inquire on the preparation and serving. The manager and kitchen crew were friendly and I let them know how much it was appreciated.   If your looking for a little low key spot for apps & conversation, head over to the BH   Haven't done dinner here yet so looking forward to trying in the future.

LTUGqBTZ5OzMRK_z2yq28g.text: Amazing restaurant in City Scape on the 2nd floor, the windows show an nice view of downtown. Sit outside is weather allows   Food; ordered the ribeye, may have been the best I tasted in a while. It was perfectly cooked and prepared. The special drinks are also perfect.   Service; Our Server was on point, great customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6VgxJ_vTVDMCjcaX0ASUAA.text: This was my first time back to Blue Hound in about two years. Everything about our visit (a business dinner with a job candidate) was terrific, particularly the service--flawless. I was a tad disappointed with a couple of dishes, though. First, I was really sad to see that the biscuits with bacon jam were not on the starters menu any more. *sob*  Second, we ordered the fried green tomatoes because our job candidate had never eaten them before. I was hesitant, if only because I grew up in the South and am pretty picky about that dish. These were just ok, and honestly, for $16, they were not up to snuff. The tomato slices were tiny--about the size of a silver dollar--and would have been pretty forgettable if not for the lump crab and remoulade accompanying them.  The shishito peppers, however, were outstanding and at $9, a fair price.  We also had the bone marrow starter (also $16), which is utterly delicious but not really the right size for three people to share.  Two people, sure, and I'll order them again.  For our mains, we had two orders of the trout and the flat-iron steak.  All were cooked perfectly and plated very nicely. My steak was medium-rare, as requested, and the cherries in the glaze accompanying it really made the dish (one of my dinner partners kept asking me for another)!  We finished by sharing a slice of the pineapple upside down cake. I loved it. Moist, not too sweet, light rather than dense. The sorbet served with it, however, really couldn't hold its own. Its flavor wasn't distinctive enough and something with a more significant mouth-feel would be a better foil for the cake.   The total for our dinner, not including alcohol or tip, was $145. That's steep for three people, but if you're looking for a place to go for a special occasion, Blue Hound Kitchen should be an option.

4F2PqNY0cspTfxncrAz-zA.text: I went to Blue Hound on a whim and had a good time.  Service was great, and the alcohol choices were excellent.  I sat at the bar like I normally do and enjoyed talking to the bar tender about the different whiskey options.    I didn't eat anything, but the food looked good (although small portions) and a bit on the pricey side.  Either way, if you're in the mood for a quick drink, Blue Hound is a great place to stop.

oZMmqUezWkRlZaYE6gEUug.text: Service was good, ambiance is business casual, and the food was very good.  The burger was juicy and had great flavor.  We did not order any appetizers but they looked good so will have to go back and try some more.  A bit pricey for lunch but we felt that it was justified.  Will be back for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burger with a house salad.

_ZXky6LWse3RBKiBPSzJCg.text: Located in The Palomar Hotel, The Blue Hound Kitchen & Cocktails is such a great place with a fabulous vibe and energy. The drinks are always on point and the apps are amazing! I have been here a few times and the happy hour is great.. BUT, get there early, as its tight! They do take reservations for dinner and I highly recommend since it's downtown and rather popular.   My app loves: The Deviled Eggs..Bacon and Jam.. YES.Please. The Charcuterie Board...always different! Fried Green Tomatoes with Lump Crab  SOOO tasty! Shishito Peppers   Great wine list and great mixology here.. sit at the bar and watch the masters mix the libations! This is just an all around great place for dinner; drinks; date night; whatever! Oh.. and I love the Blue Hound dog!

y89caAMd53jALvp-H1ZKdw.text: Still sitting here waiting for the one drink that I ordered 20 min ago, the time is now 2:30 pm May 25 with approximately 6 people in the restaurant and I'm being ignored. Lol this bartender with the mo-hawk clearly doesn't want to be here. It shows in his presence and the service, smh such high hopes for this place. Can't imagine how it is in here if it gets busy.

geVrEn2w7ChK0q2E44z3qg.text: Inside a hotel. Validated parking. Perfect for a good selection of tasty food. We had a great server.

Pz9pPAy4u7vXO-QGB1Yr0A.text: The food was fantastic.   The setting was excellent but the service was slow coming with the food.  It was well worth the wait though.  Would highly recommend!

JoW4yoMXQFWViasw7sjHPw.text: Very cool place and a cool hotel. Food and service were really good. One of the best flatbread appetizer is I've ever had and the shrimp and grits were fantastic. Also the salad was delicious.The chocolate bar dessert was awesome.

Ba8hzGv48dMnePOLPE7jwA.text: This place is crazy good, the cocktails and menu never fail to impress. The vibe can change from visit to visit based on tourism but the service, cocktails and menu are consistently awesome. I am premeditating my next visit as I type ;p

1vzl8191w3RjpUwgAjDXSw.text: This spot is located inside the Palomar. It's kind of hard to find if you are going straight off of GPS. But the hotel folks were very helpful once I stumbled upon it. Take the elevator up and sit at the bar if you are solo. The eats here are a tad pricey, wine list was perfect. This is great to stop in for a quick beverage. They also have some light bites if that is your thing. I think this would be a perfect place to bring out of town clients or anything business related. The atmosphere is beautiful and modern. I very much enjoyed my crisp Spanish white vino. Aside from that, they have some good looking salads. I will have to eat next time.

YOeb0VEkmgW62lPLnu-AGw.text: Excellent ambiance!   Drinks and food are spectacular! I recommend the Pimm's Mule and the Seared Ahi Tuna salad!!  They will not disappoint!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TUP4mRF_ullEWD-ZlSDVFg.text: We got into town really late after a long cross-country flight so this place hit the spot. I enjoyed my old fashioned and the brisket sliders and corn grit fries were excellent as well. The kitchen closed earlier than you'd think (I can't remember the exact time) so we apparently just made the cut on a Thursday night. It's pricey but much better than your average hotel bar so it's worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Old Fashioned
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brisket Sliders
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Corn Grit Fries

GTHF4iJiJjrdCw5ac0E9Jw.text: 3 stars for a clean restaurant.  No stars for the hostess to thought my book in a bag was me bringing food into the restaurant even after I told her I was meeting my family for lunch.  Slow service and out of decoy Chardonnay. Smokey salmon dip is the best part of this blue stop.

SrXb5UYX7gl2y2xP7RZSow.text: Overall great experience. I came here on a work trip and all my colleagues enjoyed it.   The fried catfish was excellent. My family is southern so I'm very picky when it comes to southern dishes & they hit the nail on the head.   The martini was pretty good as well. I asked our server for something a little sweet but strong & that's exactly what it was. The majority of their signature drinks have bourbon in them so if that's what you like, you have plenty choices.   The atmosphere is very nice & the view is pretty at night. The service was great & our server was very knowledgeable of the menu.   Only reason I gave it 4 stars is it is pricey. Although my entree was great, it was not worth $25.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Martini
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fried catfish

BNVZ28_XNTYRFZrDpuQvfw.text: I absolutely enjoyed my dining experience at Blue Hound. My hubby made reservations for six to celebrate my bday and it was fantastic - from the service, the atmosphere, the drinks and the food!   My recommendations are pretty much everything I ordered:  Shishito peppers Corn grit fries Deviled eggs Shrimp and Grits Drink: The Melody  I also received a complimentary dessert for my birthday, which is always nice! Everyone in my party loved the restaurant and food as well. I definitely recommend trying this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My birthday cake!
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp and Grits

rBSK1xmGfTuFgYTfYVk5qw.text: Went for dinner with my lawyer and it was absolutely delicious. The shishito peppers were amazing they just melted in your mouth. Oh and the view was so beautiful. We had the chocolate cake for dessert and it was so savory and sweet could not complain would go back any time and the staff was friendly and courteous.

lhbuBl4THXvDrCsRuxAe2Q.text: Great ambiance and selection of southern favorites. I had the fried green tomatoes with lump crab and boulibon appetizers. Delicious.

lfNQSt3_d_VsGmhTnm5t-w.text: Who doesn't love a gastropub downtown.  The craft drinks are great.  Love the way the drink menu lists the type - shaken, stirred.  Bourbon on tap?  Now you are talking my language.   Bottomless caramel popcorn?  This place is crazy.  The bar is small and a touch crowded.  There is seating in the lobby but it's a little hit and miss with a variety of chairs ranging from big leather to hard cube.  The dining area isn't very big but it has a cool view - if you are into urban views.    The food is nicely portioned.  The short ribs are some of the biggest I've seen.  The pineapple upside down cake is great with the salted caramel topping.

6kDDkD5SLQEtLAolUT-WVw.text: Really enjoyed this place!   Lets start with the decor and ambiance. Well above average. Very swanky retro feel but cozy with plenty of wood details and great energy throughout the space. Awesome hip, urban eatery. More than you'd expect from a restaurant within a hotel in downtown Phoenix. I'd come back just for the restaurant even if I wasn't staying at the hotel.   Started off with the yellow corn cake app with onion jam and shaved squash=fantastic! We then shared the 'Big Ass Steak' with scallop potatoes. Equally fantastic. An enormous T-bone cooked just right:) at least 2" thick!  Had two Mezcal cocktails with my dinner.  Good, strong drinks with old fashioned big ass ice cubes. Awesome looking and tasty drink if you like Mezcal.   Great joint. Wouldn't hesitate to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Hound!

ag77lp1uWT7m0gH5sUqagQ.text: We stopped in for a birthday dinner. Carolina was an amazing server and was very knowledgeable, really awesome experience

1Fybs4EzXNSwaEQBxczEZQ.text: Great little spot for cocktails and small plates!  I didn't stay for dinner, but next time I will definitely give this place a try.  The menu looks great, and I suspect they are accommodating when it comes to dietary needs.

Vh0er68kRHkA_2cJwcEcsA.text: What a excellent find for dinner with co workers! Close to convention center (walkable) with vast menu. All appetizers are delicious favorites include: fried green tomatoes, short rib sliders, burrata, BHKC Deviled Eggs and Artisan Cheese Selection! Don't miss the Crispy Mozzarella Salad and Swordfish Entree.   Save room for desserts and yes I do mean all of them! Had one of each and couldn't pick a favorite!   This place is a True gem - great atmosphere (slightly noisy at times), however, gastro pub feel and excellent food will have me returning next visit to Phoenix!

vpD_ZXG5PZSo4DtcZUSWlg.text: I will start off by saying that it is beautiful inside. Loved the decor. Other than that, the staff was friendly for the most part. Too bad you can't control the customers though. Rude, arrogant, snotty, obnoxious, loud, and annoying but my 3 star review was really based on the food. We ordered the fried green tomatoes. Now this is really not a hard dish to put together. They add their own flare to it with crab meat. The presentation was nice BUT, the tomatoes were hard and the crab meat was cold, which seemed odd. Too me, it seems undercooked and maybe the crab meat should have been warmed up. We also tried the boudin balls were just ok as well. They were just warm, not hot. The marina served with it was kinda bland. Just expected more flavor. I "might" try this place again but it's towards the bottom of the list.

C71oQocLA-R2C4V32_pkpA.text: If your are looking for a hipster spot with good drinks and you've got money to blow this is your place. I order the lawless drink  slider  and my friend got a Salad.  Our bill was 50 bucks. Food was fair but not that good.

HN1fK2W-eVliaSGcGcdJtQ.text: Came in here for a quick drink and it was pretty good. It was a nice lounge feel with plenty of seating around for everyone. Bartenders were nice and the drinks were decent.

-Um6J_e4sLHLSJV5s0I6dg.text: Blue Hound has an eclectic, creative menu full of diverse choices - so good for dates, business meals, etc. - something for everyone.   We had a large group so got to try a large array of appetizers and dishes (sharing is caring) and everything was superb.  For starters we had the following: Corn Grit Fries Smoked bacon, white cheddar, pomodoro (so good); Short Rib Sliders Root beer onions, horseradish cream, king's hawaiian roll; Boudin Balls Tomato jam, green onions (really good); Artisan Meat and Cheese Board Fruit, nuts, crackers.  For my main dish I had the Pappardelle Schreiner's sausage ragu - rich and tasty but not too rich - perfect.  For desserts, I had the house made sorbets - all really tasty.  Good wine and cocktail selection too.  Nice decor - lots of wood, natural light and cozy feel for a large restaurant at night. Gets a little loud, but not unbearable. Service was good - not outstanding, but perfectly fine (think we may have had a relatively new waitress).  Would definitely consider going back if in Phoenix.

Fxt5KuzUcsMLMIFEB2VIKw.text: Great place if money isn't an issue. You get what you pay for and it's pricey. A nice place for dinner downtown and a great atmosphere. Plenty of seats for large groups and it's connected to the hotel. Parking isn't easy, but it's worth it.

dmAr-9Y_4FDuefw8xzYQsw.text: Came in for Happy Hour drinks and dinner after work.  Husband and I both ordered the Bourbon Smash ($6 HH) (a take on a whiskey sour), both came out very sour.  My friend's margarita also came out sour.  We think they were training a new bartender.  The drinks were easily fixes with a splash of syrup.  Orders the sliders and wings ($6 HH).  The short rib sliders were fantastic!  I was not expecting such a huge portion of short rib (my favorite).  Seriously, add a few more sliders and some fries and you would have the perfect bar food happy hour meal!  I feel guilty not ordering some of fancy food for dinner, the shrimp and grits sounded divine, but I was craving a burger all week.  Their bar burger with pimento cheese, and bacon hit the spot in all the right ways :-) ($14) and the fries were topped with sea salt and cheese.  Blue Hound pays attention to detail.  Husband ordered the Manhattan ($6HH)...BOY WAS IT GOOD AND I DON'T USUALLY LIKE MANHATTANS!).  To top it off, I ordered the local AZ  Dos Cabezas Rose wine ( great recommendation from our waiter and a steal at $5 HH).  I recommend Blue Hound over its more uppity sister upstairs (Lustre) and will add it to our favorite cityscape places.

OaioVPdRp6EEHJpDP_4iFA.text: Love this lunch spot! Today I ordered the chop salad which is awesome. Probably only second to Cowboy Chow in Scottsdale. You never have to wait at lunch for a table and the service is incredible. After work hours - the drinks are good but the service does slow down a little - likely because they are more busy at night than during the day. All and all, great restaurant.

HutQpcnpu1m0pcvMhkSkGg.text: Came for "happy hour" around 5:30 today. Bar is super small and half of it is technically already Reserved. Had to grab our drinks and sit on a couch. Can't complain much though because luckily we got a spot by the fire. The atmosphere is hip and trendy, albeit it seems a little stuffy and exclusive.  If you want a spot at the bar, May the Odds be Ever in your Favor, otherwise good luck in the lounge! If you get a couch stay and enjoy!!!

n0LkvGL2BocxhdQlUjRWQA.text: Excellent service, drinks and food overall!!  Ribs were way too salty, but the staff took good care of me and recommended 2 other apps which were awesome!!

WxAvRUerWsvLQqoYklnuzw.text: What a great addition to downtown! We came for dinner before an event at the Orpheum, and we're able to walk over after. I had the turkey burger with a lemon aoli amd my husband had the fish amd chips. Both of us loved our food. After the concert we even ce back for dessert! Apple crumble with vanilla gelato! So good. The service was great, too! If you want a quiet place to eat, this isn't the place for you. But, if you want a fun pub atmosphere with fantastic food, this is the place.

6K2a5b2FvV07U-_s_S3Azw.text: Food was decent but the service was terrible. Had my water glass filled once. Just really slow service overall. I won't be coming back. Cocktails were good but pricey, but I knew that going in.

bbthc5ev9TOjZtZ8N4UiMw.text: Nicholette was such a great waitress. Very friendly and helpful when needing helping choosing an entree. Will definitely be back

RdHzG0rUcLcLQ-bWcIyN4w.text: I was eating solo here and they were very rude. I clearly asked for a table, the offered me to sit at the bar, I mentioned I want to get a table, then they offered me to sit at the lounge (which had only coffee table). Only when I said I will leave if they don't have a table, they offered me the table. They had plenty of empty tables. The food is OK but not the best.

3YBHoAlj5e5Yxtvt-uIPXw.text: An update.  We went back to Blue Hound for dinner instead of just getting appetizers.  When we went it was in September (yes I'm behind in my reviews).  As I'm writing this review, I went to re-check the menu to remember the specific name of the dish I got, and the whole menu has changed.  So take that in mind, maybe the food will be better if you go now, vs. the menu selection we had in September.   From what I remember, I was just generally unimpressed with what options we had to choose from and the food wasn't amazing.  That is why I decreased my rating.  The experience just made us cross this off the list of "great places to eat" in phx.  I don't think we'll be doing a whole trip down here for the food.    I am curious to see if the new menu would be more promising though....

QMTRtu76twTFf6hSrb0SMQ.text: We went to the Blue Hound for a work happy hour birthday celebration.  To start, our server, also a bartender, when asked for a Manhattan with sweet vermouth, said quite sarcastically "as opposed to..."  I explained that I have had bartenders in the past make me a Manhattan with dry vermouth and I did not want that experience again.  To which he replied "That is a Brooklyn" and walked away.  OK giving him the benefit of the doubt, our drinks came and my Manhattan was very nice (everyone else drank wine and beer, so you can't really screw that up).  We ordered round two and those arrived and then decided to order some food.  And it's as if our server vanished.  Only he didn't.  He just stopped coming to our table and waited only on those around us.  Finally I went to the bar to try and get help and a bartender found a server to come to our table...while his colleague continued to avoid our table.  The food was so so (macaroni and cheese, sliders and wings).  The young lady who took over service duty was great.  But the die was cast.  This was a bad experience and I will not be going back.

2cl5GmX8VpTzq8Dm7Fkazg.text: Went here last night expecting to love it. I got there around 9 and it was very crowded and lively. Whoever designed the bar/lounge area did a great job as it creates a killer atmosphere. I had one drink and left- was unimpressed with the drink and thought it wasn't worth the $11 and 10 minutes I had to wait to order and receive it.   Might try Blue Hound again in the future, just not on a Friday night and not whatever gin cocktail I had last night.

yF2YqTGBOVwMW9JhF9-Vkw.text: Wow. Really good upscale food, but unpretentious. Wait staff is very knowledgeable & helpful with recommendations (Gemma!) She recommended the delicious Uncle Bear Mandarin Wheat - a new favorite for sure! I had the Brussels sprouts (bacon jam glaze & a fried egg on top) and fried green tomatoes (spicy roumelade & lump crab.) Chocolate cake with banana ice cream & PB sauce. To die for. And my bill was barely $40. If you're in PHX, eat here!

tRll3Npu6AVz7AePq-VPMg.text: I love the ambiance of the place but the food was all very dissapointing. I brought my friend here for there birthday last week just before Thanksgiving. I'm not sure if the staff mentally checked out or the food is always so sloppily thrown together. For the prices this place charges I expect the best quality food prepared correctly. My scallops were overcooked and tasted like they had been frozen, unfrozen and sitting in a bag of water all day. The pork belly was tough and grissley. The hangar steak was burnt and had almost no meat on it, just char. The one thing that did come out good was the tator tots.   Overall a dissapointment, do not come here, there are many better options especially for this price range!

LG6-SQnPVi69qzpiTOSrig.text: Ah.May.ZING!  Blue Hound definitely blew my taste buds out of the water last night. From the pork belly sliders, to the seafood chowder I ordered to go, and certainly not last the decedent pineapple upside down cake, I was in foodie heaven.   The sliders were topped with a crisp kimchi that paired marvelously with the tender pork belly. There were two somewhat smallish portions. I ate one and set the other aside to finish later that night. Because the principle reason I chose BH was the dessert, I asked for my second course to be boxed. I sampled the chowda at home later in the evening and it was wicked good: the ghost chile, which on the scoville scale it 10 degrees from being an A-bomb in your mouth (and, presumably, another fire a bit lower) brought an amazing heat balance with the subtle bacon and prominent mussels and clams. I'm not sure how this is served in the restaurant, but for the to-go you get a box of the clams and mussels. On to dessert. Simply wonderful! The salted caramel sauce is something I'd love to have a bottle of at home. It's decadent to the nth degree. It's the one sweet treat that I would give up sex for. It's *that* good.  At $40, this was an incredible value. Honestly, I think two people could easily share this meal and be pleasantly sated.  Who's my Daddy? You are, Blue Hound.

LU7O_b52jW4I6COfLAhnqg.text: While in Phoenix for a conference in October, a group of us came here for dinner with reservations. We were accommodated with two rows of tables for about 20-30 people. The servers attended to us rather well. Great service so far.  When it came time to order, I asked for the Seafood Chowda. A few of my colleagues ordered the shortribs. When my food came, I was disappointed that the "chowda" barely had any broth in it. Probably two tablespoons worth. It had a good amount of mussels and a couple of clams. There were a few thin slices of tiny potatoes and that was it. Being a fan of hot and spicy foods I was expecting a little kick from the ghost chile. To my disappointment, all I tasted was salt. The food was very salty and not a trace of spice. I even asked the waiter when I ordered how spicy is it and was told that it had a good kick. I gave a mussel to someone to try and he agreed to the saltiness and no spice. When the server came around again, I asked if this is how it was supposed to be prepared and he said yes. I pointed out the lack of any broth, creamy or otherwise and he just shrugged his shoulders.   Other people in my party were disappointed as well. The short ribs did not even have a hint of blue cheese. And this was coming from a person who loves cheese and is also a chef.  Sadly, many of us walked out at the end of our dinner very disappointed. We found this place to be over-priced and over-hyped. We concluded that there was little effort to please us due to the large size of the group which guaranteed their gratuity.   It's sad that the only thing some of us enjoyed was the popcorn. My advice: review the menu carefully and ask a lot of questions. I most likely will not come back here the next time I'm in Phoenix.

tLtSAHDluyJxSbF5WXULrQ.text: Visited here for dinner with a friend on a Friday evening in October and had a really nice time. We decided to sit at the bar because it is a nice, vintage style bar with a modern twist and has a view of the courtyard in this complex downtown.   Good drinks and well prepared, fresh, food with unique twists would describe this place best.  The drinks were stiff and tasty. There are many gin and bourbon based cocktails. The atmosphere is trendy with large open windows and high ceilings. The caesar brussels sprout salad was really tasty and fresh as were the fish tacos which had mango and a good amount of spice. The tater tots were also great and unique; almost like a stuffed potato. The menu is trendy and has tapas-style offerings, yet it's unique, and all of the food was very flavorful. I will definitely return.

NqodqOm9VRZSDun4RViwzw.text: Wow! Another great spot to go in downtown Phoenix. Cocktails were spot on and unique. Our waitress Natalie was superb. Our dinner of the fresh pasta was perfect. Atmosphere was classy and casual all at the same time. We will definitely visit again when we are in downtown Phoenix.

Yy3AtnwwqQNwWZ37uVRtrg.text: I came here with a friend last night because the reviews made it seem like the food was great and really friendly service. We were greeted by the hostess and taken to a table near the patio door, but behind some pillar. It was actually nice little seat, secluded from the other patrons with great window views. Unfortunately, when our server came over she neglected to tell us her name, offer any specials, and she barely made eye contact with either myself or my friend. We both ordered drinks (one house special and one whiskey and 7 with lime.) When the server returned with the beverages, she forgot my limes. It not being a big deal, I simply asked for them. She brought them over wadded up in a napkin and they were extremely dry, hardly any juice. Regardless, we ordered the sliders for an appetizer and they were delicious! Truly, some of the best we've ever had. The server came back to take our order, but neglected to offer an refills- of the drinks or the water. Our food came and we waived her down to get a refill of drinks, again no limes. This server *never* asked us how the food was or if she could get us anything else. One would think that charging $12 a drink the servers would be a little friendlier and quicker with service. After waiting nearly three minutes to even find our server, I simply flagged another server down (Simone) to ask for limes. This girl was amazing! Super friendly smile, was on it so quickly, speared the limes with a fancy pick, placed them in a bowl and delivered them to my table- and they were fresh! I wish she was our server, we probably would have had a much better experience. Sadly, at the end of the meal, I had to ask for the tab, because it wasn't offered, and inquired our servers name (Nicolette) simply so I could write this review. There was no charismatic charm, no attention to the guests, no inquiry on how things were going, no offering of specials - drinks or other wise, absurd wait time to receive drinks and garnishments, and absolutely zero interaction with her guests.   We MAY be back, but to go back for sliders and poor customer service is iffy. The pasta dishes we had were not out of this world, but decent. We would just prefer to go somewhere where the servers actually look like they enjoy their job and interact with patrons. If Simone was our server, we probably would have given her a 100% tip because of how fabulous she was, but Nicolette, it may be time for you to change jobs.

HpKkooV2ubXH_CNa340hww.text: Happy Hour SCAM. The food is not why I am poorly rating blue hound. I came in Friday night prior to a concert. I and my friend sat at the bar and the place of course was packed. We specifically asked about happy hour and were handed the happy hour menu as was several other patrons. The happy hour menu simply had the hours (no day restrictions) and items with prices. We specifically ordered 2 glasses of wine, 2 beers and 2 apps all on the happy hour menu. We got the bill and was charged full price. When we asked about it, is when we got the shocking answers! We told the waitress and it was her that even gave us the menu and she said... Oh well that was given out wrong. We said well several other people have it and it's before 6 and there are no day requirements. Then a male bartender literally grabs the menu out of hands and says.... It's not today and walked away. We asked for a manager and were told they are so busy it could be awhile and they charged our receipt on tab and handed us a copy. I advised them it's against the law for them not to honor it and even if it were not, it's in poor ethical taste not to. She stared at me and walked away!!!!!   Well played Blue Hound. Even better staff :/

MUZIFtYneLvEYMUXBjnoOg.text: Incredible Dinner and Wine menu!!  My wife and I went here with family and all enjoyed the dinner as well as the ambiance.  The staff were friendly and polite and knew exactly when to approach the table to avoid interrupting conversations.  Food preparation time was reasonable and the dessert was amazing!  Would recommend to family and friends.  Blue Hound and Kitchen is also an ideal location in downtown phoenix if you are taking in any one of the live events that are all close by and in walking distance.

9_dBkqdiRwyH2w7LEp0A-Q.text: We were invited to an event here. It had a fix menu available. The food itself was ok. Our water was regularly filled up by the nice waiters. They took our order of the entree and desert. There were two long tables outside and when they started serving the salads, which did have enough dressing, they seemed to be too slow and I got my salad by the time my neighbor was already done with his. All entrees looked pretty good and also tasted good. I had the herb chicken, was a bit too dry, and my husband had the steak. I m glad it was all served outside since it appeared to be very noisy inside. Will I come back? Most likely not.

photos.caption: Photo of Blue Hound - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vq5a6aPk7aQMbiDZtKndUA.text: I had a morning meeting downtown and a colleague and I needed a place to strategize over breakfast.  He suggested this place.    After a quick look at the menu, I decided on a Buckwheat Belgian Waffle w/Vermont Maple Syrup, $12.  To wash it down, I ordered a Coffee and Water.  The server brought out a mini-pot of Coffee so that we could refill our cups at our leisure...bonus, I like when a restaurant offers that.  After a short wait our food was served.  I poured a little Syrup on my Waffle and took a bite....it was a little disappointing.  The texture was good and it was cooked just right...however, the flavor fell flat for me.  It tasted too "grainy"....not in the rough texture sense, but in the bitter, wild grains sense.  It wasn't what I expected....even the Syrup couldn't save it.  I only ate 1/2 of the Waffle.  Looking back on it, I'd like to try it with an IPA....it might go well with a bitter Beer like that and I love IPA's.  That would be weird though, ordering a Waffle at breakfast and a tall glass of IPA...ha!  Our server was great and the place is very well kept.  If I come back, I'll be sure to try something that I'm more familiar with.  Return Factor 50%

DlrznSbkm29TPOB1uuz3eA.text: Blue Hound located in the Palomar hotel just below Lustre is a great place for a romantic evening. The location shares the second floor lobby of the hotel and has a unique ambiance that seamlessly blends semi casual and white table cloth.   This visit was a returning trip. I had written a comment on here and was contacted by the managing owner of the company. They had reached out to us with great customer service and invited us back. I asked them if they could offer us a romantic dinner for two on the house. The owner happily responded well provide the dinner but you have to bring the romance!   They treated us to a great meal. Me and my partner had the chance to try out a wide selection of the menu and it was an overall fun and enjoyable experience. I would happily come back here.   This location does have free wifi, so its not only great for dates but great for casual after work drinks or even just lounging around.

J9PUMeBix1QPAu53he6nNA.text: Took my boyfriend here for a going away dinner as he was leaving for vacation the same weekend, and I wanted to wow his pants off with somewhere we have not tried yet that would have different and fun ingredients. Parking was a bit of a hassle, but we ended up parking in the same garage as the restaurant so it worked out to our advantage that the other lot was full.  Service was great, waiter was very polite, prompt and gave great suggestions.  The food was amazing! We had the Deviled Eggs, Tater Tots, and Risotto balls for apps. The smaller portion was perfect to taste, and not leave us too full. I ordered the scallops and he ordered the rib-eye. The rub on the rib-eye was amazing, and the scallops melted in your mouth.   I will defiantly be back here with him to try other menu items! I made reservations at 9 on a Saturday, and there was barely anyone in the dining area so I don't feel the need to do that again.

kRGPkAT3tjkaWzC3MjYP_w.text: lovely lunch spot for a meeting right in the hotel.  loved my choice of the tacos but there are other just as good.  Atmosphere good and the wait staff is fabulous!  Don't ask for sweet tea, just saying if you are from Georgia.

4i6nqgiPfigLNiOKsASzMw.text: The Green Fried Tomatoes with crab and a remoulade was pleasant. It was gratis as we were looking for the dinner items that we saw on "Check Please". It could be a meal for a light eater. I also had the crab cake with a salad. The salad with the champaign vinaigrette was very nice, too.The fries that go with the burger were made from a whole potato and were tasty. We also had, as gratis for coming down after seeing the Blue Hound on "Check Please" , the corn grit fries weren't to my liking even though they came with a dipping tomato sauce. I have to add that I don't like grits! I will be back at Christmas time with a friend for dinner to see the lights and skating pond outside!I

rrb-fmKMFBms9du-Zp_fyw.text: Awesome happy hour, very well crafted drinks, love the old fashion and Juan is my favorite bar tender!! pork belly sliders are delish as are the shishito peppers. :) great atmosphere.

YHzsvdHPMQkrdTgccBb5Dg.text: Incredible cocktails and great happy hour! Staff was super warm and friendly. Deviled eggs, peppers and flatbread were all great.   You can alway tell what kind of cocktails you are gonna get by the type of ice they use. A big block in my old fashioned set the stage for great drinks! Will be back for sure.
